71843: In the wake of a large-scale disaster that literally shatters the moon, plants — not humans — become the world’s most intelligent life forms, until a young boy discovers a mysterious girl who’s been in a state of suspended animation for 300 years.

The Romance of Astrea and Celadon

22853: Justin still sucks his thumb at 17. He wants to stop and knows that his thumbsucking is disrupting his family, his love life and his identity.

21624: Set in an insane asylum populated by the likes of a French artist, a former jazz musician and an Episcopal priest.

23675: Three Bewildered People in the Night

87358: Three college students chose a class project on Gossip and how fast it spreads, which spirals out of control.

26995: An English working class girl wants to better herself by studying literature. Her assigned Open University professor is a man who prefers the company of Jack Daniels to Jack London. Starring Michael Caine and Julie Walters, who reprises her role from the stage production.

20802: From peyote to prozac, a sensitive portrait of five former hippies now approaching middle age.

22937: Rise and Fall of actor Ferdinand Marian who takes the chance and stars in the anti-semitic movie “Jud Süß”.

20966: A Swedish whaler is out for revenge when he finds out that a greedy oil man murdered his father for their land.

127269: Jazz legend Miles Davis attempts his comeback in the 1980s, as he reflects on his relationship with his first wife, Frances Taylor.

25686: When an uptight young man and his fiancee move into his libertine mother’s house, the resulting clash of life attitudes shakes everyone up.

126033: Yasmine, Roxi and Ana run away to the seaside two days before their finals to have the time of their lives.

24770: The “stupid” film director, Takeshi Kitano (Beat Takeshi) is unusually troubled about his next film.  So far, all his representative works were gangster films, but of all things, he declared never to make violent films again.

26721: A splinter group of Roman soldiers fight for their lives behind enemy lines after their legion is decimated in a devastating guerrilla attack.

25956: A man allows a bum into his home and chaos ensues.

24614: A chain of short stories about the distance between Takaki and Akari.

22783: In the aftermath of World War II, a former Czech soldier takes charge of a manor formerly owned by a German family.

27863: This is the second major animated piece following the big hit “A Thousand and One Night Stories” in Japan. The distributor treated the film as an erotic animated work for adults, advertising it as a piece “far more erotic than a thousand and one might stories.”

25832: Paul Newman directed this moving adaptation of Tennessee Williams’ classic play The Glass Menagerie.

21588: Ten of Muhammad Ali’s former rivals pay tribute to the three-time world heavyweight champion.

31052: Plain Crocodile and beauty Cow liked the same – they loved flowers and leaves. And consequently they fell in love with each other. But in autumn flowers fades, leaves fell down, and Crocodile who wants to keep his beloved, himself turned into an evergreen leaf

30208: The Buckman family is a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.

2516: Tempers fray and true selves are revealed when a heterosexual is accidentally invited to a homosexual party.

90787: After his schoolmate and master is killed and he loses an arm, student Tien Lung has to learn the art of one-arm boxing.

73425: After his girlfriend two-times him with his best buddy, a 22-year-old schizophrenic decides to off himself — but before committing suicide, he devises an intricate scheme designed to drive the two lovers to the depths of insanity.

34106: I took a photograph of the view out of the window and had a very large negative made from it, which I fastened to the lens hood attachement in front of the camera. I tried to bring the negative into alignment with the real landscape.

39: A voyage through contemporary Beijing in the taxi of the philandering Dezi.  His aimless wanderings between destinations and women are much like Beijing’s own search for identity between disappearing ancient values and an uncertain future.

70582: Andy Lau and Rene Liu play a pair of world-class grifters who come to a career crossroads after swindling a businessman out of his BMW and heading to the countryside to plan their next move in this Hong Kong action flick.

16220: Writer/director Bill Forsyth’s follow-up to his best film, Local Hero, is another comic exploration of a man undergoing a personal crisis.

108386: Following a failed operation, chief detective Carl Mørck is assigned to Department Q, a department for old, terminated cases…

90933: When a prince dies from a freak water heater accident, his nephew plans to sell his palace to real estate speculators. However, the ghosts that inhabit the palace plot to prevent the sale from happening.

33757: An FBI agent takes on a plane full of deadly and poisonous snakes, deliberately released to kill a witness being flown from Honolulu to Los Angeles to testify against a mob boss.

109958: The adventures of Amadeo, a shy but smart boy, and a table football team who try to get back together after they are broken up. Together they will have to confront the most fearsome of rivals on a pitch.

88538: A short black-and-white silent documentary film featuring a young boy boxing with a kangaroo, which was considered lost until footage from an 1896 Fairground Programme was identified as being from this film.

37691: A close-up of Allen Ginsberg reciting his “skeletons” poem is bluescreened and dissolved against archival film and video clips, and backed by musicians to create a sort of song that becomes an American anthem.

33633: To inherit his mother-in-law’s colossal fortune, a hard living, gambling addict must change his unhealthy ways before it gets the best of him.

2242: This unabashed propaganda film (also known by the title Tell Your Children, a dead giveaway) has become a cult classic of comically bad cinema due to its dated, alarmist views on the dangers of “marijuana addiction” and the exaggerated symptoms thereof.

32469: Ruttmann’s “Opus 1” is considered the first fully abstract cinematic work.

3018: Filmmakers Derick and Steven Martini deliver this period drama following two families whose lives are profoundly affected by complex relationships, real estate woes, and Lyme disease. Set on Long Island in the late ’70s.

30844: Giordano (Antonio Albanese) gets the chance to relive his adolescent infatuation with his sister-in-law Lilliana (Opera singer Katia Ricciarelli) when she returns to the family estate in the South as a war-widow…

11471: Mark Dixon (Dana Andrews) don’t take no guff. Get in his face, cross him, and things happen, bad things. Trouble is he’s a cop, a tough cop who’s lost his balance. He’s got no room for ambiguity. It’s either right or wrong. Then he crosses the line: rousting a suspect…

1049: Bruno Bonomo was a famous producer of B-movies in the ‘70s. After a long hiatus, Bonomo offers a screenplay to RAI centered on the figure of Italy’s prime minister and media tycoon Silvio Berlusconi, a subject so controversial that even the public television broadcaster refuses to produce it.

6384: A letter is addressed to three wives from their “best friend” Addie Ross, announcing that she is running away with one of their husbands—but she doesn’t say which one.

53162: Matt Lee Whitlock, chief of police in the small town of Banyan Key, Fla., is respected by his peers and loved by his community. But when Banyan Key is shocked by a double homicide, everything Whitlock thought he knew starts to unravel.

6028: In this Capra-esque drama set during the 1950’s blacklist, a young, ambitious Hollywood screenwriter loses his job and his identity, only to find new courage, love and the power of conviction in the heart of a small town’s life.

35874: A suspenseful tale about the injustices of the 19th-century English legal system

30794: Multi-millionaire Ezra Ounce wants to start a campaign against ‘filthy’ forms of entertainment, like Broadway-Shows. He comes to his relatives families and makes them members of his morale-boosting campaign. But Jimmy, another relative is producing a show, starring Ezra’s niece Barbara.

36603: Any Johnny Reb who tries to escape the Union prison at Fort Bravo faces the pursuit of Captain Roper. 34652: A master of the one-liner with an absurd rambling style, Zach’s sharp, resonating humor makes his show at the famed Purple Onion in San Francisco one of the funniest performances in recent comedy.
Zach Galifianakis: Live at the Purple Onion

68659: This thriller directed by James Foley stars Halle Berry as Ro, a woman who risks her life to discover the identity of a stranger lurking on the Internet who might hold the answers to her friend’s murder.

29141: A craftsman builds a glass harmonica that enlightens him. He travels to a town where the people are obsessed with money. A bureaucrat smashes the glass harmonica which leads to chaos and eventually to social reform.

4079: In the forgotten town of Cupang in the Philippines, a young woman named Elsa announces that she has seen the Virgin Mary — and then demonstrates a new-found ability to heal the sick. Soon the whole village has become the center of international attention.

7316: Takeshi Kitano brings his comic TV persona to the big screen in this satire of contemporary society, laced with a non-stop series of deadpan gags.

1281: An actress suffers an identity crisis when she finds herself spirited away from the bustle of Tokyo to a tropical paradise. A visually stunning ode to the need for a spiritual and tranquil life. Feature length version of a short made for Jeonju International Film Festival Digital Workshop.

Alias Ruby Blade: A Story of Love and Revolution

106410: A secretary for a police-station gets in a car accident and receives organ transplants from various animals, making him act like his donors.

43714: A German submarine is boarded by disguised American submariners trying to capture their Enigma cipher machine.

44775: Yolanda, a female teacher, cannot find the best methods to teach the marginalized children of the slums because of their different origin. Mario, a worker in a bus factory and a typical macho man, is confronted by Yolanda’s instinct for emancipation.

104689: This fascinating documentary explores the genesis of one of cinema’s greatest epics that never was: cult filmmaker Alejandro Jodorowsky’s (El Topo) adaptation of Frank Herbert’s sci-fi classic Dune.

24024: A noted professor and his dim-witted apprentice fall prey to their inquiring vampires, while on the trail of the ominous damsel in distress.
The Fearless Vampire Killers or: Pardon Me, But Your Teeth Are in My Neck

44611: This comedy is about the residents of a small town who get over-excited when their hockey team gets chosen to host a televised event

24140: Rosalie is amicably divorced, dividing her time between her mother’s house, with her siblings and small daughter, and César’s.

9078: A young woman, played by Ashley Judd leaves the Tennessee hills and starts a new life in a small town on the coast of Florida. Winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1993 Sundance Film Festival.

Chronicle of the Years of Fire

4032: This Oscar-winning saga which spawned a number of sequels depicts a classic underdog story of a small town boxer named Rocky Balboa who is given the chance to go head-to-head with a heavy weight champion named Apollo Creed.

28350: Violent gangster movie with a Brazilian protagonist.

135199: After spending most of their time focusing on their troubling teenage daughter, Toula and Ian are facing marital problems while also having to deal with yet another Greek wedding – this time, even bigger and fatter.

92201: A woman (Marion Cotillard) goes on a journey to find her husband after his plane disappears in the Sahara.

110016: Charles’ subconscious plays games with him as he tries to remember an acquaintance’s name.

90250: Subjective camera is used throughout to tell a story of a young man fixated on his sister. Returning to her life after a long absence, he manipulates her alienation from her boyfriend and friends. However, when she realises what has been going on she takes control.

35527: One November day in the countryside a young boy is afraid to go into his house. He waits for his mother to join him in the garden.

4156: In 1862, a young Englishwoman becomes royal tutor in Siam and befriends the King.
Anna and the King of Siam

28198: Rossellini’s darkly comic satire showcases the great Italian comic Toto as a barber who is imprisoned for murdering his wife’s suspected lover. After twenty years, Salvatore leaves the prison walls to find the world he once knew gone.

32546: In Nineteenth Century Japan, various women are forced into prostitution in a particular brothel. There, they are raped, tortured, and abused, and the body of each is covered with elaborate tattoos.

1166: Isabelle is taking nursing classes in a hospital. She encounters Doctor Philipp, a handsome and influential surgeon who shows little interest in her. All this changes when she begins to suffer unexplained fainting spells and begins to uncover the doctor’s secrets.

88573: When the nuclear accident at Chernobyl arrives, a young couple find that their wedding day turns into a day of disaster, destined to change their lives forever.

32422: Failing to kill anymore because of his conscience, a troubled hit-man seeks aid from a forger to help him get papers to China. However, the drug-lord has hired replacements to finish the job and kill the hit-man.

2209: A young Canadian nurse (Betsy) comes to the West Indies to care for Jessica, the wife of a plantation manager (Paul Holland).

664: Iconic portrait of eccentric, reclusive mother and daughter duo Big and Little Edie, close relatives of Jackie Onassis who live together in a filthy, decaying mansion in the Hamptons with a slew of cats and raccoons.

11846: The Z Channel: A Magnificent Obsession is a documentary that looks at the channel’s short but remarkable history as well as head of programming, Jerry Harvey’s, damaged personal life.

30473: A sexy starlet resembles Lylah Clare, a flamboyant star of the thirties, who died mysteriously and tragically on her wedding night gets a chance to play her in a biographical film directed by Lylah’s real-life husband (Peter Finch) and history repeats itself as he falls for her reincarnation.

1002: Sasha, a young British woman, is living with her baby daughter at Ile d’Yeu, a peaceful beach community. A stranger appears. Her name is Tatiana, she’s passing through, and pitches her tent in Sasha’s yard. The two women build an odd rapport, and tension builds as events unfold…

19913: At the beginning of the 20th century, Claude Roc, a young middle-class Frenchman, falls in love with Muriel, a young Englishwoman, but both families lay down a year-long separation without contact before they may marry.

25235: A poetic spirit of perseverance sifted from Korean-Chinese director Zhang Lu’s Mongolian sandscape.

21297: Steve Lopez is at a dead end. His marriage to a fellow journalist has fallen apart, and he can’t remember what he loved about his job in the first place. Then, one day, while walking through Los Angeles Skid Row, he sees the mysterious Nathaniel Ayers, pouring his soul into a two-stringed violin.

67642: Directed by Oscar winner Tony Bill, this epic drama tells the true story of the Lafayette Escadrille, a group of Americans who volunteered for the French military before the United States entered World War I.

27300: While struggling to get her stories published in Paris, Elena, a young American writer, meets a successful expatriate novelist. The two begin a passionate romance that ends abruptly when he must return to the United States.

78100: Unbeknownst to his 12-year-old daughter, Meggie, bookbinder Mo “Silvertongue” Folchart has a secret ability to bring characters to life by reading their stories out loud. But when the wicked Capricorn comes after her father, Meggie must rescue him.

106827: Inspired by a magician named Shiny Chariot, the lively Akko Kagari enters the Little Witch Academia with the dream of one day becoming as cool as her idol.

18981: Aga, a band singer, returns to Hengchun with frustration. Tomoko is a Japanese model assigned to organize a local warm-up band for the Japanese superstar concert. Together with other five ordinary residents who were not expected to be great or anything, they formed an impossible band.

62672: Buddy Manucci has made a name for himself in the New York City Police Department by heading up a task force that goes after crooks whose crimes demand a minimum sentence of seven years.

25199: A woman finds out her father is not her real one after her mother falls into a coma while searching for a mythical creature. She decides to meet her real father who happens to be an off-beat antique shopkeeper.

22254: A poignant documentary that explores a woman’s unique take on her overweight and aging body.

106943: Several figures move through the darkness on a cliff-edge. An inaudible conversation near the brow of the cliff may be the cause for the group to disband. The rest of the film follows the solitary journey of the youngest member of the group, until she rests; where land meets the sea.

104912: A silent film with only a quotation from Beckett off-screen at the critical moment ; a film of behavior, at the end of which the protagonist one Sunday afternoon starts shooting at a crowd of people heading toward the stadium.

20205: Filmmaker Andrés Wood offers a glimpse into the aspirations and disappointments of a handful of ordinary people from Santiago, Chile in this drama.

44492: Mycroft needs Sherlock’s help, but a remorseless criminal mastermind puts Sherlock on a distracting crime-solving spree via a series of hostage human bombs through which he speaks.

26392: Marie is a professional runner with hopes of making it to the European Championships in Portugal. When she is diagnosed with a mysterious blood disease, Marie is sidelined. Hoping to ease her disappointment, she moves in with new boyfriend, Bobby. There, she uncovers a disturbing mystery.

20759: Marco Berger’s debut feature sees conniving Bruno dumped by his girlfriend and deciding to win her back by hook or by crook; only she is happy with a new boyfriend Pablo and so Bruno devises another plan to get him out of the way.

27494: Four men and four women, all coming from the academic world, discuss their professional and sex lives around a diner, revealing themselves and their society as the evening goes by.
The Decline of the American Empire

42059: Pusit is having the worst day of his life. He just lost his job and is in serious debt when he receives a mysterious phone call with a tempting offer. If he could complete 13 tasks, he will win 100 million Baht.

21503: The film tells, in flashback, the story of Suresh Sinha, a famous film director. His marriage to Bina is on the rocks because her wealthy family sees filmmaking as a job lacking in social status.

22708: The setup here is a couple. They are both Japanese. She is married to a European, and is haunted by the Nagasaki bomb which killed her father. The two are in love. Space, vacuum, distance, passing.

104032: Penniless, Baron Frankenstein, accompanied by his eager assistant Hans, arrives at his family castle near the town of Karlstaad, vowing to continue his experiments in the creation of life.

100090: The Dead Man and Being Happy

118863: Will Henry is a newly single graphic novelist balancing parenting his young twin daughters and a classroom full students while exploring and navigating the rich complexities of new love and letting go of the woman who left him.

98659: As we toured through modern Guimarães, the founding city of Portugal, we wondered: “What stories does it have to tell?” The answer to this question came to us via the voices of four filmmakers with unique visions of cinema.

41336: Carter and Lee head to Hong Kong for vacation, but become embroiled in a counterfeit money scam.

24457: In his first collaboration with David Byrne and Brian Eno, Conner used footage from educational films to create a rhythmically austere image-track for music from their pioneering “sampling” album “My Life in the Bush of Ghosts” (1981).

79606: When wealthy 19th-century socialite Margaret Prior tries to find purpose in her life by volunteering at a women’s prison, she becomes obsessed with one inmate whose gifts for the paranormal hold a special attraction.

9913: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

44306: A female warrior who was raised as a man joins a young samurai’s quest to recover 48 of his body parts from 48 demons and to avenge her parents death.

42291: An exploration of the collections of medical paraphernalia amassed by Sir Henry Wellcome (1853-1936).
The Phantom Museum: Random Forays Into the Vaults of Sir Henry Wellcome's Medical Collection

24533: A film composed of images from prisons. Quotes from fiction films and documentaries as well as footage from surveillance cameras. A look at the new control technologies, at personal identification devices, electronic ankle bracelets, electronic tracking devices.

20889: Two young prisoners in a concentration camp escape from a transport hungry, poorly dressed and exhausted, they wander in the woods for three days, only to be caught again by the armed German citizens.

25769: Through his own words, personal photos, and illustrations, famed children’s book author Maurice Sendak offers a rare, intimate, often funny, and unexpected look at his exceptional life.
Tell Them Anything You Want: A Portrait of Maurice Sendak

47069: Music video of the Lady Gaga single “Bad Romance” concerning the singer getting kidnapped by supermodels who experiment on her.

45038: A middle-class man turns to a life of crime in order to finance his niece’s first year at Harvard University.

59571: Athletically challenged misfits Clark, Gus and Richie learn it’s never too late for glory in this goofy sports comedy that proves every (under)dog has its day — even though it might take, say, 20 years.

123240: The world’s best all-round sporting event returns in 2012. This time in London, and England’s capital has a lot in store.
London 2012 Olympic Opening Ceremony: Isles of Wonder

92595: A contemplative film observing the routine practice of a girl’s basketball team in Japan.

6693: When acerbic critic Sheridan Whiteside slips on the front steps of a provincial Ohio businessman’s home and breaks his hip, he and his entourage take over the house indefinitely.
The Man Who Came to Dinner

3973: A young woman becomes the fourth wife of a wealthy lord, and must learn to live with the strict rules and tensions within the household.

1922: An IT company hires an actor to serve as the company’s president in order to help the business get sold to a cranky Icelander.

3817: This violent and bloody exploitation action feature finds the hero seeking retribution and revenge for the villains that killed his loved ones. When he leaves the dart of the Golden Swallow at the murder scenes, the Golden Swallow herself investigates to see who is using her trademark calling card.

89275: This comedy is about a group of ex-factory workers who try to start up an ostrich farm in the middle of Tuscany. The plot is based on mistaken identity as the farmers try to obtain funding to keep their business afloat.

31211: Follow two good friends in this hilarious road movie as they embark on a tour of the Lake District and the Yorkshire Dales of Northern England, eating, chatting and driving each other crazy.

12209: A writer’s young assistant becomes both pawn and catalyst in his boss’s disintegrating household. Set in the beach community of East Hampton, New York, the film chronicles one pivotal summer in the lives of famous children’s books author Ted Cole and his beautiful wife Marion.

70509: Underdog (voiced by Jason Lee) is really Shoeshine, a mild-mannered pooch who’s been imbued with superpowers following a lab accident. But his teenage owner is the only person who shares the indestructible hound’s secret.

2631: An emotionally burnt out journalist attempts to escape his own existence by exchanging identities with a dead arms dealer. Shot on location, the protagonist goes on a life-changing journey through Africa, Spain, Germany and England.

33240: Isabelle Czajka’s tough, acidic drama about the working life – and leaving it behind – with up-and-coming star Anaïs Demoustier.

1846: A calamity at Dante and Randall’s shops sends them looking for new horizons – but they ultimately settle at Mooby’s, a fictional Disney-McDonald’s-style fast-food empire.

28768: At a New York City restaurant, the patrons are men, nude but for a G-string, waited on by a waiter and a waitress, also clad in just a G-string.

153203: A cause unknown, an accident has occurred in the tunnels of the Tokyo Bay Aqua Line, causing an emergency cabinet meeting to convene. Immediately afterwards, a huge creature appears, destroying town after town with its landing reaching the capital. The mysterious giant organism named “Godzilla”.

74763: A young psychic named Ashley is forced to tell a small lie out of sympathy for her bereaved client, Henry, when she fails to make contact with his dead fiancée, Kate — a restless spirit who was tragically killed on her wedding day.

131467: 1921, the beginning of the Roaring Twenties. Not far from Paris. It is party day at Marguerite Dumont’s castle. Like every year, an array of music lovers gathers around a great cause at the owner’s place.

92639: A black-and-white video portraying the death scene of a young mother and the tempestuous relationship that ensues between the husband and the daughter. Years later Madonna, as the grown-up daughter, reconciles with the father at the woman’s grave.

112803: Mr. X, a Vision of Leos Carax

7765: Ambitious documentary chronicling the cultural life and religious customs of the Sinhalese and the effects of advanced industrialism on such customs. The film is poetic in tone and features a number of image and sound montage sequences.

2885: English PoWs in Burma are forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. The commander overseeing construction tries to thwart the allies plans to blow it up.
The Bridge on the River Kwai

14156: A young boy faces a visit from the terrifying sandman.

30283: Governor George Wallace will not let two black students into an Alabama school, against the wishes of President Kennedy. Loud shouts come from both sides of the issue as JFK stands by his decisions.

26831: Wes is a disaffected, clock-punching drone, who will amount to nothing – until he meets a sexy woman named Fox. When Wes’ estranged father is murdered, Fox recruits him into The Fraternity, a secret society that trains him to avenge his father’s death, by unlocking his dormant powers.

18346: A possession film about a marriage counselor who becomes possessed by a Demon of Sexuality, when her father in law…

24860: Pulls philosophy out of academic journals and classrooms, and puts it back on the streets. In Examined Life, filmmaker Astra Taylor accompanies some of today’s most influential thinkers on a series of unique excursions through places and spaces that hold particular resonance for them.

103018: About the search for an adult who pushed a classroom full of troubled teens to gang-rape and murder their female teacher. A hard-bitten Police Inspector named Liberti is put on the case and sets about brutally interrogating the young punks.

79729: In this dark, cult comedy set to retro karaoke hits, a war for revenge rages between two sects of karaoke devotees when a middle-age divorcée from the Midoris crew is killed by a teenage slacker from the Gakis gang.

24578: After the easygoing Lincoln meets a poor Vietnamese immigrant Minh, son of a black GI, at an all-night movie house, they take a playful, spur of the moment trip down the Mississippi in Lincoln’s father’s cabin cruiser.

26955: Avant-garde, experimental and misogynist in the bargain, this oddball film is about 17 men named Frank who make their way through Helsinki in a commandeered subway car.

38031: “Lettre d’un cinéaste à sa fille” is a playful, free and personal film in the form of a letter, a film interwoven with a thousand stories knit together with different textures, a book of images where a filmmaker shows the images and the stories he wants to share.
Letter from a Filmmaker to His Daughter

100213: A conversation with Steve Jobs as he was running NeXT, the company he had founded after leaving Apple.

26529: The Woman, a childrens book writer is abducted from her bed in the middle of the night and imprisoned for writing subversive literature. She declares her books to be pure fantasies, but her inquisitor, The Man, sees the books as allegorical attacks on the State.

23965: In order to reunite the family, Rizvan Khan must set out on a journey all the way across the USA, a country that is still deeply traumatised by 9/11.

44185: The historical backgrounds of three nursery rhymes (Little Jack Horner, Mary Mary Quite Contrary, and London Bridge) are uncovered.

43248: After years of working mostly on comedies and literary adaptations, Raffaello Matarazzo turned to melodrama with this intense tale of a tight-knit working-class family shattered by temptation.

26685: A middle-aged man dies in the street, leaving his widow, two sons and a daughter destitute. The devastated family is confronted not only with his loss but with a terrible challenge – how to survive. For they are cannibals.

20712: An intimate and moving account of one family’s extraordinary courage in the face of overwhelming injustice and brutality.

22743: An ambitious department store worker endeavors to improve his station in life by manipulating women to get what he wants – money that is.
Bitter End of a Sweet Night

21934: A young country girl becomes pregnant, is spurned by her lover and takes up the life of an itinerant player.
The Straits of Love and Hate

101281: Polish experimental animation by Walerian Borowczyk and Jan Lenica.

42176: The vengeful Doctor rises again, seeking the Scrolls of Life in an attempt to resurrect his deceased wife.

23801: The most complex and complete expression of the anti-machismo that gives such a forceful critical edge to so many of Ripstein’s masterworks, this film marked an important milestone in Mexican cinema through its unprecedentedly frank depiction of homosexuality and violently reactionary homophobia.

21850: A troubled young artist, Robert (Christophe Malavoy), has a secret obsession, spying on his beautiful neighbour, Juliette (Mathilda May in a César winning performance).

40127: Hotel clerks by day, amateur ghost hunters by night, the last two employees of the historic Yankee Pedlar Inn set out to prove that their place of business is as haunted as its reputation.

35030: Carrie White is a lonely and painfully shy teen-age girl with telekinetic powers who is slowly pushed to the edge of insanity by frequent bullying from both her class-mates and her religious, abusive mother.

112550: A series of interviews featuring linguist, philosopher and activist Noam Chomsky done in hand-drawn animation.
Is the Man Who Is Tall Happy?

15223: A mobster travels to Hollywood to collect a debt and discovers that the movie business is much the same as his current job.

48072: Colonial tea planter John Wiley, visiting England at the end of World War II, wins and weds lovely English rose Ruth and takes her home to Elephant Walk, Ceylon, where the local elephants have a grudge against the plantation.

91961: The children of Harpagon, Cléante and his sister Elise, are each in love but they still haven’t spoken to their father yet. Harpagon is a miser who wants to choose the right man and the right woman for his children. Based on Molière’s play.

90623: The story of a man who smells of women’s nudity.

17316: Once Upon a Time in Mexico

28647: Upon discovering his fiancée Tollea has been kidnaped, Ramu and his friend Kado set out for a Pacific isle where all strangers are to be killed on arrival and the inhabitants, who are frequently sacrificed to an angry volcano god, worship the cobra.

93428: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit enjoying his quiet life, is swept into an epic quest by Gandalf the Grey and thirteen dwarves who seek to reclaim the lost Kingdom of Erebor, their mountain home, which was long ago conquered by the dragon Smaug.

53792: American Matt Quigley answers Australian land baron Elliott Marston’s ad for a sharpshooter to kill the dingoes on his property. But when Quigley finds out that Marston’s real target is the aborigines, Quigley hits the road.

52664: Trampy femme fatale Jewel Valentine nonchalantly lures three guys into her criminal strategy of happy homemaking: horny bartender Randy, arrogant lawyer Carl and guilt-ridden Det. Dehling.

30164: Jacques Rozier’s film follows the day-to-day conflicts between an enemy—the paparazzi and their invasive cameras—and its prey, Brigitte Bardot.

94449: When Bond’s latest assignment goes gravely wrong and agents around the world are exposed, MI6 is attacked forcing M to relocate the agency. Bond. 007 takes to the shadows, following a trail to the mysterious Silva whose lethal and hidden motives have yet to reveal themselves.

93784: The Turkish government passes a new law: every man can complete his military service in 28 days instead of the regular 18 months, in exchange of a certain amount of money. Many people want to take advantage of that, but maybe they should take their army duty more seriously after all…
He is in the Army Now

28997: In turn-of-the-century Mexico, two very different women become a bank-robbing duo in an effort to combat a ruthless enforcer terrorizing their town.

115829: Explores Jakarta at street level through the lives and distinctive sub-culture of the city’s gifted bus musicians. Jalanan is an intimate portrayal of the buskers and their individual struggles and aspirations, and also a raw, humorous, often shocking portrait of Indonesia’s bustling capital city.

373: Novice nun Viridiana pays a visit to her lecherous uncle who falls in love with her. In an attempt to atone for a resulting disaster, she offers charity to a colorful collection of derelicts and beggars.

97642: Duke, a crooked and music-mad cop, patrols in Los Angeles’ streets, music blasting and meets a young techno lover, David Dolores Frank. Appalled by the musical tastes of the young adolescent, Duke decides to give him a good music lesson.

112798: A story about changing seasons and changing attitudes, a newly accomplished writer faces mistakes and miseries affecting those around him, including his girlfriend, her sister, his idol, his idol’s daughter, and all the ex-girlfriends and enemies that lie in wait on the open streets of New York.

3544: Tom Ripley is a talented mimic, moocher, forger and all-around criminal improviser; but there’s more to Tom Ripley than even he can guess.

32135: Over fifty years old, Gianni Dubois has not made a film in years. Now he finally has the chance to direct a young TV star but he cannot come up with an idea for a story.

36197: A 9-year-old boy, frustrated by his newborn brother’s claim on their mother’s breasts, makes a plaintive appeal to the moon for a breast of his own, which soon arrives in the form of a French cabaret performer and her besotted, jealous husband.

1471: Brothers, Andy and his younger brother Hank are suffering from financial problems. They organize the robbery of a suburban mom-and-pop jewelry store as a quick victimless and fix for their situations. The perfect crime begins to go awry when they discover the store belongs to their parents.
Before the Devil Knows You're Dead

3420: Shy, nerdy teenager Peter Parker is bitten by a radioactive spider, which gives him superhuman spider senses which he uses to battle an evil villain after a tragedy in his family.

217: Scripted by novelist Marguerite Duras, themes of war and memory penetrate through this Academy Award-nominated tale of a French actress’ affair with a Japanese architect as she films an antiwar film in Hiroshima.

97507: In his twilight years, a disappointed Auguste Renoir is filled with a new, wholly unexpected energy when a young girl miraculously enters his world. Back at the family home, Jean too falls under the spell of the new, redheaded star in the Renoir firmament.

115710: Kill Bill: The Whole Bloody Affair

3601: A man is murdered, and the detective tries to find out whodunit. But the house he’s investigating is decidedly haunted, and he never knows just what’s round the next corner…

32270: A mother and her daughter are always fighting and screaming at each other. Each thinks the other has it so easy. Then, thanks to a magical fortune cookie, they switch personalities and bodies and discover each other’s problems and complications, gaining a little respect for their points of view.

29888: The film is about Les Anderson (Haim), a 16-year-old who is trying to get his driver’s license. He has a crush on one of the more popular and attractive girls in school, Mercedes Lane (Graham).

1650: In order to raise the tuition to send her young son to private school, a mom starts an unusual business — a biohazard removal/crime scene clean-up service — with her unreliable sister.

2827: 14-year-old Hervé is an average teenager who lives alone with his mother and struggles to cope with his urges, unprepossessing physique and mediocre intellect.

6885: An FBI agent persuades a social worker, who is adept with a new experimental technology, to enter the mind of a comatose serial killer in order to learn where he has hidden his latest kidnap victim.

32314: Five minutes before his big performance, the Maestro and his persistent mechanical assistant are in preparation mode. As the clock ticks, life at the top is not all it seems. The multi award-winning Maestro blends an operatic aria with CG animation.

50414: A young priest, Father Chisholm is sent to China to establish a Catholic parish among the non-Christian Chinese. While his boyhood friend, also a priest, flourishes in his calling as a priest in a more Christian area of the world, Father Chisholm struggles.

152: Inspired by Douglas Sirk’s All That Heaven Allows: two people, seperated by race and age, meet in a bar one stormy night. When they fall in love, prejudices among their families, colleagues and the community are revealed.

10156: Matt and Christina Drayton (Spencer Tracey, Katharine Hepburn) are a couple whose attitudes are challenged when their daughter brings home a fiancé who is black.

95432: A study of the mental breakdown of a doctor in a remote rural village. He believes himself intellectually superior to everyone except for a political prisoner in a mental ward. This is a metaphor on life under repressive governments, conformity versus individual expression.

1734: 40 international directors were asked to make a short film using the original Cinematographe invented by the Lumière Brothers, working under conditions similar to those of 1895.

30345: A scientist is experimenting with teenagers and turning them into murderers.

134591: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a special young girl named Melanie.
The Girl with All the Gifts

1498: It is 1933, and after leaving Dogville, Grace, her father, and his army of villains head south. They happen to stop in front of an iron gate in Alabama and a panicked young black woman runs up to the car from a plantation where white masters still rule black slaves.

55424: Officer Carey Mahoney and his cohorts have finally graduated from the Police Academy and are about to hit the streets on their first assignment. Question is, are they ready to do battle with a band of graffiti-tagging terrorists?

10: The long-lost father of two Russian brothers suddenly returns home. He proposes a fishing trip to make up for lost time. His effort to impose discipline escalates into an alarming test of strength for the boys.

4704: Mark runs a pirate radio station and causes an uproar when he speaks his mind and enthralls fellow teens.

112615: The rain and a confusion over names can sometimes be a catalyst for two strangers to have a conversation!

148789: Heinz Bütler interviews Henri Cartier-Bresson (1908-2004) late in life. Cartier-Bresson pulls out photographs, comments briefly, and holds them up to Bütler’s camera.

2693: A Scotland Yard undercover detective is on the trail of a saboteur who is part of a plot to set off a bomb in London. But when the detective’s cover is blown, the plot begins to unravel.

28466: So White flees from the wicked Queenie, wins over the thugs from Murder Inc. and meets her overrated Prince Chawmin’.
Coal Black and de Sebben Dwarfs

90402: The intriguing story of a young woman discovered in a London flat three years after her death.

37240: Two psychical researchers procure the services of a lady of the night and send her back in time under hypnosis. She finds herself in the body of a past existence – a woman in medieval times waiting to be beheaded as a witch. By avoiding this fate she unwittingly starts to alter history.

90566: A comedy-drama film starring Selçuk Yöntem as a widowed constitutional law professor whose life takes a turn for the worse when he remarries to a university student, which was awarded Best Film and Best Screenplay at the 18th International Adana Golden Boll Film Festival.
The Extremely Tragic Story of Celal Tan and His Family

28502: Dick’s first film, consists of eight unedited rolls of super-8 sound footage. A chorus of red and white Kodak leader separates the individual rolls, each of which is a sort of screen test for Dick’s female subjects (most of whom are or were associated with the punk music scene).

4660: A fashion show in Paris draws the usual bunch of people; designers, reporters, models, magazine editors, photographers. Lots of unconnected stories which all revolve around this show, and an all-star cast.

29758: When a Las Vegas performer-turned-snitch named Buddy Israel decides to turn state’s evidence and testify against the mob, it seems that a whole lot of people would like to make sure he’s no longer breathing.

1980: Set in Tel Aviv’s Shenkin neighbourhood, follows the lives of a group of young people oblivious of reality until a Palestinian man comes to break their routine.

22406: A disobedient young girl ventures into a reflective land of distorted truth after striking up a friendship with her own reflection in a youthful tale of fantasy that shows just when children can learn when they peer through the looking glass.

24591: A community of magical shape-shifting raccoons desperately struggle to prevent their forest home from being destroyed by urban development.

99669: In the aftermath of Japan’s defeat in World War II and the American occupation of the country, a Japanese expert (Matthew Fox) on the staff of Gen. Douglas MacArthur (Tommy Lee Jones) is faced with a decision of historic importance…

23738: Set in New York City during the mid-’80s, the story follows the interconnected lives of several people affected by the AIDS crisis, intense spiritual experiences, and the Reagan Administration.

22562: A man, a woman and their four daughters live in a log cabin in a snowbound mountain village.  After an accident kills the man, the woman and their adult daughters are left behind to mourn.

21769: As Alia, the daughter of a beautiful servant Khedija, grows up in the Kings Palace at the end of the French colonial rule in Tunisia, she realizes the sexual favours required of her mother and other servants.

27552: A European director is making a film with children from a social center in Tangiers. Because of his methods, his relationship with the children during shooting degenerate and transform the evolution of the project.

45252: Franรงois lives a skillfully controlled, well managed life, in Bloemfontein, South Africa. Father of two daughters and a devoted husband, he is wholly unprepared when a chance encounter unravels his clean and ordered existence.

38210: The tragic story of the second wife of England’s Henry VIII is given a first-class treatment, complete with opulent sets and beautifully-shot exterior sequences. Emil Jannings (THE LAST LAUGH, THE BLUE ANGEL), one of Germany’s greatest screen stars, plays Henry and steals the picture.

24759: Director Mikio Naruse has admitted to going through a dark period as a younger man and his 1958 film Anzukko (the first he is credited with writing after 1950’s White Beast) seems, in part, his way of dealing with the tortures of his past.

25503: In this quirky comedy, Tobe, an awkward teenage aficionado of 1980s soft-core, sets off in his grandfather’s used Weinermobile to see his sexual idol perform at a strip club in Indiana.

8923: Devastated Peter takes a Hawaii vacation in order to deal with recent break-up with his TV star girlfriend, Sarah. Little does he know Sarah’s traveling to the same resort as her ex … and she’s bringing along her new boyfriend.

25467: This is a filmic poem that celebrates the different artisan and cultural traditions of Georgia – graphic arts, wall painting, wine, ceramics and carpentry and song.

102107: A girl, sent by her parents to live with her two eccentric aunts, finds out on her sixteenth birthday that she is a witch.

38374: Guzmán interviews people involved in the making of The Battle of Chile, speaks with Allende’s former guards, reflects on his own time being held by the military government, and overall focuses on the individual experiences under such a regime.

76477: In this supernatural thriller, the Campbell family’s move to Connecticut takes a mysteriously dark turn when a series of shocking paranormal events reveals that their inviting new home is a former mortuary with a sordid past.

28851: In the great restaurant of life, there are those who eat and those who get eaten. Raimundo Nonato finds an alternative way, a life of his own: he cooks in order to survive and find a place in society.

16326: Directed by multi-award winning veteran Polish director Andrzej Wajda, Katyn investigates the murder of thousands of Polish officers by the Soviet Secret Police during World War II. Among those killed was Wajda’s own father.

3482: U.S. Marshal Carrie Stetko tracks a killer in Antarctica, as the sun is about to set for six months.

108280: The bears tempt Goldilockswith carrot soup, the scent of which brings Bugs on the scene. Bugs romances Mama bear and she becomes infatuated with him.
Bugs Bunny and the Three Bears

12384: Warring alien and predator races descend on a small town, where unsuspecting residents must band together for any chance of survival.

36051: A Cashier in a bank in a small German town is alerted to the power of money by the visit of a rich Italian lady. He embezzles 60,000 Marks and leaves for the capital city, where he attempts to find satisfaction in politics, sport, love and religion.

132529: Samuel M. Delgado and Helena Girón go in search of the last living witch in Yé, a small town on the island of Lanzarote, recuperating non-verbal histories on the verge of obsolescence and evoking an eerie, otherworldly atmosphere where oblivion looms.

93726: Inspired by Georges Melies’ moon shorts, Guzzanti and collaborator Paola Cannatello imagine a 1939 expedition to Mars intent on turning the Red Planet to Fascist Black.

14213: A dying gunfighter spends his last days looking for a way to die with a minimum of pain and a maximum of dignity

152278: A comedy that takes place in the 1960’s during turbulent times in the United States and a middle class suburban family is visited by a guest who turns their household completely upside down.

153022: An in-depth look at the legendary punk band, The Stooges.

28549: Odd-couple partners Henry Winkler and Michael Keaton spice up the morgue night shift by running a call-girl ring.

33061: A couple makes love in a hotel. She lives in Switzerland, he lives in Belgrad. What’s been destroyed by war will be reborn in this hotel room.

2410: New Orleans businessman Michael Courtland’s life is shattered when his wife and daughter are tragically killed in a botched kidnap rescue attempt.

50947: Tormented by a gang of bullies — led by Matt Dillon, in one of his first film roles — sheltered new kid Clifford seeks protection from older student Linderman, a burly loner who’s rumored to have killed — and possibly eaten — his own brother.

135548: Based on true events, Christine tells the story of a career-driven 29-year-old news reporter at WXLT-TV in Sarasota, Florida, circa 1974.

109376: Betty Boop-oop-a-dooped her way to the silver screen in the Max Fleischer short Dizzy Dishes on August 8th, 1930. Today, in no matter what form she comes, Betty is and always will be an animation classic.

97428: The deterioration of a small community in Fogo Island, offshore of Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada, is forcing its inhabitants to leave and resettle. In spite of a condemned future, there are some residents who decide to remain, holding on to their memories and grieving for the past.

96672: O documentário retrata as diversas facetas do músico, desde suas parcerias com Paulo Coelho até seus casamentos.
Raul - O Início, o Fim e o Meio

94623: Sylvain George has aimed his camera for more than four years at the ups and downs of refugees stranded in the French port of Calais. Most compassionately, George provides an impressive and poetic picture of this hunted group, largely filmed in black-and-white.

36299: A winner and sure to please. In front of one of the largest newspaper offices is a hot air shaft through which immense volumes of air are forced by a blower. Ladies in crossing this shaft often have their clothes slightly disarranged. A young man is escorting a young lady and talking very earnestly.
What Happened on Twenty-third Street, New York City

31154: Seven friends fresh out of Georgetown University struggle to overcome the issues that keep them from growing up and moving on past their college glory days.

44043: Romance blossoms again for a divorced jewel-thief couple as they try to rekindle the love they once had for each.

26743: A middle-aged woman, running a cafe in Paris, recognizes a tramp to be the husband she thought she lost in the war many years before and now he suffers from amnesia.

25934: When people start dropping like flies around the production of the movie Stab 3 – the latest meta-movie sequel based on events occurring in the film series itself – Sidney and other Greensboro survivors are once again drawn into mayhem.

25548: The latest film from Yoji Yamada depicts the strong bond between a mother and her family during WWII. Set in Tokyo in 1940, the peaceful life of the Nogami Family suddenly changes when the father, Shigeru, is arrested and accused of being a Communist.

22685: Hope plays truant, when a group of people are chased and captured by the authorities. A lone man watches the caravan leave. He stands in the midst of desolation, mysteriously.

47248: A dejected fugitive hides on a deserted island, tourists arrive, clad in 1920s high-society clothing, and his fear of being discovered becomes a mixed emotion when he falls in love with one of them. He wants to tell her his feelings, but an anomalous phenomenon keeps them apart…

64250: After mutilating a patient, a plastic surgeon is booted from the medical profession and goes into hiding in France. There, he transforms disfigured female criminals into beauties who perform in his traveling circus.

27965: In this classic Harold Lloyd comedy short, a tipsy young doctor (Lloyd) encounters his pretty patient (Mildred Davis) sleepwalking on a building ledge, high above the streets.

99896: Bullets fly, barbs are traded and old scores are settled when a Korean master criminal and his crew hightail it to Macao to join his treacherous former partner on a $20-million jewel heist, in this full-throttle action caper from South Korean director Choi Dong-hoon.

44127: The babies get lost in the woods as Tommy faces responsibility when Dil, his new baby brother, enters his life.

105281: High speed camera 2000fr/sec. match striking fire.

24676: Winner of the Grand Prize for Best Short Film at the Cannes Film Festival, Ostrov (Island, 1973) is a genial critique on the selfishness of modern society.

27801: A Vietnam veteran heads to an island inhabited by cannibals to save a kidnapped model not only from her kidnappers, but also from the cannibals’ lurking Devil god.

119464: Two women who grew up together discover they have drifted apart when they retreat to a beach house together

23617: A conversation that starts with music and emails, and ends up possibly changing the relationship between the two people from “mother-son” to “woman-man.”

20860: In Search of Famine is a movie about making a movie. A young, idealistic director arrives in a village to make a picture set during the Great Bengal Famine. It’s a film that he hopes will reveal the problems and privations still current in rural India.

22831: Bennett plays spoiled socialite Celia, who falls recklessly in love with the handsome but emotionally complex Mark Lamphere (Michael Redgrave). After their wedding, Celia becomes uncomfortably aware that Mark’s mild distrust of women is actually a deep-set, and potentially dangerous, hatred.

21646: In 1982 Gus Van Sant’s first project was a short based on the William S. Burroughs’ essay ‘Do Easy’.

20904: Against all odds, a worn down fading boxer, painstakingly clashes against his driven opponent, firmly refusing to accept the hearsay of a washed up career.

102384: On the set of Cleopatra, Hollywood’s most beautiful star, Elizabeth Taylor, fell into the arms of one of the world’s greatest actors, Richard Burton – and she didn’t leave. Their subsequent white-hot, scandalous love affair gave rise to the paparazzi…

23773: Commissioned by the MoMA to create an essay on the role of the fine arts, Godard and Mieville came up with this invigorating video spectacle. Godard and Mieville use The Old Place to voice their own personal philosophies.

26893: Dawn, the forest. André is waking up. Soon, Wally is taunting him. André points the other way and, with Wally temporarily distracted, runs off. Wally quickly catches on and chases André; off camera, we hear a scream, and Wally flies back with a bent stinger.
The Adventures of Andre and Wally B.

99746: A group of unlikely friends are brought together through shared determination to recover from sex addictions, in order to forge meaningful relationships for the first time in their lives.

43022: A lyric, poetic, and visionary trip through outer and inner space. Beautiful and profound, spiritual and sensual, speaks the language of the soul.

22955: New York City’s Stonewall Inn is regarded by many as the site of gay and lesbian liberation since it was at this bar that drag queens fought back against police June 27-28, 1969. This documentary uses extensive archival film.

61260: This psychological thriller follows the trail of terror left by one of the most notorious serial murderers in U.S. history, the still-at-large Zodiac Killer, who terrorized Northern California in the 1960s and ’70s.

20578: Not a fairy tale, but rather the true story of how Disney regained its magic with a staggering output of hits – Who Framed Roger Rabbit, The Little Mermaid, Beauty and the Beast, Aladdin, The Lion King and more – over a ten-year period.

22075: Set during the days of Turkish dominance, it is a tale of vengeance. A goat herder whose wife has been raped and had then died of suffocation takes to the mountains until he manages to kill the rapists one by one.

46786: Whenever it becomes known how good he is with guns, ex-gunman George and his wife Dora have to flee the town, in fear of all the gunmen who might want to challenge him. Unfortunately he again spills his secret when he’s drunk…

102908: An experimental short by Apichatpong Weerasethakul.

20388: Vishnu, a restless young man, rejects his father’s faltering hair oil business and hits the road with a travelling cinema.

14587: An IRS agent with a fateful secret embarks on an extraordinary journey of redemption by forever changing the lives of seven strangers.

33825: In this visual evocation of sex and sexuality, a man and woman stage an elaborately choreographed courtship ritual, edited with Rist’s usual attention to the syntax of mass media.

53308: Mickey Rourke is an IRA terrorist who grows tired of violence after he accidentally blows up a school bus full of children. Now useless to his cause, he’s being hunted by both the British and the IRA.

33941: An imprisoned IRA sniper is freed to help stop a brutal, seemingly “faceless” assassin from completing his next job.

88752: Pinhead plays Motorhead’s front man in a poker game for Lemmy’s band. In an unlikely turn of events, Lemmy wins.

37887: A band of four thieves is hired to steal the museum-housed diamond called the Sahara Stone.

Wallace & Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit

106885: Facing West, glistening embers. A week of observations along the waterfront.

1586: The Last House on the Left

Li'l Quinquin - Part 3: The Devil Himself

Lost Angels: Skid Row Is My Home
