20502: A father returns to his old hometown with his young family. Events force him to face the small town’s xenophobia.

87340: Just like Herod, you will fall under the spell of the dance of Salome! These wonderful colours date back to 1910.

40337: A new action-packed adventure, following the world’s most famous detective, Sherlock Holmes, and his longtime trusted associate, Dr. Watson, as they match wits with their arch-nemesis, the criminal genius Moriarty.
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

20466: Was it black magic that took him from her? Or the vision of her rival’s swaying hips?

42366: A young and rich couple (Farmer and Esposito) is preparing to attend a reception where they are invited. Meanwhile, a prostitute and a pimp (also played by Farmer and Esposito) are violently quarrelling.

99304: Disembodied parts of dancers are seen moving freely in black space… form a moving and rhythmic three dimensional design and semi-abstract shapes.

21360: An eighty-six-year old translator is making her first trip since the war back to the places of her childhood in the Ukraine. The film interweaves the story of Swetlana Geier’s life with her literary work and traces the secret of this inexhaustible mediator of language.

126413: This road trip drama portrays a woman whose husband suddenly returns home after disappearing for three years.

23331: About love and birth of human being.

27393: Five lonesome cowboys get all hot & bothered at home en the range after confronting Ramona Alvarez and her nurse.

24198: Nastassja Kinski plays a young woman who runs away from her small town to New York City, gets discovered as a model and becomes thrust in the middle of a terrorist ring.

82898: Director Noboru Iguchi and gore master Yoshihiro Nishimura team up for this hyper-violent and hilariously grotesque depiction of a very angry army of butt sword-wielding geisha robots with enough strength to embed tempura shrimp in villains’ eyes.

43978: A little boy named Edmond learns that the crowing of Chanticleer the rooster has put an end to a flood on his family’s farm.

126577: Beautifully unfolds the complicated ties connecting three teenagers on holidays on a lake shore. Surrounded by the magnificent and imposing nature, they defy its laws, just like they defy the ones imposed by the other giants, the adults, who they are very suspicious of.

24234: AIDS takes its toll on a group of affluent white male homosexual friends in New York City over a ten year period.

26265: Paul Hanganu loves two women. Adriana his wife and the mother of their daughter, the woman with whom he’s shared the thrills of the past ten years, and Raluca the woman who has made him redefine himself. He has to leave one of them before Christmas.

100847: This uncompromising portrait of the appalling practice of taking poor children from their parents and sending them as “contract children” to live with new families who often abused them, was common in Switzerland until the 1950s

58148: Based on real-life events, this erotic thriller tells the sad and sadistic tale of a Japanese geisha (Hitomi Kuroki) whose behavior spiraled out of control.

927: Nishi is a beleaguered cop whose wife is suffering from leukemia and whose partner is paralyzed from a gangster attack. In order to do right by those he loves, he must do something wrong, which results in tragic consequences.

31516: An inspector is having a secret relationship with a woman. When she is murdered by his boss, all proofs is against him.

94261: An elite trio of expert hunters venture into the woods to track and capture an especially rare and dangerous prey for the Christmas season.

14499: When the weight of rejection begins to set in after being denied entry to every college he has applied to, a high school burnout attempts to placate his mom and dad and win the heart of his dream girl by scheming with his friends to create a fake university.

96230: This pop-art video of The Beatles’ “Get Back” is Iván Zulueta’s first attempts to get his colourful ideas on film and a clear nod to what would become his first feature film, “Un, dos, tres… al escondite inglés.”

29199: The original “shockumentary” consisting of a collection of mostly real archive footage displaying mankind at its most depraved and perverse, displaying bizarre rituals, cruel behavior, and animal violence.

33547: A powerful and thought provoking drama based on one of the most shocking crimes of the 20th century, the chilling story of child killers Ian Brady and Myra Hindley.
See No Evil: The Moors Murders

2136: An inland ocean with a close proximity to the urban areas of southern California, the Salton once clocked in as a veritable paradise – many tagged it “The California Riviera.” By the early years of the 21st century, however, the Salton had dwindled to a decrepit ecological catastrophe.
Plagues and Pleasures on the Salton Sea

30628: Ricky leaves Hong Kong for Switzerland to look for the lost soul and trace the past of his deceased lover, Pascal. Ricky struggles with the confusion of memories, reality and illusion.

1259: Jakub stumbles across his grandfather’s journal which is written in backwards script. He finds a map leading him to an old bottle of wine hidden years ago. Now curious, Jakub must solve the mysteries of his grandfather’s garden. From Slovakia’s celebrated director Martin Sulík.

843: Together with his young son a father heads off for an inimitable quest: By car they drive through the nightmarish chaos of the earthquake catastrophe from 1990. The destruction demanded over 50’000 deaths, entire villages were razed to the ground.

92292: In a twist to the fairy tale, the Huntsman ordered to take Snow White into the woods to be killed winds up becoming her protector and mentor in a quest to vanquish the Evil Queen.

2052: A biography of British painter Francis Bacon and his relationship with his lover, a former small time crook…

33423: An art-house black and white film without dialogue. It’s about a man who lives alone on a farm with his pigs.

51323: Miami newspaper reporter Malcolm Anderson is fed up with writing about murder.

37999: Peter Brackett and Sabrina Peterson are two competing Chicago newspaper reporters who join forces to unravel the mystery behind a train derailment.

32679: Whispering Sands takes place on the island of East Java, and stars Indonesian superstar Christine Hakim as a village midwife who sells traditional herbs to augment her living.

793: “Why would I tie myself to one woman if I were interested in others?” says Jerôme, even as he plans on marrying a diplomat’s daughter by summer’s end. Before then, Jerôme spends his July at a lakeside boardinghouse nursing crushes on the sixteen-year-old Laura and her blonde stepsister, Claire.

4269: Loretta Lynn was one of the first female superstars in country music and remains a defining presence within the genre; with her strong, clear, hard-country voice and tough, no-nonsense songs.

111173: Music video for Autechre, which was re-edited by the director in 2002.

30584: One night, a spur-of-the-moment wager – whether two of the couples, blindfolded, can pick out their respective naked partners using only their hands – teaches a group of old friends all more than they ever wanted to know.

52284: Legendary funnymen Walter Matthau and Robin Williams star in this black comedy as Sonny Paluso and Donald Quinelle, two unemployed strangers who witness a robbery and become the targets of a hit man.

55149: This third outing for the kings of stoner comedy — Cheech Marin and Tommy Chong — concerns their latest enterprise: selling ice cream from a truck. (But, of course, they’re delivering more than just good humor to their customers.)

6238: The discovery of a corpse threatens to unravel a bumbling local politician’s (Chris Cooper) campaign for governor of Colorado.

29235: Two 15-year old girls from different sides of the tracks compete to see who will be first to lose their virginity while at camp.

34526: Alien creatures invade a small town and a group of four teenagers, plus one little boy, try to escape from them.

36577: Two anarchistic brothers live by petty thievery and try to recover from their Catholic upbringing. Bandiera (Laurent Terzieff) and Rabbino (Franco Citti) were children when they pushed their drunk of a father out of a window for killing their pet sheep.

102545: The horrific 2010 death of a SeaWorld Orlando trainer at the hands of an 8,000-pound orca named Tilikum sparks director Gabriela Cowperthwaite’s edge-ofyour-seat documentary Blackfish.

18959: In this dark, affectionate, and rarely seen satire (Miloš Forman’s first feature made in the US), a husband and wife embark on a wild goose chase after their runaway daughter and wind up experimenting with the wild habits of youth counterculture.

25025: The film is a visual improvisation between camera and actors, virtually no storyline.

39910: A humorless loner (Kentucker Audley) attempts to win the admiration of a drifter with his debut performance at the local comedy club.

46903: Wintertime in Lyons. About a dozen people, men and women, are having a snowball fight in the middle of a tree-lined street.

25141: What is man ? Man makes war, man kills man, man hunts, man is executed. A montage mixing original drawings by Topor, original shots and stock shots that ironically analyze what man is.

47641: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even it if means murder.

8079: Semi-biographical film based on the experiences of gonzo journalist Hunter S. Thompson.

44836: A darkish journey down memory lane, to visit some news events, folkways and thought patterns associated with the late forties and early fifties.

80636: Unlike more typical Italian zombie fare, Zeder (which is also known as Revenge of the Zombies) emphasizes mystery over gore. When a journalist (Gabrielle Lavia) discovers a bizarre secret within the ribbon of an old typewriter.

43787: This short documentary records the celebration and ritual surrounding a snowshoe competition in Sherbrooke in the late 1950s. The film marked the beginning of a new approach to reality in documentary and prefigures the trademark style of the NFB’s newly formed French Unit.

87987: A documentary filmmaker explores seemingly unrelated paranormal incidents connected by the legend of an ancient demon called the “kagutaba.”

27110: 1933. Ten years after Rick and Evie met, married, and settled in London, raising their eight-year-old son, until Imhotep’s corpse starts to walk the earth again, determined to become immortal, while another force born of the darkest rituals of ancient Egyptian mysticism is set loose in the world.

126824: Just as Magda is diagnosed with breast cancer, she meets Arturo, a devoted husband and father in the midst of unspeakable loss. Their chance encounter leads both down a path of strength, grace, love, and rebirth.

107411: In this hilariously thought-provoking dramedy, celebrated Greek morning TV show host Antonis Paraskevas decides to give his career a boost by staging his own elaborate kidnapping. As he holes up at an abandoned luxury hotel, he ponders the best way to make a momentous return.
The Eternal Return of Antonis Paraskevas

38982: An affluent owner of a doll shop becomes obsessed with a child-like, young girl due to her resemblance to one of his dolls.

98115: A London drug dealer finds himself on the wrong side of a ruthless Mr Big when a massive deal goes disastrously wrong in Luis Prieto’s striking, energetic remake of the 1996 feature that propelled Nicolas Winding Refn (Bronson, Drive) into the international spotlight.

101586: Pursued by assassins, Zatôichi must deliver an orphaned infant to his father.

121795: The “black sheep” son of a wealthy family meets a young psychiatric patient who’s been raised in isolation her entire life. He takes the naive young woman home for his brother’s wedding to convince his family that he’s finally straightened out his life.

87657: An instant classic when released in September 1971, John Lennon’s Imagine was the ex-Beatle’s solo masterpiece, and its musical legacy is matched here by priceless footage of Lennon’s creative process, independently edited from original 16-millimeter footage by Andrew Solt.
Gimme Some Truth: The Making of John Lennon Imagine Album

43857: Fact-based recounting of a group of women who are imprisoned on the island of Sumatra by the Japanese during World War II and used music as a relief to their misery.

26182: A scientist (Victor Slezak) obsessed with World War III hits the road with a woman (Anna Juvander) so he can re-create scenes from history.

43933: The story of Wilson Bond, a pimp who after saving Chan, the leader of the Heaven and Earth society, a revolutionary group, is made a member. After a botched first assignment for the group, he is made a servant to the Prince, the very person the Heaven and Earth society want to overthrow.

22044: This drama explores the agony of all involved when a childless but loving noble family hires a penniless girl to provide them with a “sibaji,” a contract child, in return for a small tract of land.

34409: Two exorcists literally remove the skeletons from the cupboards from people’s homes. Some fairly embarrassing secrets are revealed along the way. A case where the skeletons have hidden themselves turns the lives of all those involved.

28140: An old man is watching abstract animations. He doesn’t understand them, so he heckles with strange commentary, to the annoyance of those around him.

36824: A mercenary with a three-bladed sword rediscovers his royal heritage’s dangerous future when he is recruited to help a princess foil the designs of a brutal tyrant and a powerful sorcerer in conquering a land.

5078: After winning the heavyweight boxing championship and single-handedly winning the war in Vietnam for America, Sylvester Stallone moves on to a real challenge — arm wrestling — in this action drama with a family undercurrent.

34875: It is Lifeday, a holiday that is celebrated on Chewbacca’s home planet. Chewie and Han Solo are trying to get to the planet where Chewie’s family is waiting, but the empire is out searching for the rebels.

37602: When Camiel, a gay dentist, and Simon, a carefree café owner, collide in a traffic accident, their lives become intrinsically entangled. When they bump into each other fourteen years later, Simon is severely ill. Camiel experiences at close range how Simon and those around him come to terms.

90040: A band of survivors must fight to keep humanity alive in a bleak post-apocalyptic world.

4346: From the acclaimed director of American Movie, this portrait of radical thinker Michael Ruppert explores his apocalyptic vision of the future, spanning the crises in economics, energy, environment and more.

108689: In a story that plays out entirely on a teenager’s computer screen, Noah follows its eponymous protagonist as his relationship takes a rapid turn for the worse in this fascinating study of behaviour (and romance) in the digital age.

37766: Fletch is a reporter for a L.A. newspaper, but he acts more like a detective. When a relative leaves him a Louisiana mansion, Fletch is naturally curious.

94186: A hunter dreams through its prey’s eyes.

34911: This short film was specifically done by Víctor Erice to be shown at the exhibition ‘Erice – Kiarostami. Correspondences’, held at the Centre de Cultura Contemporània de Barcelona

88763: Bas Jan Ader stands in a garage behind a concrete paving slab. On the floor to his left and right are illuminated light bulbs. After approximately one minute Bas Jan Ader picks up the heavy concrete slab and raises it onto his left shoulder.

1376: Hélène, a widow, sells antiques from the apartment she shares with her stepson, Bernard. Bernard is haunted by his participation in the torture and murder of a young woman named Muriel while serving as a soldier in the war in Algeria. One the most powerful classics in Alain Resnais’ work.
Muriel, or The Time of Return

54190: Three different stories come to life in this sequel to the hit animated Disney adventure. Explorer Milo Thatch (voiced by James Arnold Taylor), his new sweetheart, Queen Kida, and the rest of the team are preparing to rebuild the underwater city.

33970: A young boy stays with his aunt and uncle, and befriends his cousin who’s the same age. But his cousin begins showing increasing signs of psychotic behavior.

510: A portrait of domestic turmoil detailing the emotional breakdown of a suburban housewife and her family’s struggle to save her from herself. A married couple so deeply in love but unable to express their ardor in terms the other can understand.

31921: When a nightclub singer is forced to take refuge from the mob in a convent, she ends up turning the convent choir into a soulful chorus complete with a Motown repertoire, until the sudden celebrity of the choir jeopardizes her identity.

115236: During a fictional series of Big Brother, a zombie outbreak occurs, but the house-mates are unaware of the impending doom outside of the Big Brother House.

108525: Sunhi, a film-studies graduate, visits one of her professors, Choi, in order to receive a recommendation letter allowing her to study in the United States.

32756: Purushin, a student on his way to Delhi, becomes obsessed with the tragic suicide of a young drummer. He collects many people to go with him to tell the boy’s mother.

33814: The film consists purely of cell-phone conversation snippets of twenty-two random people walking through the streets of New York City. Ranging from complainers to neurotic worriers conversing about bizarre or amusing situations, they and their comments are unrelated to one another.
Sounds from a Town I Love

31439: A woman’s struggle for equality in Japan in the 1880s.

117303: A man begins to suspect that his long-distance girlfriend whom he met on the Internet has been living in the same city as him, and he sets out looking for her.

808: Paul Robeson: Tribute to an Artist

1212: A widowed aeronautics engineer, who has lost his job, travels with his son hopping freight trains from Moscow to Koktebel, a town by the Black Sea, to start a new life with the father’s sister.

93083: A most perfect picture of the Pan-American Exposition buildings, including the Electric Tower and Temple of Music, as they appear at night.

3243: “Count” Karamzin, a Don Juan, lives off the money he scams from rich ladies who are attracted by his charms and his title.  Having set up shop in Monte Carlo, he and his partners in crime pick their next target: the wife of an American envoy.

51368: The Starship Troopers are back to take action against the Bugs in this fast-paced sequel directed by Academy Award winner Phil Tippett. Unfortunately, they are not only besieged by giant insects, but must battle an internal human threat as well.
Starship Troopers 2: Hero of the Federation

89821: A beach, a couple, a man who has been bitterly disappointed in his past and one single camera shot from far away. The protagonists in this brief comedy act like playing pieces among the scenic bay filled with false harmonies. Wounds don’t heal in a day, sometimes not even in 15 years.

474: A matriarch’s need for a transplant from a blood relative brings a reunion of the volatile Vuillard family at Christmas. Yet a simple family gathering can’t begin to describe the unpredictable, emotional experience of this magical drama that’s equal parts merriment and melancholy.

90288: Music video to Robyn’s “Indestructible,” in which the singer dons a dress made out of clear plastic tubes with colored fluids running through them, intercut with various couples in compromising positions in bed.

655: A pair of greedy peasants agrees to lead a man and woman through hostile territory to safety in exchange for gold, unaware that they are a princess and her general.

3062: An 8 year old boy must return his friend’s notebook he took by mistake, lest his friend be punished by expulsion from school.

29297: The story of the early days of California wine making featuring the now infamous, blind Paris wine tasting of 1976 that has come to be known as “Judgment of Paris”.

114329: A plastic surgeon is going to operate the classic female anatomy.

13826: Xu Xin’s epic documentary surrounds the December 8, 1994 theatre fire that took the lives of 323 people in Xinjiang Province, China.

116378: In an idyllic seaside city in the Dominican Republic, the long-time relationship between a beautiful and impoverished young local girl and her wealthy European lover is put to the test as issues of class, inequality and exploitation rise to the surface.

135360: Claire, a talented but emotionally troubled dancer, joins a company in New York City, and soon finds herself immersed in the tough and often cutthroat world of professional ballet.

1033: A fable of innocence: thirteen-year-old Aviva Victor wants to be a mom. Her sensible parents thwart her, but, undeterred, she runs away…

117122: The Liquid Casket / Wilderness Of Mirrors

3106: Mickey Rooney and Judy Garland are cloned in an experimental backyard musical. The starting point is a number of scenes from the days when both the adolescents romped through the family series and Busby Berkeley musicals.

108704: The film expands on a series of short videos Herzog directed for a public awareness campaign in an effort to curb the practice of texting while driving. The doc profiles the victims of distracted driving and features conversations with the drivers themselves.
From One Second to the Next

133393: The tale of a young girl, the Queen of England and a benevolent giant known as the BFG, who set out on an adventure to capture the evil, man-eating giants who have been invading the human world.

1157: A new vision of Tom Thumb’s tale in a fascinating stopmotion animation technique that combines with live action.
The Secret Adventures of Tom Thumb

4167: The story of the friendship between a star pitcher, wise to the world, and a half-wit catcher, as they cope with the catcher’s terminal illness through a baseball season.

33481: Hugh Hudson’s primal epic follows John Clayton, a royal-blooded man raised by apes after his parents died following their shipwreck in Africa. After being found by Phillipe D’ Arnot, a kind hearted man that Clayton nursed back to health, they set sail for their native England.
Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes

28205: A clairvoyant woman, inspired by a vision, smashes open a section of wall in her husband’s home and finds a skeleton behind it. Along with her psychiatrist, she seeks to find the truth about who the person was and who put her there.

6052: Florence and Chet Keefer have had a troublesome marriage. Whilst in the middle of a divorce hearing the judge encourages them to remember the good times they have had hoping that the marriage can be saved.

132301: For Marnie Minervini (Sarandon), motherhood is not a familial duty. It’s a vocation. A compulsive advice-giver, the recently widowed but ceaselessly cheerful Marnie cannot stop texting, calling, and showing up unannounced at the home of her daughter, Lori.

985: Set in Ghobadi’s native Kurdistan, close to the Turkey-Iran border. Soran is a 13-year-old boy who orders other children around as he installs an antenna for villagers keen to hear the broadcast of Saddam Hussein’s fall…

33999: After experiencing what they think are a series of “break-ins”, a family sets up security cameras around their home, only to realize that the events unfolding before them are more sinister than they seem.

2194: Laure, a sultry former jewel thief and con woman, tries to straighten out her life. Suddenly, she is exposed to the world and her enemies by a voyeuristic photographer, Nicholas Bardo, who takes a special interest in her.

34628: In every photo, it exists a point, a detail that attracts the eye. A particular detail, strange and prominent. This detail takes on an emotional tone; it determines the spectator’s state of being in relation to this photo.

4003: The inn’s service is rude, even quarrelsome. Is this any way to treat a guest who is the most respected Shakespearean of his day? It is if you’re part of a theatrical group posing as innkeepers and trying to give the renowned but pompous David Garrick his comeuppance. Garrick is aware of the ruse.

114085: A present day social drama spanning multiple characters about the human insecurity in a “new country” which gradually unwinds to a mythological scale concerning the human condition on earth entirely.

81485: Edmund Blackadder, a kindly Victorian shopkeeper, flips the script on Charles Dickens’s holiday classic when a visit from the Spirit of Christmas makes him realize that he ought to give meanness a try.

39585: Chris Vaughn, a U.S. Army Special Forces operative, returns to his rural Northwest community, which is being ravaged by petty crime and widespread drug use. Upon learning of these depredations, Chris ousts the corrupt sheriff and runs for office himself, in order to clean up the town.

22301: In the heat of the August fair holiday, Bruno Cortona cruises the streets of Rome in his powerful Lancia Aurelia Sport. Quite by chance he meets Roberto, a young university student. Roberto is fascinated by the carefree, easy life Bruno leads and agrees to spend the day with him…

20350: A young man comforts his older brother’s wife and children after he goes missing on yet another tour of duty in Afghanistan.

27331: A football player and his friends travel to the planet Mongo and find themselves fighting the tyrant, Ming the Merciless, to save Earth.

103826: Brothers Yaki and Shaul kidnap a girl, hide her in a cellar and then place a call demanding a huge ransom for her release. But they’ve forgotten that today is Shabbat and their victim’s orthodox family will not answer the phone. Time starts to run out…

58322: In this animated superhero story, Bruce Wayne has retired as the Caped Crusader. His Batmobile is now permanently parked in the Batcave, and Gotham City is overrun by thugs and evil geniuses.

39629: A detective investigating the death of a heroin-addicted prostitute uncovers evidence pointing to the existence of a murderous devil cult.

104797: Teen rent boy Reinier falls in love with a mate in the slum soccer field at their neighbourhood in Havana. Although obsessed with moneymaking to hold up his baby, teen wife and wife’s granma, gambler Reinier always fails in getting the stoke of luck he looks for.

25360: In 1897, in a castle near the town of Werewolfville in the Carpithians, a slightly deranged Professor Orfanik experiments with his new inventions which include, even at this early date, television and a film camera.
The Mysterious Castle in the Carpathians

8258: An unemployed cartoonist moves back in with his parents and younger brother Freddy. When his parents demand he leave, he begins to spread rumors that his father is sexually abusing Freddy.

47460: A gangster who wants to be an actor; an actor more gangster than anything. Here their paths and lives begin to cross.

86898: The classic fairy story: the fairy who is not invited to the Princess’s christening party curses her to die from pricking her finger on a spindle. A good fairy commutes the sentence to 100 year’s sleep, to be broken by a kiss.

25204: Jiang Wen stars in his third directorial work that boasts a stellar cast including Joan Chen, Anthony Wong and Jaycee Chan. A polyptych of interconnected stories in different time-zones, shifting between a Yunnan village, a campus, and the Gobi Desert.

45929: In a spontaneous looking yet tautly directed home-movie-like quest for the black pages from her family history, the director tries to come to terms with her past before her first child is born.

101913: Bored with chasing Red Riding Hood, the Wolf decides to go after Cinderella, but her fairy godmother takes a shine to him instead – and has an arsenal of magical powers to help achieve her ends…

41493: An avant-garde collage from Gustav Deutsch, using found footage from various scientific films to explore the impact and nature of film.

38517: A dark, offbeat comedy about a group of Mexico City teens embroiled in a kidnapping involving a retired wrestling legend and a parrot.

111236: The music video for “Livin’ on the Edge” is notable for a number of things, including depicting vandalism, theft (notably grand theft auto), joyriding, airbag crashing, unprotected sex, and violence among school-aged youth, cross-dressing teachers, a naked Steven Tyler holding a zipper…

14514: On any day of the week, you could expect a newborn baby to be nurtured and loved by his older sister. Except, of course, if it’s Wednesday.

35921: After being dumped by her live-in boyfriend, an unemployed dancer and her 10-year-old daughter are reluctantly forced to live with a struggling off-Broadway actor.

36756: A man disrupts an entire town with his endless sneezing.

37970: Based on the autobiography of Gypsy Rose Lee, this made-for-TV movie-previously a Broadway smash and a 1962 film-depicts the life and times of a stripper and her domineering mother.

29014: About the life and death of the legendary Swedish/American agitator Joe Hill.

32690: American crook Renzo Capetto plans to help loyalists (and the national treasury) escape on his boat, then kill the men and blame their deaths on a mythical sea monster.

36632: A colourful sequence of animals, artists, jugglers and circus-rider performances.

6019: Trevor Reznik, a lathe-operator, has not slept for a year. His every waking minute has become an unremitting nightmare of confusion, paranoia, anxiety and terror. An escalating series of clues lead to the source of his mysterious affliction. For this is no ordinary insomnia…

35845: A Turkish action film abour two Turkish police officers sent to New York to bring back a smuggler.

37468: In this drama, an elderly fellow recounts the adventures and misfortunes he and fellow trekkers suffered on an ill-fated 1905 expedition to the South Pole. That he was the only survivor only adds poignancy to his incredible tale.

111352: The world shivers in the darkness, trembles in the light.

35439: A cat from outer space teams up with a young girl and an old man to fight a murderous alien that possesses people.

150836: Young Tunisian Hedi lives an ordered life in which he believes there can be no more surprises. His future will play out as other people have planned…

37814: Montag the Magnificent (Glover) is a master illusionist who performs at underground venues, selecting female volunteers from his rave-like audiences…

4048: “The Irish are the blacks of Europe, Dubliners are the blacks of Ireland, and the North Siders are the blacks of Dublin, so say it loud – I’m black and I’m proud!” Or so Jimmy tells his puzzled friends as he tries to assemble a R&B band in a working class community in Dublin.

3385: A secret kid society called The Goonies go on a wild expedition following a pirate’s ancient treasure map in order to save their homes from being foreclosed.

29170: Mr. & Mrs. Rough live happily in a house by the sea until Mrs. Rough’s mother arrives and stays for a few weeks. Mother-in-law immediately begins to disturb the tranquility of the household.

34663: Based on the work by Sándor Weöres – a kind of novel in verse of the life story of a fictitious Hungarian poetess. Although the film spans 120 years, the characters do not age.

31983: An epic fantasia of a young girl’s coming-of-age, featuring Catherine Breillat’s signature take on gender relations and breathtaking cinematography.

97083: Volume 12 in the Collection Petites Planètes—music recordings made around the world, a series on ‘experimental ethnography’ by Vincent Moon and local people created without any money involved—features Brazilian comedian/singer Thalma de Freitas performing with her father around Rio de Janeiro.
Petites Planètes (volume 12): Thalma & Laércio de Freitas

35795: In 120 minutes, a live radio program DJ must save a family that has been kidnapped.

32458: The daughter of a prominent Japanese politician is kidnapped by a gang of lowlifes, the politician has Agent Zero sprung from prison so that she can infiltrate the gang and save his daughter on the down low.

109471: Depressed single mom Adele and her son Henry offer a wounded, fearsome man a ride. As police search town for the escaped convict, the mother and son gradually learn his true story as their options become increasingly limited.

28086: Four best girlfriends hatch a plan to stay connected with one another as their lives start off in different directions: they pass around a pair of secondhand jeans that fits each of their bodies perfectly.
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants

2273: Questions arise when a Senator returns to a small Western town to attend the funeral of a local man he once saved from a notorious outlaw who spread terror across the town. He reveals the truth behind his ‘good’ deed.
The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance

15586: This is the tale of an ill-fated romance, of war against evil, Yi-hang is the unwilling successor of the Wu-Tang clan, and disenchanted commander of their forces against evil clans led by magic twins Ji Wushuang.

31653: In this surrealist comedy, 31-year-old Abel refuses to leave his home — ever — until a quarrel between his overbearing parents results in his being tossed out. Luckily, Abel is taken in by a kind stripper who happens to be his father’s mistress.

2317: Notorious outlaw Jesse James is a hero to many including the young and zealous Robert Ford. A wanted man with big money riding on his capture, James’ demise may ultimatley come from within his own ranks.
The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford

51066: Count Dracula is back in action when three swingers turn to black magic to boost their sex-drive slump. The Count enters the picture when the group goes from drinking blood to worshipping Dracula’s rival, Lord Courtley.
