99173: How the Wizard (James Franco) arrived in Oz and became the ruler. A prequel to The Wonderful Wizard of Oz.

43617: In this modern day take on auteur Alan Clarke’s 1989 cult classic, a young wannabe football casual gets drawn in to the charismatic but dangerous world of the firm’s top boy.

23022: George and Rose Loomis are honeymooning at a Niagara Falls motel. She plots with Ted Patrick to do him in, but all does not go smoothly. For one thing, after Loomis is reported missing Polly Cutler spies him at the motel but her husband Bud thinks she’s imagining it.

22278: The film is set in Lithuania after the Second World War. It shows dramatic events in a small Lithuanian farming community, where people are split between the Soviets and the “brothers in the woods”, who are fighting to defend their land from the Soviets after the end of the Second World War.

20229: Ratz wishes he could kill his father who is an Austrian Minister. At least virtually. He develops a computer game that allows him do so as often as he pleases.

106513: A drama centered on the relationship between Phil Spector and defense attorney Linda Kenney Baden while the music business legend was on trial for the murder of Lana Clarkson.

21073: In a no-man’s-land filled with high-tension pylons and mobile homes, Marcus and Bettina raise their daughter, who wanders the industrial backwater to occupy her mind. When a tragic accident occurs, their pursuits of happiness are put to the test…

108752: Dusty is a cropdusting plane with dreams of competing as a high-flying air racer, but he happens to be afraid of heights. So he turns to a seasoned naval aviator, who helps Dusty qualify to take on the defending champ of the race circuit. Dusty’s courage is then put to the ultimate test!

88968: The song is also praised for its artistic and highly cinematographic music video. The video consists of children dressed in old-fashioned Icelandic clothing, migrating towards an unknown destination somewhere in Iceland.

109508: Due to a huge difference in the way they perceive life, the relationship between the students and their new German language teacher becomes critically tense. When one of the students commits suicide, her classmates accuse the teacher of being responsible for her death.

7096: Brian Kessler, a journalist researching serial killers, and his photographer girlfriend Carrie set out on a cross-country tour of the sites of the killings.

1101: Real sideshow performers star in this grotesque revenge drama set against a circus backdrop. A trapeze artist plans to wed and then murder a midget for his fortune. When his fellow ‘freaks’ discover her scheme, she becomes the target of their horrifying vengeance.

603: After her husband’s murder, a woman is pursued by three cooks who want the money her husband stole from them. She turns to a charming stranger for help but soon discovers he isn’t who he claims to be.

3034: An American scientist publicly defects to East Germany as part of a cloak and dagger mission to find the solution for a formula resin and then figuring out a plan to escape back to the West.

57088: Abandoned mutt Benji finds his hope in humanity restored when a kind family adopts him. Told from the dog’s perspective, director Joe Camp’s heartwarming box office hit follows the lovable pooch as he chases cats and plays with his young owners.

35788: A light-hearted story of two working-class brothers courting three wealthy and beautiful sisters in a small Illinois town.

36583: A newly recruited night security guard at the Museum of Natural History discovers that an ancient curse causes the animals and exhibits on display to come to life and wreak havoc.

109810: An unprecedented look inside the private world of J.D. Salinger, the reclusive author of The Catcher in the Rye.

55375: Two years after getting his heart broken, Chicago investment banker Matthew returns to the “scene of the crime” — his old neighborhood of Wicker Park. But the newly engaged Matthew flips when he sees a woman who looks just like his long-lost love.

35858: In the old house by the Black Sea lives a boy. It is a winter and there is snow. Suddenly a man appears. Is he from the past? Does he really exists or is he an image of the boy’s subconscious memories? A nostalgic story where the borderlines between dreams and memories blur.

90353: The final part of Mikhalkov’s trilogy about Divisional Commander “Kotov” finds him returning home during World War II having been betrayed, narrowly escaped execution for treason and nearly reduced to dust in a prison camp.

28337: When a group of whale watching tourists find themselves stranded at sea, rescue comes in the form of an old whaling ship.  But not long after they board, it becomes clear that the crew that saved them are crazed lunatics, starting a horrific rampage that covers the deck in blood.

91109: The film is like a cubist painting given a time dimension.

3398: A cult classic about sweethearts Brad and Janet who breakdown during a storm and discover the eerie mansion of Dr. Frank-N-Furter, a transvestite scientist. They meet a houseful of wild characters including Frank-N-Furter’s latest creation: a muscular man named “Rocky.”

37809: Tom Sharky is a narcotics cop in Atlanta who’s demoted to vice after a botched bust.

31486: A serpentine day in the life of ten seemingly disparate women: a porn star, a flight attendant, a psychiatrist, a masseuse, a bartender, a pair of call girls, etc. All of them with one crucial thing in common. Trouble.

14509: Little-known Fred Zinnemann suspense movie about an American POW (Van Heflin) who betrays his fellow prisoners to the Germans and is then pursued in peacetime by a vengeful ex-comrade (Robert Ryan).

37511: In the grips of delirious illusion, Anna, a young, gentle and shy young woman convinces herself that Doctor Zanevsky is fervently in love with her. Nothing can shake her certainty… But after hope will come resentment, followed by hatred.

14975: Baron Victor Frankenstein, in prison for murder and trying to evade the guillotine, tells a priest how he and his mentor, Paul Krempe, had performed many scientific experiments, eventually leading to the resurrection of a dead body.

16558: Set in late 19th century Canton this martial arts film depicts the stance taken by the legendary martial arts hero Wong Fei-Hung (1847-1924) against foreign forces’ (English, French and American) plundering of China.
Once Upon a Time in China

11695: In a remote village in the Dolpo in the northwestern Himalayas of Nepal, Tinle, a charismatic old chief, has just lost his eldest son and blames his son’s friend Karma for his death.

4131: A homeless boy Lucas (Paul Dano), meets Jacques (Brian Cox), a grumpy bar-owner, whose unhealthy lifestyle has brought him five heart attacks. Jacques takes Lucas under his wing with the intention of having him continue his legacy.

28253: Onoff is a famous writer who hasn’t published any new books for quite some time and has become a recluse. When he is picked up by the police one stormy night, without any identification, out of breath and running madly, without clear memory of recent events, the Inspector is suspicious.

17702: Novelist Catherine Tramell is once again in trouble with the law, and Scotland Yard appoints psychiatrist Dr. Michael Glass to evaluate her. Though, like Detective Nick Curran before him, Glass is entranced by Tramell and lured into a seductive game.

87420: A small film crew is accepted by the population of the island Corvo and discovers a 500-year-old civilization, whose history is practically undecipherable and almost without any written records.
It's the Earth Not the Moon

105637: “He doesn’t stop resisting; he stands in the snow, in the silence, stubbornly keeping the position”.

40457: An animated, magical, musical version of Dickens’ timeless classic “A Christmas Carol.” The nearsighted Mr. Magoo doesn’t have a ghost of a chance as Ebenezer Scrooge, unless he learns the true meaning of Christmas from the three spirits who haunt him one Christmas Eve.

22357: Edda Chiemnyjewski, a freelance press photographer and single mother living in 1970s West Berlin, is confronted with the fact that “a cook has no time for affairs of state”. She also fails to find a market for the project she has been working on with her photography group, documenting the city.

42406: In “The Soviet Elegy” the long train of photos of the Soviet leaders, dead or alive, stops at the portrait of Yeltsin. At the time of shooting Yeltsin had fallen down from the assembly of the Communist Party deities, and participated in the earthly life through connections of different kinds.

118040: Based on a Chekhov tale about a distinguished professor of medicine living in the country, bored with his work and his family, whose tedious days are disrupted by the return of a former student, now a famous actress.

23069: The short film is a collage of snippets from discarded footage found by Lipsett in the editing room of the National Film Board, combined with his own black and white 16mm footage which he shot on the streets of Montreal and New York City, among other locations.

26059: Three women find themselves sharing their husbands with other women in this drama from Indonesia.

45503: A firefighting cadet, two college professors, and a geeky-but-sexy government scientist work against an alien organism that has been rapidly evolving ever since its arrival on Earth inside a meteor.

27203: A man tells his story of how he became unstuck in time and abducted by aliens.

101945: While vacationing in the Ozark Mountains, Bugs Bunny encounters Curt and Pumpkinhead Martin, two dimwitted hillbillies who are duped by Bugs into a violent square dance.

102732: Claudio Giovannesi’s award-winning second dramatic feature captures one week in the life of sixteen-year-old troublemaker Nader, who, despite his mother’s threats and family’s insistence that he respect his Muslim roots, fights, steals and pursues an Italian girlfriend.

38859: A political hack becomes President during the height of the Depression and undergoes a metamorphosis into an incorruptible statesman after a near-fatal accident.

8752: A historical account of Vietnam, beginning in the 1840s and showing the events the led to the Vietnam War.
In the Year of the Pig

83316: After assuming the identity of a dead person, a callow young man is quickly sucked into a dark and violent underworld where powerful men gamble on human lives in very high-stakes games of Russian roulette.

121276: Florence, Thirteenth Century. The \“Black Death\” is spreading. Ten kids (three boys and seven girls) decide to escape and to seek shelter in the countryside, away from the horrible …

26979: Fight promoter Nick Donati grooms a bellhop as a future champ, but has second thoughts when the ‘kid’ falls for his sister.

24554: Horty, a French foundry worker, wins a contest and is sent to see the sailing of the Titanic. In England, Marie, saying she is a chambermaid on the Titanic and cannot get a room, asks to share his room. They do, chastely; when he awakens, she is gone…

23699: The life of a respected British politician (Jeremy Irons) at the height of his career crumbles when he becomes obsessed with his son’s lover.

26505: With over 86 speaking parts, Podalydès has assembled an all-star, ensemble cast including Catherine Deneuve, Mathieu Amalric, and Chiara Mastroianni in this film about the everyday lives of Parisians living in the wealthy suburb of Versailles. Conclusion to his Versailles Trilogy.

24928: Jackie Chan’s personal favorite among his more than 100 films features the action superstar in several of his most crazily balletic, duly celebrated set-pieces, including dangling from a speeding bus with just an umbrella for support…

85049: Psychotic doctor Evan Rendell escapes from a mental institution and returns to his hometown to exact revenge on the locals who killed his father. The doctor commits a string of gory murders with the surgical tools he has at his disposal.

119746: Murphy is an American living in Paris who enters a highly sexually and emotionally charged relationship with the unstable Electra. Unaware of the effect it will have on their relationship, they invite their pretty neighbor into their bed.

23535: When she discovers that there are other women who share her name, the 27-year-old Silvia Prieto develops a bizarre obsession with the “other” Silvias, an obsession that involves unraveling the riddle of her own identity.

41235: A wife neglected by her husband, a medical researcher in China, falls in love with a dashing diplomatic attaché.

45297: When a young married couple’s car breaks down on the way to the Imam Reza shrine at Mashhad, the nearest town yields a peculiar man who can help fix their car so long as the wife takes his place as teacher of the town school.

27597: A dramatization of the Hamburg, Germany phase of the Beatles’ early history.

21400: This jam session starts with a blues played by Lester Young. Mili uses very sharp lights with subtility qnd also blacklit effects. The musicians become silhouettes, concentrated and relaxed at the same time, shrouded in mistery, appearing suddenly in close-up at the right time and tempo.

23451: Following the intertwining lives of six young gay and lesbian characters through a Godardian structure of fifteen separately titled sections, Araki creates a vivid portrait of everyday teenage pressures compounded by a host of extraordinary burdens.

131564: Two brilliant young women, art school graduates with deliciously profane vocabularies and supreme confidence, talk sex, cinema, and power, as they wield their shared video camera like a scalpel.

197: Students at a suburban high school drift through a seemingly uneventful day, until two arrive with sinister intentions. A semi-improvised exploration of how violence makes its way into a typical American high school that won the Best Director and the Palme d’Or at 2003 Cannes Film Festival.

110951: Young Anka and her father have lived together since her mother’s death, and have always been more like close friends than father and daughter. One day, Anka discovers a letter from her mother whose contents make her question her whole relationship with her father…

2986: The title character, played by Tavernier’s “alter ego” Philipe Noiret, is benumbed by the nihilistic activities of his son Sylvain Rougerie. Arrested on charges ranging from arson to murder, Rougerie offers the standard-issue explanation.

54517: A demented widow lures unsuspecting children into her mansion in a bizarre “Hansel and Gretel” twist.

112900: 1985. Ocean City, Maryland. Summer vacation. Rap music. Parachute pants. Ping pong. First crushes. Best friends. Mean bullies. Weird mentors. That awkward, momentous time in your life when you’re treated like an alien by everyone around you.

30380: Director Nikita Mikhalkov documents the history of Russia from 1980 to 1991 by annually asking his daughter Anna such questions as “What do you love the most?”, “What scares you the most?”, “What do you want above anything” and “What do you hate the most?”

29929: Danielle is the dirty girl of Norman High. When her misbehavior gets her banished to a remedial class, she teams up with an innocent closet-case and together they head out on a road trip to discover each other and themselves through a funny and serendipitous friendship.

49204: When tough-but-honest Chicago cop Eddie Cusack takes on dueling mob families — and his fellow police officers — this blood-for-blood revenge thriller explodes in a fireball of deception.

69173: A geneticist plans to unleash a deadly virus on the world’s population in order to rid Earth of humans and repopulate the planet with dinosaurs.

96798: Lawrence Kasdan returns to his specialty, the ensemble piece, with this tale of a dog lost in the Rocky Mountains, and the equally rocky marriage of Beth (Diane Keaton) and her self-involved husband Joseph (longtime Kasdan collaborator Kevin Kline).

29431: A small-town Canadian hockey player transforms herself into a supermodel in this satire from director Denys Arcand.

52998: Charlie Brewster and Peter Vincent from the original Fright Night must face more vampires out for revenge.

1695: Worlds collide, tempers flare and dreams are realized when Mr. Vig, an 82-year-old virgin from Denmark and Sister Ambrosija, a headstrong Russian nun, join forces to transform Mr. Vig’s run-down castle into an Orthodox Russian monastery.
The Monastery: Mr. Vig and the Nun

1539: Showman Jerry Travers is working for producer Horace Hardwick in London. Jerry demonstrates his new dance steps late one night in Horace’s hotel, much to the annoyance of sleeping Dale Tremont below. She goes upstairs to complain and the two are immediately attracted to each other.

3914: Four friends fleeing a viral pandemic soon learn they are more dangerous than any virus.

31312: Dirty Harry is on the trail of vigilante cops who are not above going beyond the law to kill the city’s undesirable

33343: An animated vision… a subliminal glance at man in light and space.

2732: Danila returns from army service to a St. Petersburg high on music and anarchy.  Soon, the young man is accompanying his brother, a contract killer, through the Russian underworld…

32119: Affluent widow Lady Margaret and her son Roland enlist the help of Sherlock Holmes to keep a huge diamond from being stolen on a trip to Edinburgh.

1945: The troubled life and career of one of Norway’s most celebrated artists is examined with documentary-style realism in this biography from celebrated filmmaker Peter Watkins.

11101: When a black crime boss suddenly dies, his quiet and submissive driver Frank Lucas unleashes a ruthless ambition that sees him climbing the ranks to become a heroin kingpin.

31276: Jujiro (???), also known as Crossroads, Crossways, Shadows of the Yoshiwara or Slums of Tokyo, is a 1928 silent Japanese film drama directed by Teinosuke Kinugasa.

3870: Warhol’s strange interpretation of “A Clockwork Orange.” Includes Gerard dancing to the Martha and the Vandellas classic “Nowhere to Run” and being tortured by professional sadists.

1821: A husband and wife tangle with an investigator over her dead brother’s million-dollar insurance policy.

2656: In the Ecole Technique Officielle, the Catholic priest Christopher and the idealistic English teacher Joe Connor lodge two thousand and five hundred Rwandans refugees, under the protection of the Belgian UN force and under siege by Hutu militia.

33227: Once upon a time there was a war between earth and the planet Zog. The two vast space fleets took off to do battle but, at the point of contact in deep space, the earth crews were smelling their girlfriend’s underpants while the Zog’s were distracted watching porn and so they passed one another.

25895: Set in the near future when artificial organs can be bought on credit, it revolves around a man who struggles to make the payments on a heart he has purchased. He must therefore go on the run before said ticker is repossessed.

83195: Anna Faris stars in this rollicking comedy as Ally Darling, a sexually adventurous twentysomething who begins to suspect that her one true soul mate may be among the many lovers she has left in the dust, including Colin.

42075: A 2010 British documentary film challenging the media for the role they played in the Iraq and Afghanistan conflicts, which went on nationwide general release on December 13, 2010 and was shown on ITV1 the following day.

21953: This circuitous film begins with the alleged suicide of a young activist who is part of a radical film collective. When his camera is recovered by a friend, Motoki, it is revealed that the footage is nothing but mundane street scenes of Tokyo.
The Man Who Left His Will on Film

87053: A Hungarian carnival troupe follows a young girl who reforms a tearaway after her old suitor tried to kill him with a poisonous lizard.

22724: A storm on the Caspian Sea lands two friends, sailor Yusuf and mechanic Alyosha, on the shores of Soviet Azerbaijan. Working at the kolkhoz (“collective farm”), the two fall in love with a beautiful administrator, and their rivalry for her affections affects their work and threatens the community.

26786: “With the making of his sixth film, 6/64: MAMA AND PAPA, Kren introduced subject-matter that was considered at that time to be highly revolutionary or even explosive. He began filming ‘actions’ and ‘happenings’ staged by Otto Muehl and Gunter Brus, and by the Vienna Institute for Direct Art.”
6/64: Mama and Papa: An Otto Mühl Happening

20611: The story unfolded itself instantly by the reactions and ideas of actors during the 20 days of shooting and developed into what is presented to the audience.

61109: Boldly original comedian Louis C.K. brings the audience to hysterics in this live HBO stand-up performance. In a blistering routine, the award-winning comic exposes life’s most absurd realities with his signature blend of raw wit and twisted wisdom.

118433: As a series of strange and violent events start happening, an alcoholic policeman realizes that he has been turned into a werewolf as part of a larger plan, so he investigates with the help of his partner and his friend.

40140: Javier wants to forget his ex. But it’s impossible when she’s always online. Getting drunk and partying it’s the only solution. Or not.

87137: A Japanese-inspired ballet that moves on to a serpentine dance in the “Loïe Fuller” style. An uncoiling string of colors.

21837: The façade of good manners and appearances is gradually broken down when perversity slips into the life of a respectable family from a good background that seems to have everything arranged perfectly.

39368: Abstract animation illustrates Edwin Gerschefski’s modernist composition. Two dots – one blue and one orange – appear most often, sometimes large, sometimes small, sometimes overlapping.

25621: A documentary on the evolution of the Oklahoma band The Flaming Lips.

47121: The neighboring gardens of Montague and Capulet are at war, but the gnomes, Gnomeo and Juliet, are in love.

99783: At the dawn of the Spanish civil war, a group of children insensitive to pain is locked in a sanatorium in the heart of the Pyrénées. In the present day, brilliant neurosurgeon David Martel discovers that he has a tumor and starts searching for his biological parents…

24807: Eight years into her marriage, Miyako Mizuki (Mariko Okada) looks happy on the outside, but in fact she is not satisfied with her husband who cares about nothing but his career.

38056: A mockumentary chronicling the rise and fall of a not particularly talented –or particularly bright but always controversial—1990s hip-hop group.

26932: A department store manager and his floorwalker (a dead ringer for Charlie Chaplin) plan to embezzle the store’s money.  When Chaplin himself wanders in, chaos ensues.

27714: The film follows Daniel Smith, an eccentric musician and visual artist, as he leads his four siblings and best friend to indie rock stardom, eventually facing the struggle to become viable as a solo act.
Danielson: A Family Movie (or, Make Joyful Noise Here)

24963: Former assistant director to maverick auteur Seijun Suzuki, Yasuharu Hasebe made his directorial debut with this lurid, bizarre gangster-spy yarn. The film opens on Daisuke Honda (played by matinee idol Akira Kobayashi), a hard-bitten war photographer fresh from the trenches of Vietnam.

21683: Joao Vuvu, a widower with no family, lives alone in his large house that shows signs of wealth in an old neighborhood of Lisbon. He is not very sociable, if at all, and every day repeats the same routine. Yet when his son gets out of prison, it provokes a desire for regeneration in Joao.

31359: Realizing the urban legend of their youth has actually come true; two filmmakers delve into the mystery surrounding five missing children and the real-life boogeyman linked to their disappearances.

54794: Undersized Max Keeble is the butt of jokes at school and the fall guy for a passel of playground bullies (no surprise, with a name like that!). But when he learns he’s moving to Chicago, it’s a heaven-sent opportunity for retaliatory payback.

95674: A young American uncovers a conspiracy during his attempt to save his family, who were kidnapped while on vacation in Spain.

3523: Two friends and business partners find their lives turned upside down when strange circumstances lead to them being placed in the care of 7-year-old twins.

32152: An exuberant dog that growls, barks, and shows his teeth at the slightest provocation convinces his owner to take him on a walk. The dog pulls on the leash as they head for the park.

94852: A portrait of HPG, actor, director, and producer of pornographic films, entirely conceived from the thousands of hours of making-of recorded during his film shoots.

2779: Jean-Marc Leblanc is living the ideal North American life. He has a big house, a safe civil service job, a wife who is a go-getter businesswoman, and two kids. But the wife and kids ignore him, and as for the job… he explains to people why the government can’t help them.

51408: Dave and Barbara Whiteman seem to have it made: He’s a successful businessman, and she’s a happy homemaker. Together they have a son, a daughter and a Beverly Hills manse to die for. At least, that’s what a wayward bum thinks.
Down and Out in Beverly Hills

33308: Tommy comes from a forced rest period due to injuries suffered in Harlem’s gang warfare. With the help of his girl, he will reorganize his gang, and overcome his rival gang leaders, through extreme acts of violence and death.

1416: Eight of Geoffrey Chaucer’s lusty tales come to life on-screen in Pier Paolo Pasolini’s gutsy and delirious The Canterbury Tales, which was shot in England and offers a remarkably earthy re-creation of the medieval era.

12225: Emperor Kuzco is turned into a llama by his devious advisor, Yzma, and her hunky henchman, Kronk. Now the ruler who once had it all must form an unlikely alliance with a pleasant peasant named Pacha. Together, they must overcome their differences as they embark on an adventure.

28894: An anthropologist goes to Haiti after hearing rumors about a drug used by black magic practitioners to turn people in zombies.

97741: About a football match between Bhutan and Montserrat, the then-lowest ranked teams in the FIFA World Rankings. The game was played in the Changlimithang Stadium, Thimphu, Bhutan.

270: An experimantal tale in which classic Americana and avant-garde cinema meet Zen Buddhism and the Bible, as El Topo, a master gunfighter and cosmic mystic, must defeat his four sharp-shooting rivals while on an increasingly bizarre path to enlightenment.

94936: The seaside city of Kaitan is not a happy place: the shipyard is downsizing due to poor economic conditions, and the city’s residents are about to face another harsh northern winter. Sketches of Kaitan City offers five of the many stories concurrently happening in this city.

3447: High School Musical’s Vanessa Hudgens stars as a shy social misfit who teams up with a popular girl to form a rock band for their high school’s battle of the bands contest.

28744: Images of mostly traffic in Paris, seen from the apartment of Germaine Krull or shot while walking through the city with her.

17215: Coming-of-age story about a 15-year-old boy, Oscar, who falls in love with his stepmother, Eve.

29962: A lawyer whose wife has had an affair sets out to leave her by flying to LA. He becomes ever more involved in the lives of a few fellow travelers on a journey that ends up showing him as much about himself as about the others.

91906: Farmer Vincent kidnaps unsuspecting travellers and is burying them in his garden. Unfortunately for his victims, they are not dead.

31191: At 2:37, someone commits suicide in the school lavatory. The day is told up to that point from the viewpoint of six different students.

97891: A Spanish orchestra conductor (Quim Gutiérrez) deals with the mysterious disappearance of his girlfriend.

149795: The murder of gay porn studio owner and producer Bryan Kocis by two of his stars, Harlow Cuadra and Joseph Kerekes.

90644: This film combines three diverse worlds in an absurd manner to show the author’s passion for black humour: traditions of the avant garde cinematography of 20s, the social motives of contemporary Russia, and forensic medicine.

28620: Emmanuelle returns to her husband in Hong Kong and proceeds to have several extramarital affairs – with his knowledge…
Emmanuelle 2: The Joys of a Woman

110402: The music video of the song is an elaborate performance of the band dancing on treadmills in a single continuous take.

37162: A reclusive sports hustler returns home to his family farm after years of absence to reunite with his two eccentric, unhinged and emotionally damaged brothers.

13096: Nick investigates the case of a missing man and later a murder that is connected to Nora’s family.

15101: In 1950, a simple Italian postman learns to love poetry while delivering mail to exiled Chilean poet Pablo Neruda.

110623: When a poor college student who cracks an online poker game goes bust, he arranges a face-to-face with the man he thinks cheated him, a sly offshore entrepreneur.

33285: The life of a tropical fish shop owner is taken over by a fellow fish entrepreneur who happens to be a serial killer. Loosely based on the exploits of two Tokyo serial killers, Sekine Gen and Hiroko Kazama, a husband and wife duo who owned a pet shop and murdered at least four people.

28401: Monteiro creatively borrowed from traditional Portuguese legends to craft a series of echoing, parallel tales of young couples desperately escaping cruel false fathers, each couple on the run across different regions of the country and during increasingly contemporary time periods.

299: A nurse (Bibi Andersson) is put in charge of an actress (Liv Ullmann) who no longer speaks and finds that the actress’ persona is melding with hers. One of Ingmar Bergman’s most revered motion pictures.

1883: Two old friends embark on a spiritual journey through Californian wine country. They veer dizzily sideways into a wry, comedic exploration of the crazy vicissitudes of love, friendship and the enduring war between Pinot and Cabernet.

28919: The story of serial killer Ted Bundy.

37227: A so-called “snuff” movie involving the exploits of a cult leader leading a gang of bikers in a series of supposedly real killings on film.

111961: A feminist cult survives by robbing and killing passersby, at their remote desert ranch. The North Star Dhruva cult leader Magdalena refuses to work for the Yankee dollar. Consequently she subjugates her two followers, who are forced to listen to the music of German opera all the time.

68027: After a comic introduction, we look closely at a shrimp. Eyes on stilts, color patterns, pinchered walking feet, a rostrum. We watch shrimp eat using a strong claw and a fine one; we watch digestion. After eating, shrimp clean themselves.

28565: Wendy and her brothers are whisked away to the magical world of Neverland with the hero of their stories, Peter Pan.

2790: This adaptation of the 1995 novel by José Saramago of the same name depicts an unexplained mass epidemic of “white blindness” that befalls on an unnamed city, tearing it apart when the community becomes quarantined.

7870: Alcoholic musician Martin Blair becomes the prime suspect when his cheating wife is murdered, until it is determined that he was “sleeping one off” at the time of the killing. Another man, who was being blackmailed by the murdered woman, is sent to prison for the crime.

3666: Semi-true story of the Hollywood murder that occurred at a star-studded gathering aboard William Randolph Hearst’s yacht in 1924.

32217: The legendary Joe D’Amato delivers what is perhaps the most explicit nunsploitation films ever made. As nuns become possessed by the devil, the situation only worsens when well-meaning priests try to intervene.

17398: Charlotte, a young Scottish woman, who has studied in France, is living in London during World War II. Within weeks she both falls in love with a young pilot and is recruited by the Secret Service to act as a courier for the French Resistance.

2840: When a dockworker is murdered before he can testify against corrupt New Jersey union bosses, a sullied former boxer must take a stand for his beliefs in this Academy Award-winning saga.

1637: After a family tragedy, a racist prison guard reexamines his attitudes while falling in love with the African American wife of the last prisoner he executed.

114951: After losing his crew in a fatal crash, legendary Rescue Swimmer, Ben Randall, is sent to teach at “A” School, an elite training program for Coast Guard Rescue Swimmers.

135564: In a desolate community full of drug-addled Marines and rumors of kidnapping, a wild-eyed stoner named Lou wakes up after a wild night of partying with symptoms of a strange illness and recurring visions as she struggles to get a grip on reality while stories of conspiracy spread.

115613: After an unexpected tragedy, Suzanne struggles to put her life back together during a sad, strange Christmastime in suburban Virginia.

33129: An alien is on the run in America. To get his kicks, it kills anything that gets in its way, and uses the body as a new hiding place.

135: Hsiao-Kang sells watches in the streets of Taipei for a living. A few days after his father’s death, he meets a young woman, Shiang-Chyi, who as it turns out leaves for Paris the very next day. He runs around setting all the watches and clocks in Taipei to Paris time.

113784: Fred does not approve of this world. Why should he live here, driven by the same inexorable power that forces a blade of grass through the concrete? He loses his job at a newspaper because his review of Terrence Malick’s Tree of Life is peppered with monosyllabic expletives…
Free Range/Ballad on Approving of the World

32373: Set in Edwardian England where upper lips are always stiff and men from the Colonies are not entirely to be trusted, Fisk Senior has little time or affection for his son, but when the pair visit an eccentric Indian, they start a strange journey that eventually allows the old man to find his heart.

116864: An only-in-New-York account of Ming, Al, and Antoine Yates, who lived in a social housing apartment in Harlem until news of their dwelling caused a public outcry. On the discovery that Ming was a 500 lbs. pound tiger and Al a seven-foot alligator, their story took on an astonishing dimension.
Ming of Harlem: Twenty One Storeys in the Air

3702: The personal and professional entanglements of twin sisters Jeannie and Lauren in Austin, over the ownership of Jeannie’s bright, candy-colored vintage clothing store, and the involvement of her ex-boyfriend. Soon everyone is trying to lend each other a hand but nothing is going according to plan.

1753: A high-priced law firm brings in their “fixer,” Michael Clayton, when one of their lawyers has a nervous breakdown, putting a multi-billion dollar class action suit in jeopardy. Winner of the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for Tilda Swinton.

30322: An oriental scene on a China plate comes to life to tell the story of two young lovers menaced by an overweight Emperor and a fire-breathing dragon.

92798: All fourteen-year-old Robbie Hendrick ever wanted was a family. Yet as another Mississippi summer begins, his wayward mother has run off again fearing a breakdown and he’s left to burn the days caring for his half brother, Fess.

2924: Invited to serve on the jury at a film festival, Director Ku does not care about his supposed-to-dos. Ku runs into an old friend who insists he come over for dinner, and he stays the night. Yet the next day, Ku finds himself in trouble with an alleged accusation of seducing his friend’s wife.

31178: A woman secretly suffering from kleptomania is hypnotized in an effort to cure her condition. Soon afterwards, she is found at the scene of a murder with no memory of how she got there and seemingly no way to prove her innocence.

45235: In central Gothenburg, Sweden, a group of black boys, aged 12-14, robbed other children on about 70 occasions between 2006-2008. The thieves used an elaborate scheme called the ‘brother trick’, involving advanced role-play and gang rhetoric.

27535: Director Franco Zeffirelli’s film adaptation of the famed novel by Charlotte Brontë, with Charlotte Gainsbourg in the title role.

25918: The first opening day in Muhammadyah elementary school is wonderful day for two teacher, Muslimah (Cut Mini) and Harfan (Ikranagara), and 9 students who live in Gantong village, Belintong. If the student in the school is less than 10, the school will be closed.

27949: Friends since childhood, Fanny and Marius love each other, but Marius has a secret wanderlust: every ship’s whistle stirs a longing for foreign lands…

9606: The movie borrows from the parodies of Mel Brooks like Robin Hood: Men in Tights, Blazing Saddles, and Dracula: Dead and Loving It.

102004: Quiz-show contestant Porky is the one who’s supposed to be penalized each time he misses a question, but host Daffy is the one who winds up getting safes and boulders dropped on him and deluged by torrents of water.

45351: Friendships are tested and secrets come to the surface when terminally single Rachel falls for Dex, her best friend Darcy’s fiancé.

100131: A minimalist piece, which deals with tabooed issues like gender, sexuality, desire, brutality, love and humiliation.

38313: In Buenos Aires, a few days before traveling to Spain with his beloved wife Liliana Rovira to visit their son Pedro, the leftist Literature professor Fernando Robles is compulsory retired in the University, and he concludes that it is impossible to live with his pension.

25400: As a lone spaceship proceeds on its long voyage across space, the crew are surprised to encounter a strange pyramid form. Surprise turns to horror as one by one, they discover that their darkest nightmares are all starting to become real.

87316: Set in apocalyptic Palermo peopled by ignorant, inbred, flatulent gluttons and deformed Mafiosi, a dark comedy which centers on a poor family of three-middle aged brothers who are coerced, by local Mafia honchos, into hiding a mysterious old man known as the Uncle From Brooklyn in their home.

40361: The eventful ascent of a doctor in the corrupted Italian healthcare system.

20430: June 1946: Stalin invites Russian emigres to return to the motherland. It’s a trap: when a ship-load from France arrives in Odessa, only a physician and his family are spared execution or prison.

119834: Explores the meaning of life and suggests how best to live and love.
What We Did on Our Holiday

20928: The sudden death of his wife plunges a terminally ill man into profound grief. Realizing how little he knew her and how little he showed her his affection, he devotes his last weeks to fulfilling her long-cherished dreams.

87272: An 1896 British short silent actuality film featuring top-hatted pedestrians and horse-drawn carriages passing over Blackfriars Bridge, London, which was taken from the southern end looking northwards over the Thames by July of that year,

24492: Six characters, three men and three women, from a cross-section of social groups, play sexual power games in this film from writer/director Neil LaBute.

119950: Janusz is not a man to be easily shocked. As coroner he undertakes precise research, analysing the crime scene in minute detail. Despite the extreme situations he comes up against, he works hard. Perhaps too hard.

19192: A love triangle begins between two teenage best friends, tomboyish Kerou and boycrazy Yuezhen, and a rebellious heartthrob named Shihao.

27699: A teenager escapes her provincial town and moves to the big city to find an Internet cult group called Haikyo.com where she meets the site’s web-master, and loses herself in the cult practices of this strange group—which include a unique approach to prostitution and mass suicide.

20554: Director & piano player Clint Eastwood explores his life-long passion for piano blues, using a treasure trove of rare historical footage in addition to interviews and performances by such living legends as Pinetop Perkins and Jay McShann, as well as Dave Brubeck and Marcia Ball.

45199: Pokémon: The First Movie - Mewtwo Strikes Back

42254: A satirical comedy about the excessive restrictions that children face during their vacation in a Young Pioneer camp.

95906: An unusual relationship develops between a student, who works as prostitute on the side to pay for her studies, and a brilliant, elderly academic who is one her clients.

28682: The author of a scandalously racy best-selling book tries to hide her celebrity from her provincial small town neighbors who’d be scandalized if they knew.

2477: Bab’Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul is the story of a blind dervish named Bab’Aziz and his spirited granddaughter, Ishtar. Together they wander the desert in search of a great reunion of dervishes that takes place just once every thirty years.
Bab'Aziz: The Prince That Contemplated His Soul

35191: A female forensic psychiatrist (Julianne Moore) discovers that all of one of her patient’s multiple personalities are murder victims. She will have to find out what’s happening before her time is finished.

93891: A seductive woman pushes three men to the limits toying with their sexual desires and male pride.

13215: The film retells the 1789 real-life mutiny aboard HMAV Bounty led by Fletcher Christian against the ship’s captain, William Bligh.

31057: An underachiever meets a woman who makes him reexamine his lifestyle of emotionless sexual conquests.

89033: In fascist Portugal of the late sixties a rich landowner leads an idle life of hunting, drinking and enjoying himself. He owns everything and everybody around him, including his servants and his own beautiful wife whom he keeps secluded inside his house like an emulator of the old feudal lords.

114402: A washed up actor, famous for portraying an iconic superhero, struggles to mount a Broadway play. In the days leading up to opening night, he battles his ego and attempts to recover his family, his career, and himself.

32338: Dias Sin Luz is the second short film by Jaume Balaguerò after Alicia in 1994.

95862: The teenage Tobe Hooper’s first film was a slapstick comedy. This farcical low-budget short is about three thieves who are wanted dead or alive. A bit Three Stooges, a bit Chaplin and a bit Keaton!

33162: Imbecilic best friends Lloyd Christmas and Harry Dunne stumble across a suitcase full of money left behind by Mary Swanson. The pair decide to go to Aspen to return the cash, unaware that it is connected to a kidnapping, and during the trek Lloyd and Harry find their friendship and brains tested.

53633: Inseparable childhood friends Akash, Sameer and Siddharth are just out of college and still nothing comes between them — until they each fall in love, and their wildly different approaches when it comes to women creates tension between them.

31133: A dreamy film in which two women are transported from a beach in France to New York City. Separated and lost, they frantically search for one another.

134611: Five interlocking tales of terror follow the fates of a group of weary travellers who confront their worst nightmares – and darkest secrets – over one long night on a desolate stretch of desert highway.

93589: A US politician visits his poet friend in Mont. St. Michael, France. While walking through the medieval island discussing their philosophies of life they happen upon Sonja, a scientist in recluse, who joins in their conversation.

94644: A debut about the doubts of the director Nance and his relationship with a beautiful young woman. He combines personal experiences with fiction, documentary and various animation styles. A film filled with vulnerability and humour; enthusiasm leaps at you from the screen.

1718: A man moves his two daughters to Italy after their mother dies in a car accident, in order to revitalize their lives. Genova changes all three of them as the youngest daughter starts to see the ghost of her mother, while the older one discovers her sexuality.

28836: What happened last night in Tina’s apartment? Did she sleep with Gianni willingly, or was she raped? And what was that other couple doing in the apartment with them? Tina, Gianni, Tina’s mother, and Tina’s concierge all have differing opinions in this shagadelic sex farce.

37308: The mortal son of the god Zeus embarks on a perilous journey to stop the underworld and its minions from spreading their evil to Earth as well as the heavens.

93625: Monika, a middle-aged wealthy woman, goes through a marriage crisis with her younger husband Linas. A car accident leads Monika to meeting three young girls, Kristina, Egle and Gitana, who happen to be ex-prostitutes extradited from Germany.

4728: In this adaptation of the John Collier short story “Sleeping Beauty”, inimitable auteur James B. Harris presents a dreamlike, erotic puzzle, with the tale of a melancholic jazz musician who purchases a real life Sleeping Beauty from a carnival show and whisks her away to his Gothic pleasure palace.

29610: This experimental short film by Norman McLaren is a playful exercise in intermittent animation and spasmodic imagery. Playing with the laws relating to persistence of vision and after-image on the retina of the eye, McLaren engraves pictures on blank film creating vivid, percussive effects.

32094: Achim Bornhak’s movie focuses on the restless life of Uschi Obermaier, the icon of the 1968 movement in Germany and groupie. At the age of 16, Uschi is bored by her job in a photo lab, but soon becomes the “it girl” of Munich’s club scene.

113463: Three best friends find themselves where we’ve all been – at that confusing moment in every dating relationship when you have to decide, “So… where is this going?”

14274: Three stories are told, respectively set in Tokyo, Taipei, and Shanghai.

28952: Post-teen virgin moves to New York City, falls for a cold-hearted beauty, then finds true love with a loyal lass.

34067: Johannes, a new assistant at the university, is asked to provide reports on an Algerian colleague – who is suspected of being a sleeper. He refuses, but the seed of doubt has been planted.

132932: Zhao Liang depicts the Mongolian coal mines as a journey through hell, and the beast that is civilisation.

3581: I Am So Proud of You

29774: Based on the true story of Jack DiNorscio, a mobster who defended himself in court for what would be the longest mafia trial in U.S. history.

20807: Pierre (Hardy Krüger) is a former military pilot psychologically devastated by a wartime experience. Isolated, Pierre begins to perk up when he befriends a 12-year-old urchin (Patricia Gozzi) abandoned by her father. But problems arise when their relationship is misconstrued.

104310: After serving 10 years in prison for murder, Jenny returns to society. She wants to live a quiet life and resume her responsibilities as a mother, but soon shadows from the past start to appear.

21621: Double screen film of six children playing on the street below (three sets of twins). Filmed through two adjacent cameras, one with colour film and one with black and white.

61363: The accent is on suspense in this 1971 chiller starring Susan George as teenage babysitter Amanda, who’s held captive and terrorized by her charge’s deranged father — an escapee from a mental institution intent on murdering his ex-wife.

87239: Woody Harrelson gives a ferocious performance as a dirty cop, balancing a home life with two ex-wives as he becomes embroiled in the Los Angeles Police Department’s infamous Rampart corruption scandal.

47183: With the help of three fans, the Muppets must reunite in order to save their old studio from a greedy oil tycoon.

22932: Newly arrived from Calcutta, Nandalal takes a position as the Postmaster of a tiny rural village in Bengal. He has for his servant Ratan, a young orphan girl. She is illiterate, but he teaches her how to read and write. When Nandalal falls ill, Ratan nurses him back to health…

106225: A man enters in people’s apartments at night … He watches them sleep. Dreaming. There are rumors of bombing at a great distance. And a little girl, at the window.

99721: Quirky portrait of an aloof young woman in New York City, as she looks for her own apartment and tries to move up in her job where she works as a dance studio apprentice.

44388: Goofy is attacked by a cold virus.

21745: Commissioned by the heads of the 2000 Cannes Film Festival to make an opening-night short commemorating cinema as it enters its second full century, Godard instead offers up re-edited footage of wars and Nazi atrocities, interspersed with clips of “Gigi” and his own “À bout de souffle.”

25953: Angel, a selfish and morally bankrupt man, wakes up one morning with wings on his back, in this dark comedy about a person’s battle for their soul.

66266: Cohabitating couple Gary and Brooke find their once-blissful romance on the rocks when petty spats about lemons and dirty dishes mushroom into an all-out battle for custody of their upscale Chicago condo.

24775: Jan Svankmajer’s adaptation of Edgar Allan Poe’s “The Pit and the Pendulum”.
The Pendulum, The Pit, and Hope

21895: A young married couple decides to give each other one night with someone else.

80258: Based on Jan Guillou’s Crusades trilogy about Swedish Knight Templar Arn Magnusson, this adventure saga follows the son of nobility from his monastic education to his return to the family to help fight for the crown of Sweden.

27902: A bored little boy thinks everything is a waste of time until he drives through a mysterious turnpike tollbooth in a toy car. His customary bored attitude lands him in the doldrums, but he is rescued by a magical dog and together the pair embark on a journey through the Kingdom of Wisdom.

26640: It’s a tough winter for young Julien: he meets up with his mother and she asks him to write a statement against his father for the divorce trial; he meets up with his friend Arthur and he tells him that his girl, Lolita, slept with Demian, another friend…

25837: In Washington, D.C., a female reporter faces a possible jail sentence for outing a CIA agent and refusing to reveal her source.

27866: A yakuza of Chinese descent and a Japanese cop each wage their own war against the Japanese mafia. But they are destined to meet. Their encounter will change the world.

22786: A recently orphaned girl (Diane Lane) and her cousin (Laura Dern) and sister (Marin Kanter) start a punk rock band, touring with two established metal and punk rock bands. A cynical commentary on teen angst and rampant consumerism.
Ladies and Gentlemen, the Fabulous Stains

25117: Made-for-HBO biopic of tragic supermodel Gia Carangi, played by Angelina Jolie.

78346: Partners in crime Paulie and Brian find themselves at odds after years of pulling dangerous jobs, surviving turf wars and evading a determined detective in this gritty crime drama set in South Boston.

47617: A Super Namekian named Slug comes to invade Earth. But the Z Warriors do their best to stop Slug and his gang.

23080: A comedy about two outlaws who just wanted to be wanted.

44860: With one coin to make a wish at the piazza fountain, One Man Band tells the humorously captivating tale of a peasant girl who encounters two competing street performers who’d prefer the coin find its way into their tip jars.

46831: A contemporary fable loosely based on Fyodor Dostoyevsky’s Crime and Punishment.

100426: By going to the Philippines, Imamura comes to meet people living in an extreme poverty. He discovers very quickly that some communities are under the control of cruel & armed pirates.

27146: Three friends are playing cards in a beer garden…

44904: At the royal court, a prince is presenting the princess whom he is pledged to marry, when a witch suddenly appears.

9311: Jong-du is a social misfit: fidgety, snuffling, laughing inappropriately, without a super ego. He meets Gong-ju, a young woman disabled severely by cerebral palsy. Both are abused by their families, and both are used by them as well. Is there a place in the world for these two inarticulate people?

27022: In the center of this Walter Scott classic fiction inspired film the chivalrousness and the daring stand. Ivanhoe, the disowned knight join to the bravehearted and high-minded Robin Hood, the valiant of Forest Sherwood. They want King Richard to rule the kingdom instead of evil Prince John.

139184: A Pulitzer-winning writer grapples with being a widower and father after a mental breakdown, while, 27 years later, his grown daughter struggles to forge connections of her own.

26278: In the second installment of the parodic Fantomas series, the title arch criminal and master of disguise kidnaps prominent scientist Prof. Marchand in order to develop a new powerful weapon to threaten the world.

19729: A down-on-his-luck ex-GI finds himself framed for an armored car robbery. When he’s finally released for lack of evidence—after having been beaten up and tortured by the police—he sets out to discover who set him up, and why.

66496: Returning to college after a stint in the navy, Eun-shik takes up a hardcore fitness regimen with the Cha Ryu group. But he’s distracted from his routine by gorgeous Eun-hyo and the female aerobics team that trains in the same gym.

107523: When Christian, an LA trust-fund kid with casual ties to Hollywood, learns of a secret affair between Tara and the lead of his film project, Ryan, he spirals out of control, and his cruel mind games escalate into an act of bloody violence.

87765: A short black-and-white silent actuality film featuring two Edison employees with boxing gloves, pretending to spar in a boxing ring, which was an experimental demonstration film never publicly shown.

24185: Isolated, alone and socially awkward but with an underlying capability of violence, Tony is an unusual and unforgettable character brought to the screen by first time feature director Gerard Johnson.

118261: A psychological thriller, based on one of the most controversial court cases in the Netherlands. Lucia, a nurse, is sentenced to life imprisonment for allegedly having killed at least seven babies and elderly people.

8383: On his first day on the job as a narcotics officer, a rookie cop works with a rogue detective who isn’t what he appears as.

40676: A young refugee and his mother flee war and ethnic cleansing in the breakaway Georgian region of Abkhazia, leaving his father behind.

45996: Oliver Stone’s second documentary on/interview with Fidel Castro specifically addresses his country’s recent crackdown on Cuban dissidents; namely, the execution of three men who hijacked a ferry to the United States.

43801: The Henderson family’s car hits an animal in the road. At first they fear it was a man, but when they examine the “body” they find it’s a “bigfoot”. They think it’s dead so they decide to take it home. Far from being the ferocious monster they fear “Harry” to be, he’s a friendly giant.

90016: A film of memories, we follow a young ethnomusicologist who leaves Istanbul in search of her Kurdish lover. Along the way she records testimonies of Kurdish survivors, meets a young man who shares her interests and gradually gets closer to resolving what has happened to her friend.

109485: A group of filmmakers visit Ingmar Bergman’s house on the remote Swedish island of Faro to discuss his legacy.

28072: A very interesting attempt to go beyond imposed filmic and social schemas. Shot with a hidden camera at the counter of the (state-owned) Social Security office, this satire on bureaucracy and clerical soullessness is right on target.

2287: Lovers Mickey and Mallory Knox, both products of abusive upbringings, murder Mallory’s lecherous parents and go on a cross country killing spree, which becomes a media sensation in this controversial and violent satire.

29228: Bringing his unique sense of humor to this bizarre and original piece of moviemaking, Tom Waits takes the audience through a musical journey with his jazzy, quirky, bluesy tunes presented as you would never, ever, ever expect.

30881: This autumn, Dr. Earl Headley is eagerly demonstrating what seems to be a miraculous cure for tuberculosis. Yet not far from where he is working, the disease seems ready to claim yet another life, a young woman named Winifred, who is already seriously ill.

37730: Author Rudyard Kipling and his wife search for their 18-year-old son after he goes missing during World War I.

14728: The ambitious criminal Rico moves from the country to the big city and joins Sam Vettori’s gang.

34947: A man named Mr. Smith delivers a woman’s baby during a shootout, and is then called upon to protect the newborn from the army of gunmen.

35605: Through the reflection in the mirror, a girl witnesses her mother’s boyfriend’s murder.

4274: Bing Crosby does the Academy Award-bid bit in the atypical role of a self-pitying alcoholic, but it was his co-star, a deglamorized Grace Kelly, who won the Oscar for her performance in The Country Girl.

51092: Dr. Travis Ryer chases the ultimate thrill — hunting dinosaurs — by turning back the clock with the help of a time-travel outfitter run by Charles Hatton. But after he unwittingly destroys a butterfly-like creature, Ryer’s outing goes awry.

28116: As one video wants to be a film, a filmmaker travels across the world in search of another filmmaker.

6225: George Bernard Shaw’s breezy, delightful dramatization of the classic fable—about a Christian captive saved from death at the Colosseum because of his kind act of pulling a thorn from a lion’s paw—was written as a meditation on modern Christian values.

52299: A priest who’s spent 20 years in a Siberian labor camp rises to become the first Russian pope in this passionate drama. Despite world crisis and the prospect of global nuclear war, the newly elected pope refuses to lose touch with the people.

37654: Bye Bye Bluebird relates the satirical tale of two eccentric young women who, after years abroad, return to their native Faroe Islands, and embark on a strange road trip.

95142: Jacky Bonnot, 32, a fan of haute cusine and with a definite talent, dreams of success and opening a great restaurant. However the financial situation of he and his wife obliges him to accept menial jobs that lead nowhere. Up until the day he crosses paths with Alexandre Vauclair…

33842: A bad Polish actor is just trying to make a living when what should intrude but World War II in the form of an invasion…
To Be or Not to Be

1244: One of the most important directors of all time, Luis Buñuel was also one of the most fascinating and universal personalities of the 20th century. With unpublished photos and footage material, and comments by friend and scripwriter Jean-Claude Carrière.
The Last Script: Remembering Luis Buñuel

32664: A local prince in British Burma has been killed, apparently by his prospecting partner Jim Brecan. The bereaved father wants Brecan’s head, no questions asked, but Captain Cardigan of the colonial police hopes to find him first for a fair trial.

3215: After the end of the four-year civil war in Chad, all war criminals were given amnesty, including Nassara, now a modest baker. It is he who 16-year-old Atim is looking for to avenge the death of his father. Atim has Nassara take him on as an apprentice and patiently waits for the right moment.

422: Already stretched in a loyalty tug of war between Triad bosses and his loose cannon partner, Wah (Andy Lau), a rising star in the Hong Kong underworld, finds himself caught in an escalating test of wills involving his beautiful cousin and a mob turncoat.

10426: A writer must turn out a novel in thirty days or face the wrath of loan sharks.

31977: Robert Rath is a seasoned hitman who just wants out of the business with no back talk. But, as things go, it ain’t so easy. A younger, peppier assassin named Bain is having a field day trying to kill said older assassin.

34697: An accountant is introduced to a mysterious sex club known as The List by his lawyer friend. But in this new world, he soon becomes the prime suspect in a woman’s disappearance and a multi-million dollar heist.

3371: A disparate group of stereotypical highschoolers serve a Saturday detention together. As the day progresses, the barriers between them begin to break and by nightfall, these comrades in crime question whether school wil ever be the same.

11718: ohn Russell, disdained by his “respectable” fellow stagecoach passengers because he was raised by Indians, becomes their only hope for survival when they are set upon by outlaws.

29184: Employees of the Sleeptite Pajama Factory are looking for a whopping seven-and-a-half cent an hour increase and they won’t take no for an answer. Babe Williams is their feisty employee representative but she may have found her match in shop superintendent Sid Sorokin.

86908: A 1901 British short silent comedy film featuring a gentleman being entertained by the little people who emerge from the cheese at his table, which combined the jump-cut with superimposition.
Cheese Mites; or, Lilliputians in a London Restaurant

42708: The film is about inhabitants of Antarctica penguins, about their existence full of dangers, about adventures of penguin Lolo who being inquisitive since the birth, learns a lot of interesting about the world, the nature and the environment.
Adventures of The Little Penguin Lolo

18694: Headbangers Terry and Dean explore the depths of friendship, and the art and science of drinking beer like a man.

104763: Kali is ten. Her parents Rahul and Shalini are divorced. Kali now lives with her mother and her step-father Shoumik, who heads the police detection squad in the city of Mumbai. One particular Saturday, when kali is out with her father Rahul, she disappears…

25394: A woman suspected of murdering her doctor boyfriend has an identical twin sister. When both twins have an alibi for the night of the murder, a psychiatrist is called in to assist a detective in solving the case.

101883: Comedy showing various incarnations of Ugo Fantozzi through the ages – from the Garden of Eden to the Space Age. Throughout the ages he is accompanied by his wife Pina, and daughter Mariangela.

23203: Maxi, a boy on the cusp of his teens, is already comfortable with his homosexual feelings, with acceptance from his family. When Maxi is assaulted one evening, Victor, a police officer, comes to his aid. Maxi soon develops a crush on Victor, who shows a platonic affection for the young lad.

41503: An ex-con is used by police to lure a criminal out of hiding.

119114: Godard’s filmed letter to Cannes Festival President Gilles Jacob.

23367: A look behind the scenes during the making of Stanley Kubrick’s The Shining.

86410: When a brother and sister who share a dark secret run away to a densely wooded nature preserve, they don’t realize that a psychopathic killer walks among them. But what happens next is hardly the familiar horror formula you might expect.

104607: Based on the 1930 classic by Faulkner, it is the story of the death of Addie Bundren and her family’s quest to honor her wish to be buried in the nearby town of Jefferson.

46406: An exquisite jewel: an unexpected, eloquent, seemingly simple yet intensely concentrated dance for a pair of hands

24306: After an encounter with a neck-biter, a publishing executive thinks that he’s turning into a vampire.

39415: Ambitious yakuza Kenji befriends harmonica-playing bartender Chuji, who moonlights as a part-time drug-dealer for the opposing gang. Their friendship is threatened by Kenji’s plans for advancement, as well as by his bodyguard’s growing jealousy of Chuji.

40591: Lacking consciences because they were born during a solar eclipse, a trio of 10-year-olds embark on an indiscriminate killing spree.

22291: Set in 1955, the residents of a small Montana community are forced to move their homes to make way for a new dam.

44457: This is a movie about two people (Gigi Leung and Takeshi Kaneshiro), who are destined to be together but by some twist of circumstances they never find each other.

25038: In a small town in Japan, Kirie comes upon her boyfriend’s father silently videotaping a snail. He seems unaware of her presence.  Later, the mans obsession with spirals becomes more and more bizarre, ending in his suicide in a washing machine which turn his body into a spiral.

24262: Three stories offer different perspectives of the AIDS epidemic set in Africa, Canada and China.

87482: A short black-and-white silent trick film featuring a clown trying to shoot fruit of the head of a dummy which comes to life, which shows a level of onscreen violence not previously seen in a surviving Méliès film.

26233: This project gathered together over 80 young people from Rio’s “favelas” (slums) to film five stories, capturing different facets of life in the favela.

18538: A remake of the 1960 film directed by Alfred Hitchcock. Although this version is in color, features a different cast, and has been set in a contemporary timeframe, it is closer to a shot-for-shot remake than most remakes, often copying Hitchcock’s camera movements and editing.

45769: A documentary experiment by a pair of young Russian filmmakers who let fifty selected individuals record their lives on camera. The stories of three of them, whose lives intersect, ultimately formed the basis for this documentary.

31424: A young man finds a back door into a military central computer in which reality is confused with game-playing, possibly starting World War III.

95109: Liam (Liam Cunningham) and Michael (Michael Fassbender) are professional safe crackers who meet on a simple job to relieve an office safe from its contents. The catch is a light activated alarm system impelling the men to embark on a pitch black heist.

33809: Paul Thomas Anderson’s music video for Fiona Apple’s “Paper Bag.”

2004: The Day I Became a Woman

33475: Ex-convict Danny Kean decides to become honest as a photographer for a paper. He falls in love with Patricia, the daughter of the policeman who arrested him. Mr Nolan, her father, doesn’t like that relation at first, but McLean, Kean’s boss, convinces him of Kean’s good nature.

12840: Pasqualino, an Italian everyman, deserts the army during World War II. Germans capture him and send him to a prison camp, where he does just about anything to survive.

11637: Just north of London live Wendy, Andy, and their twenty-something twins, Natalie and Nicola. Wendy clerks in a shop, Andy is a cook who forever puts off home remodeling projects, Natalie is a plumber and Nicola is jobless. This film is about how they interact and play out family, conflict and love.

4193: The first feature-length effort by documentary filmmakers Joe Berlinger and Bruce Sinofsky, Brother’s Keeper unfolds a strange-but-true story about a most unorthodox family.
