8162: The story of the relationship between painter Dora Carrington and author Lytton Strachey in a World War One England of cottages and countryside.

38749: Jae-jun (Youngwoong JaeJong) delivers letters to heaven from those who can’t get over the loss of their loved ones. One day Ha-na (Han Hyo-joo), who writes to her late boyfriend, discovers Jae-jun’s secret identity. He offers her a part-time job assisting him, and they set off on a 14-day journey.

24200: Raya Martin’s lyrically silent poem about the 1896 Philippine revolt.
A Short Film About the Indio Nacional (or the Prolonged Sorrow of the Filipinos)

159550: We follow a girl, at the end of the adolescence, Ana, who does not know any more who she is and what she wants, but who chooses to fight, to arm herself, and who finds in the group, in the discipline, and sometimes even in the alienation, a stand to be.

99254: A lonely composer commits suicide in his apartment. By means of a webcam that the victim mounted on a tripod and pointed at the middle of the room, we are able to follow the commotion that subsequently takes place in his flat.
Death of a Man in Balkans

41405: This is the story of a disoriented and vulnerable woman, overburdened with daily life problems and more: her belongings are impounded, her cosmetics shop has been closed down, and her children are forced to go to a public school.

23305: A film-within-a-film thriller about two teen girls among a small group of people whom are terrorized in a movie theater by a killer while watching a horror film about a murderous optometrist who stalks his victims in a movie theater in the film.

126427: The passionate and complicated story, seen through the years, of a couple with a child.

107812: Bugs Bunny reflects on his past cartoon exploits.

38581: The captain of a submarine sunk by the Japanese during WWII is finally given a chance to skipper another sub after a year of working a desk job. His singleminded determination for revenge against the destroyer that sunk his previous vessel puts his new crew in unneccessary danger.

Black Mirror: Hated in the Nation

25292: The tale of a young girl who loves to dance and chooses to marry a log driver over his more well-to-do competitor.

18792: An impoverished backward nation declares a war on the United States of America, hoping to lose, but things don’t go according to plan.

26099: Proud country, a taste of young paradise, Rumania, somewhere in the early Eighties, a little like our Fifties. Horiatu, the soldier, dreams about fucking. Cristina, still in high school, has nothing against it, but not before engagement. It’s a principle.

21354: The powerful businessman Henrik Vanger invites Mikael to an investigation work. He gets surprised when realizes that the service has nothing to do with financial scandals, but with the disappearance of Vanger`s niece, 36 years previously, in a family meeting.
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

87374: The history of the Sicilian island of fishermen, almost intact. Just lapped by tourism, which also begins to change behaviors and attitudes of the islanders.

23659: The “panchoneras” – women from Cantabria (Spain) who traditionally work as fishmongers – face an alien invasion.

24594: Two orphans flee a world stricken by war and death, across an ash desert, to reach a city whose inhabitants have become guardians of silence.

I Killed My Lesbian Wife, Hung Her on a Meat Hook, and Now I Have a Three-Picture Deal at Disney

42236: Bimbo the dog suffers the nightmarish consequences of stealing a chicken.

22567: Five aspects of a peopled scene are repeated 21 times by duplication. Black frames interrupt running. It is more interesting to be thoroughly exasperated than merely distracted by some boringly mediocrity. – Kurt Kren

8792: Two country handymen and a seismology student discover a desolate town infested with gigantic man-eating creatures that live underground.

81387: Decades after a group of rock-obsessed kids called the Secret Base Gang wrote a Book of Prophecies that ended up coming true, the world is still wrestling with the consequences in a postapocalyptic society ruled by the fiendish Friend.

87210: Saturn Films reveals everything. Quick review of the first Austrian production company specializing exclusively in erotic film.

25506: The ever-prolific Takashi Miike directs this wild and woolly prison drama, reportedly based on real-life cases of Japanese imprisoned abroad.

23491: Straight shooting Lemonade Joe cleans up Stetson City, in this musical parody of early Westerns, after shooting the pants off villain Old Pistol. Joe’s endorsement of Kolaloka (Crazy Cola) lemonade as the refresher that assures deadly aim, convinces the Arizona sin-town to abstain from alcohol.

100153: Agent Coulson stops at a convenience store and deals with a coincidental robbery during his visit.
Marvel One-Shots: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Thor's Hammer

151391: A pair of cops investigating a drug invasion stumble upon a mysterious bank vault.

2822: New York. A little six-year-old girl is missing. Six months later, the child still has not been found. Her father, William Keane, makes the acquaintance of a single mother and her little daughter. He hides his story from them, and tries to start anew with them.

50909: In this slapstick comedy from director David Zucker, an eager young man house-sits for his mean boss, hoping to use it as an opportunity to win the heart of the boss’s daughter, Lisa, on whom he’s long had a crush.

30224: In HOME STORIES Müller transforms linear, syntagmatic events into a world of purified emotion expressed in closely related, paradigmatic elements, condensing them into a grand poem of fear."

32275: A series of interrelated episodes featuring the erotic escapades of a young New York heiress and the people associated with her.

10037: Young workers begin to die in a small village in Cornwall, only to return as undead slaves under the control of a mysterious voodoo priest.

30340: Three fellows dream of prize money and a chance for a real Hollywood contract by winning the Liberty-Pete Smith amateur movie contest.

1731: Batman faces his greatest challenge yet against the Joker, a nihilistic villain with dark plans for Gotham City.

95437: Big Star: Nothing Can Hurt Me

157: During a sweltering summer vacation on the Aegean coast, the relationship between middle-aged professor Isa (played by Ceylan himself) and his younger, television producer girlfriend Bahar (the luminous Ebru Ceylan, Ceylan’s real-life wife) brutally implodes.

34286: A middle-aged woman, traumatized from the death of her adulterous lover, moves into a room at a New Orleans boarding house where the blind landlord becomes suspicious to her activities of continuing her affair with her dead lover.

3760: Dan Ballard, a respected citizen in the western town of Silver Lode, has his wedding interrupted by four men led by Ned McCarthy, an old acquaintance who, as a US Marshal, arrests Ballard for the murder of his brother and the theft of $20,000.

32311: Larry Talbot chips Frankenstein’s monster out of a block of ice. When Talbot changes to the Wolf Man, the two creatures do battle.

2696: Woody Allen plays a consumer products tester named Mellish who joins a Latin American revolution after getting rejected by political activist Nancy, who is looking for someone with more political clout in a mate.

114787: Three brothers from the Aspromonte region in Calabria are not affiliated with the mighty and deadly ‘ndrangheta organization but are involved in numerous and widespread criminal activities. The infernal journey of the three protagonists traces an ever widening path of blood and violence…

15: In one of the all-time classic chase films, Buster Keaton must impress the girl he loves by becoming a business man, even if that means “borrowing” a cop’s wallet, accidentally stealing a family’s entire household, and outrunning the city’s entire police force!

37321: Chaz Bono was a male trapped in a female shell for as long as he can remember. Growing up as Sonny and Cher’s adorable golden-haired daughter in a body he felt wasn’t his own was a crucible it took years to transcend.

91739: A man in a decaying room looks at an old photograph of himself and tries to recreate the happiness he once felt.
The Man in the Lower-Left Hand Corner of the Photograph

33383: Africa – Land of the evershining sun, German soldiers fulfilling a UN mission. For General Brenner a dream comes true: Here, where the people are still native and simple, the German can prove his abilities.

112774: A young girl has a one-night stand with a random stranger and contracts, what she thinks is, a sexually-transmitted disease – but is actually something much worse.

93768: When a group of petty criminals is hired by a mysterious party to retrieve a rare piece of found footage from a rundown house in the middle of nowhere, they soon realize that the job isn’t going to be as easy as they thought.

30188: “When a nationalistic wealthy landowner’s idealist son falls for a non-muslim prostitute, he finds himself in a conflict between his feelings and politics under the shadow of the " Events of September 6th-7th in 1955.

39004: A fond farewell to the unique Kodachrome film stock Dorsky used to shoot most of his extraordinarily beautiful films.

27960: A glowing orb terrorizes a young girl with a collection of stories of dark fantasy, eroticism and horror.

103277: A Roma family living far away from the urban centres of Bosnia-Herzegovina. The father Nazif salvages metal from old cars and sells it to a scrap-dealer. The mother Senada keeps the house tidy, cooks, bakes and cares for their two small daughters.

25931: A group of oversexed militants named after the days of the week try to steal weapons from a U.S. Army base.

26746: A man who falls in love with the woman who received his wife’s heart must decide which woman it is who holds his heart.

25429: An unusual visit to a large, empty apartment.  Is it empty or not?  Maybe a family has lived there or is going to live there…Maybe a young girl is going to escape from there…Maybe some of the old-timers who lived there have never left.
7p., cuis., s. de b., ... à saisir

78678: When Tala and Leyla meet in London and begin to have feelings for each other, it’s a problem. Tala’s wealthy Middle Eastern family is currently planning her wedding, while Leyla is dating Tala’s male friend.

27804: A neglected young wife responds to her husband’s coldness by venturing into the snowy wastes and transforming into a reindeer. Symbolically, every man who hunts this deer comes to a bad end. And then the husband goes hunting…

24673: Experimental short uses Ray Charles’ “What’d I Say” as accompaniment to constantly shifting collage of female nude, cartoons, and newsreels of atomic bomb explosions.

58817: A Department of Defense supercomputer known as Colossus develops its own intelligence independent of the machine’s programmers; starts sharing classified information with Guardian, its Soviet counterpart; and launches a plan for global domination.

Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine

Her life then becomes entwined with life at the Hôtel du Nord and, oddly, with another colorful couple—a young woman and her pimp…

21643: Lugubrious Finns Valto and Reino take to the road in search of coffee and vodka, without which their lives are not worth living.
Take Care of Your Scarf, Tatiana

42319: Producer Carl Denham returns to Skull Island in search of more monsters.

104372: An obsessive, self-styled “Archivist” roams the city collecting strange objects and documents.

47085: After ruining his reputation with the town, a courageous chicken must come to the rescue of his fellow citizens when aliens start an invasion.

40348: Tom returns to his hometown on the tenth anniversary of the Valentine’s night massacre that claimed the lives of 22 people. Instead of a homecoming, however, Tom finds himself suspected of committing the murders, and it seems like his old flame is the only one will believes he’s innocent.

22448: Eagle Pennell’s first feature details the tragi-comic struggles of two small-time schemers desperate to land their big break.  A landmark of American independent film.

23612: The film documents the religious practices of a black community in Brooklyn, New York. Huie the preacher sings and encourages the faithful who have packed the halls to participate enthusiastically.

38096: The movie consist of 13 separate episodes each handling a period between 1960 and 1970. The length of these periods varies from one day to some years. It tells the story of a group of people in Munich (mostly music and film students).
Heimat 2 - A Chronicle of a Generation

98519: The music video for “Video Games” was directed and edited by Del Rey and features video clips of skateboarders, cartoons, shots from old movies, and paparazzi footage of Paz de la Huerta falling down while intoxicated.

106247: In an odd coffee shop, an old man, Salah, waits for clients without any hope. An elegant man come to make him an unexpected offer : to buy his shadow in exchange for anything he would ever desire. Salah refuses, and gets rid of him. But the visitor comes back during his dream, as a White Angel.

22950: Set in 1926 when Japanese tradition was much stronger, this standard drama looks at the inner workings of a small family, especially the relationship between a sister and brother.  —allmovie

119979: Hana is growing up in an archaic alpine landscape in Albania where the old codes and traditional gender roles prevail. She escapes the fate of a wife and servant when, in accordance with the Kanun, the traditional Albanian law, she pledges herself to life-long virginity.

26896: What if we could build a system to help police developing nations. What if it could be rebuilt and improved upon. What if…

119505: A loving father finds a clown suit for his son’s birthday party, only to realize the suit is part of an evil curse that turns its wearer into a killer.

23776: An absurdist tale of master and slave that mixes comedy, cruelty, and a motley array of musical sounds.

20901: This film follows Sergio through his life after the departure of his wife, parents and friends in the wake of the Bay of Pigs incident. He observes the constant threat of invasion while chasing young women in Havana before finally meeting a young girl he seeks to mold into the image of his ex-wife.

91616: A man suffers from an eye defect; he receives treatment and the eye is cured. The king suffers from the same complaint but he does not receive treatment and instead imposes his own distorted view of things on his people.

3487: A scholarly, wide-eyed teenage girl in the suburbs of London during the 1960s is shown a life of culture and refinement by a dashing playboy nearly twice her age.

28428: Humberto Fuentes is a wealthy doctor whose wife has recently died. In spite of the advice of his children, he takes a trip to visit his former students who now work in impoverished villages. His trip soon becomes a quest.

34005: Zed has only just arrived in the beautiful Paris and already he’s up to no good. Having just slept with a call girl, he spends a night on the town with his dangerous friends. They all decide to rob a bank the following day.

29716: “Duke Ellington and his all-colored orchestra put over the hot jazz – and how.” —Film Daily, 1929.  Dudley Murphy collaborated with Fernand Léger on Ballet mecanique in 1924 and seasons this film with avant-garde sequences while also telling a story.

91772: The film speaks of student demonstrations in Belgrade, 1969 and of the critical quality, enthusiasm and discipline of this form of protest. It was the most powerful public criticism of ‘’red bourgeoisie’’ – members of communist apparatus, who suppressed creativity and affirmation of new generations.

32192: Famous theater rioter and performer Christoph Schlingensief has his roots in film. This portrait shows many of his early films for the first time.

50692: The McCandles ranch is run over by a gang of cutthroats led by the evil John Fain. They kidnap little Jacob McCandles and hold him for a million dollar ransom. There is only one man who is brave enough and smart enough to bring him back and that man is Big Jake.

94892: This bold debut film by author Stephen Elliott, a visual love letter to San Francisco, is the story of high school student Angelina (a mesmerizing Ashley Hinshaw), whose choices lead her from a depressing home life and dead-end job in Los Angeles to the fetish-filled Bay Area adult film world.

130901: Director Jacob Hatley’s intimate documentary finds Mr. Helm in Woodstock, NY, creating his first studio album in 25 years. Shot during the course of two-plus years, the film focuses on this founding member of The Band after his 2007 comeback album, Dirt Farmer, brought him back to the spotlight.
Ain't in It for My Health: A Film About Levon Helm

28930: In the midst of World War II, the story of the affair of a young woman, married to a man bound to a wheelchair, with a deserter from the Italian army, intertwines with that of the grab of power of a very fanatical local fascist leader, who gets the hold with a massacre of Pacific opposers…

31399: Ascanio Celestini gets behind the camera to narrate the lives of those who have known the experience in the asylum. Memories and stories of those who lived in a mental hospital, a trip through the wildest imagination and the reality of unspeakable fears insurmountable.

97935: Second single off Depeche Mode’s Songs of Faith and Devotion, directed by Anton Corbijn.

31035: A convicted arsonist looks to manipulate a parole officer into a plan to secure his parole by placing his beautiful wife in the lawman’s path.

54884: When Van Wilder, a party-loving student shuffling through his seventh year in college, learns that his father won’t pay for another semester, he has to figure out a way to pay for his education all by himself.

33064: Based on the award winning play by Julian Mitchell, the film explores the effect of Public School life in the 1930’s on Guy Bennett as his homosexuality and unwillingness to “play the game” turns him eastwards towards communist Russia.

89135: The acclaimed musician’s rigorous touring year culminates in perpetual fever as he crosses the finish line on crutches from an onstage injury. Concert documentary features collaborators Martin Dosh, Annie Clark of St. Vincent, and others.

35097: Beth B, in collaboration with legendary downtown performance artist/musician Lydia Lunch, creates a chilling yet poetic vision of despairing nihilism — literally, a “meditation on death.” In this noirishly rendered narrative, a woman negotiates the banalities of life.

52877: Con man Tom Turner is sentenced to employment in the dead letter department of the post office to avoid a prison stretch. Ever the opportunist, Turner plunders valuables from undeliverable mail and discarded letters. But now he’s in for a surprise.

11342: Barbra Streisand stars as a strong-willed matchmaker who travels to Yonkers, New York in an attempt to find a match for the miserly “well-known unmarried half-a-millionaire”.

2571: Like the films of another great Russian filmmaker, Andrei Tarkovsky, this film is about memory and nostalgia.

40230: It’s the world of humans and animals and Danny is the ambitious one coming to Hollywood to become film star where he is immediately cast in musical epic.

118743: Four stories of love and disgust between men of different generations facing their conflicts and their fears.

26592: The film’s protagonist, the guesser, joins the film’s audience of children in solving three riddles. The riddles are presented as animated picture puzzles.

20405: English naturalist Charles Darwin struggles to find a balance between his revolutionary theories on evolution and the relationship with religious wife, whose faith contradicts his work.

42305: The whole clique of Cruchot’s police station is retired. Now he lives with his rich wife in her castle – and is bored almost to death. He fights with the butler, because he isn’t even allowed to do the simple works.

20879: A simple immigration issue spins wildly out of control for those involved, ranging from the President of the United States, to a news producer.

47099: Horton the elephant watches over the egg of a lazy mother bird.

40354: In 1840’s Mexico, wealthy landowner Don Diego Vega learns of his late father’s secret as Zorro, the masked folk hero, and Vega adopts his new persona.

25799: A small time thug collecting debts for the local triad is torn between his criminal aspirations and his devotion to his family.

25435: After doing a fiction film about Jacques’ childhood (Jacquot de Nantes), my idea was to make a documentary—a relatively objective one—about Jacques Demy, as an adult and a filmmaker.  —Agnès Varda

47335: An art student is in love with a woman who resembles the ideal female form used in artistic study.

45364: In this short by Georges Méliès, an inventor dreams that his newly designed airship takes flight.
Inventor Crazybrains and His Wonderful Airship

8971: Over the years, a child’s romantic ideals about death blossom into necrophilia, the study of embalming and the most profound relationship of her life.

38242: When two boys leave for a philosophical journey and only one is prepared for it, their worlds will part forever.

39018: To save the only child of the Zhao Family, whose whole clan is massacred at the hands of a nefarious minister, a doctor sacrifices his own son, and later becomes intent on seeking vengeance against the minister after the child grows up.

8815: Gene Wilder plays Sherlock Holmes’ younger brother who is annoyed that he has had to live in Sherlock’s shadow for so long.
The Adventure of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother

27500: In the Californian desert, an incredulous audience attends a telepathic tire’s adventures which is mysteriously attracted by a beautiful young lady. An investigation begins.

21497: Cynthia Beatt and Tilda Swinton re-trace the line of the Berlin Wall that once isolated Berlin from East and West Germany.  The film describes this journey, the print of a second foot, a Wall’s fall and 21 years later, through varied landscapes, this time on both sides of the former Wall.

15298: An unhappy wife becomes romantically entangled with her handyman, while the handyman’s wife becomes involved with the unhappy wife’s spouse.

108135: Honeymooning couples of various animalspecies take a rocket ship excursion to the moon. Spectacular lunar scenery.

3737: A follow-up to filmmaker Penelope Spheeris’ classic 1981 “punk” documentary hits the glam metal circuit. Ozzy Osbourne, Gene Simmons, Joe Perry and Steven Tyler are among the icons interviewed in this film.
The Decline of Western Civilization Part II: The Metal Years

74793: Best friends Alice and Darlene journey to Thailand to celebrate their high school graduation. But after falling in with a charming con artist, they’re busted at the Hong Kong airport for smuggling narcotics they didn’t know they were carrying.

32346: A millionairess and a doctor cannot marry until they meet conditions set-up by their respective parents.

28798: Between 1986 and 1990, Arthur Aristakisian lived among the tramps and beggars of Kishinov, the Moldavian capital, studying them and empathising with their plight.

115626: An ambitious tax attorney decides to represent an old friend in court.

1602: Everything that happens to us “down here” is written “up there”: this is Tiago’s favorite phrase, a chauffeur by profession, he uses to justify his surprising actions when he drives his boss to his endless love-affairs.

93493: A retired master car thief must come back to the industry and steal 50 cars with his crew in one night to save his brother’s life.

116549: Noah Baumbach’s exploration of aging, ambition and success stars Ben Stiller and Naomi Watts as a middle-aged couple whose career and marriage are overturned when a disarming young couple enters their lives.

2875: A loser of a crook and his wife strike it rich when a botched bank job’s cover business becomes a spectacular success.

31029: A budding electronica artist (Laurent Lucas) gives up his shot at stardom to pursue a woman whose voice he hears merely from a telephone dating network.

33078: In a country shaken by major political events, three generations of a Greek family clash over an inside-the-family adoption.

95978: Three shorts created under an almost arbitrary manifesto.

2409: It is a story about the continuity and collapse of history, the power of suppression, and the terror of reconciliation; loyalty, treason and revenge.

114518: A teenage boy is sent to a juvenile reform facility in the wilderness. As we learn about the tragic events that sent him there, his struggle becomes one for survival with the inmates, the counselors, and with the retired war colonel in charge.

3653: Notorious gunfighter Jimmy Ringo rides into town to find his true love, who doesn’t want to see him. He hasn’t come looking for trouble, but trouble finds him around every corner.

34019: A mini opera/musical. Two cupid-like goddesses decide to intervene with the affairs of the mortals.

28550: While on a train, a teenage boy thinks about his life and the flamboyant aunt whose friendship acted as an emotional shield from his troubled family. This film evokes the haunting quality of memory while creating a heartfelt portrait of a boy’s life in a rural 1940s Southern town.

35243: Roscoe is a doctor who falls in love with a pretty woman whose boyfriend, in turn, falls in love with Roscoe’s wife’s jewelry.

111528: Three sixty-something friends take a break from their day-to-day lives to throw a bachelor party in Las Vegas for their last remaining single pal.

37212: Angela is back, in the form of an angry inner-city camper on the hunt for blood.

36048: Two couples of Italian immigrants in Brazil are part of a game that leads to treason and brings serious consequences to those who lose.

31385: A crime lord ascends to power and becomes megalomaniacal while a maverick police detective vows to stop him.

4756: Leona Stevenson is an alluring, wealthy, and irritating hypochondriac whose psychosomatic illness has her bedridden. Leona’s only lifeline is the telephone, which she uses to excess. One evening, Leona impatiently tries to locate her henpecked husband Henry who is late in coming home.

108299: Ann, a reclusive elegant lady, with an obsession for butterflies, is surprisingly befriended by the eerily beautiful young Alice.

35327: A Turkish drama film about a devoted family man who comes home from work one day to find his house deserted.

17165: Nathan, a brilliant New York lawyer who leads a life of professional success, but his private life is pretty dismal since he divorced Claire, his only love. Until he meets Doctor Kay, a mysterious doctor who introduces himself as a “Messenger.”

28848: Traumatic incidents, conflicts, and bloody quarrels awaiting the Funuke family members who return home to bury their parents.
Funuke: Show Some Love, You Losers!

42: A 10-year-old Pakistani boy mistakenly crosses over to India, resulting in immense changes on the lives of people living on both sides of the border.

6707: Jack Nicholson and Bruce Dern play estranged siblings David and Jason, the former a depressive late-night-radio talk show host, the latter an extroverted con man; when Jason drags his younger brother to a dreary Atlantic City and into a real-estate scam, events spiral toward tragedy.

94596: A chronicle of the struggles of a young woman held captive by her father and forced into prostitution in the Bicol region of the Philippines. Her story eventually intersects with that of a farmer and his dying wife, as well as that of two treasure seekers from the city.

24624: The familiar tragic story of Vincent van Gogh is broadened by focusing as well on his brother Theodore, who helped support Vincent. The movie also provides a nice view of the locations which Vincent painted.

27853: A teenager has to deal with his girlfriend dumping him among family crises, homicidal paper boys, and a rival skier.

25802: Father Greg Pilkington is torn between his call as a conservative Catholic priest and his secret life as a homosexual with a gay lover, frowned upon by the Church.

123157: Al Caruso, John Gresco and Jack Amoruso are three gangsters working for the Genovese family. However, their efforts are more than headache-inducing, and when they are given one last chance: To protect the boss’s aunt, she is accidentally killed and the three men are sentenced to death.
La leggenda di Al, John e Jack

26675: The main character (played by Leos Sucharípa) is an elderly man, admittedly competent, but not very responsible. In the continuous fear, he is trying to do as much as he can but, instead of confidence, he only finds out that in the real life one cannot just take but must give as well.
The Very Late Afternoon of a Faun

44175: The movie is about an unusual band of friends and their involvement of a kidnapping. The friends consist of six guys with no-good jobs, or odd jobs that comes their way living together in an old, old house with a nosey neighbour.

39053: A witty, snow-steeped French comedy thriller that riffs on the Marilyn Monroe legend, as a mystery writer unravels the death of a small-town beauty (Sophie Quinton).

103220: An art auctioneer who has become mixed up with a group of criminals partners with a hypnotherapist in order to recover a lost painting.

65058: Once again donning a disguise as butterball granny Big Momma, FBI agent Turner goes undercover to stop a national security threat in this madcap sequel. Modeling the latest in frumpy dresses, Turner infiltrates a suspect’s house by posing as a nanny.

46040: Various stories of various people as an earthquake of un-imagineable magnitude hits Los Angeles, including Ava Gardner, Charlton Heston, Geneviève Bujold and Richard Roundtree.

44011: A description of the measures taken to protect the health both of married and unmarried mothers and their children through “Mother Help” (Mødrehjælpen) – a humanitarian organisation aiding young mothers with children.

25966: In a future society, the population has grown to such a degree that the consumption of resources must be managed to ensure the continuation of humanity. This is done by killing everyone when they reach the age of thirty. But a man named Logan 5 wants to live past that birthday…

24890: Space hero Duck Dodgers, along with Eager Young Space Cadet Porky, travel to Planet X in search of Illudium Phosdex, the shaving cream atom.

22907: The true story of a part aboriginal man who finds the pressure of adapting to white culture intolerable, and as a result snaps in a violent and horrific manner.

20956: Sara is the perfect young housewife, eager to serve. When husband Hessam requires an expensive emergency operation abroad, it is she who get the funds. For the next three years, it is Sara, labouring secretly to pay the shady loan and save Hessam’s manly pride. Until the truth is revealed…

41021: A five minute experimental animated short short in which a small bug crawls over the silhouette of a house, falls and lands on its back.

22863: Best known for their award-winning Zorba the Greek, director Michael Cacoyannis and writer Walter Lassally tackle both the grievous flaws in a selfish approach to life and the strength of character to overcome them in this cutting drama.

27783: This early Tex Avery effort, made way back when he was still calling himself Fred, already features his crazy trademarks. The whole cartoon is just a collection of crazy sight gags one after another.

19088: When Seth Brundle makes a huge scientific and technological breakthrough in teleportation, he decides to test it on himself. Unbeknownst to him, a common housefly manages to get inside the device and the two become one.

24588: The third installment of Peter Greenaway’s Tulse Luper Suitcases finds the titular hero, now played by Roger Rees, again imprisoned.
The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 3: From Sark to the Finish

87368: On a quest to find out what happened to his missing brother, a scientist, his nephew and their mountain guide discover a fantastic and dangerous lost world in the center of the earth.
Journey to the Center of the Earth

20832: This achingly powerful melodrama rails against the growing hypocrisy and callous indifference of contemporary Indian society, as a poet (Dutt) is taken from abject failure and destitution to runaway success tempered by the incorrect belief that he is dead.

74510: Oscar winner George C. Scott stars as Kilvinsky, a philosophical veteran beat cop who’s assigned to teach idealistic young rookie Roy Fehler how to police the mean streets of Los Angeles.

29741: Set in gold rush-era Victoria, and based on a true story, this violent, rollicking portrayal of infamous Irish outlaw Dan Morgan (a bravura performance from an intense Dennis Hopper Easy Rider, Apocalypse Now) is a classic of Australia’s 70s cinema renaissance.

1999: Lisa suffers a motorcycle accident and loses her memory. Jota is a musician, desperate after separating from his girlfriend. When he meets Lisa he takes advantage of the situation and reinvents her life according to his desires.

383: Combining fiction and documentary, 66-year-old Carlos Saura directed this Spanish-Argentine dance drama with masterful camerawork by acclaimed cinematographer Vittorio Storaro.

92952: A short documentary on the production of rayon, shot in Torviscosa (Italy). It portrays the production of this new synthetic fabric in the small town of Torviscosa, entirely built following strict fascist canons.

36003: Frank Perry is an institutionalized convict fourteen years into a life sentence without parole. When his estranged daughter falls ill, he is determined to make peace with her before it’s too late. He develops an ingenious escape plan…

96894: Morton Downey Jr. was a chain-smoking showman, extremist, and master of provocation with the smile of a movie star and the mouth of a sailor. He was a son of a crooner and a sonofabitch whose friends in high places did not make him nearly as famous as his friends in low…
Évocateur: The Morton Downey Jr. Movie

30194: A tale set in the Tokugawa Era. Framed for a crime he did not commit, Eiji is subjected to the harsh realities of the Ishikawa Island workhouse. Sabu, Eiji’s longtime friend, must discover who is responsible for Eiji’s incarceration, before the prison life consumes him completely.

37259: Asya and İlyas’ love, which could once have been the stuff of legends, is now threatened by jealousy, alcohol and infidelity. His weak character and problems at work lead İlyas to abandon Asya, even though he still loves her, and she is left alone with their child, hopeless.
The Girl with the Red Scarf

49010: Friends since childhood and now college students, Ryan and Jennifer, couldn’t be more different; industrious Ryan is focused on his degree, while independent Jennifer is always ready for fun.

34136: An upstart television producer accepts the challenge of reviving a struggling morning show program with warring co-hosts.

92836: An evil queen steals control of a kingdom and an exiled princess enlists the help of seven resourceful rebels to win back her birthright.

49174: Jackie Chan directs and stars in this loose remake of Frank Capra’s A Pocketful of Miracles. Chan plays Cheng Wah Kuo, a down-on-his-luck man who accidentally gets caught in the midst of a gang war and is appointed leader of one of the gangs.
Miracles - Mr. Canton and Lady Rose

1481: Thomas and Luc are brothers. Thomas is straight; Luc is gay. Unable to accept his brother’s homosexuality, Thomas distances himself. When Thomas contracts a terminal illness, he intrudes into Luc’s contented life and asks him to be his caretaker.

95787: A pregnant woman’s search for her missing husband takes her from London to Kolkata, but everyone she questions denies having ever met her husband.

94671: Eloy’s personal vision of Japan is based on the manga comics created by his friends… who have never been in Japan.

14089: Poor Pat is the black (blonde) sheep in a conniving female-dominated household with only her curmudgeonly father to sympathise.

88338: In a documentary about Samuel Fuller, the spectator gets different impressions about the Hollywood director and his films. The film is divided into the three sections: The Typewriter, the Rifle and the Movie Camera.
The Typewriter, the Rifle & the Movie Camera

37091: A washed-up movie queen finds romance, but still desires a come-back.

31062: An unlucky meter reader enrolls in a confidence-building class so he can win the love of the girl of his dreams. The class turns out to be something quite different when it becomes clear to the young man that his professor has his sights set on the same girl.

29891: Two New York City police officers who arrest a member of the Yakuza and must escort him back to Japan. Once there, he escapes, and the two police officers find themselves dragged deeper and deeper into the Japanese underworld.

30238: A family drama by Paul Schrader, set in suburban Pennsylvania with brother and sister Joe (Michael J. Fox) and Patty (Joan Jett) as the focus amid their musical aspirations and family turmoil.

1649: A young woman with a history of drug problems is given temporary release from her rehabilitation facility to attend her sister’s wedding, but her arrival causes heated family tensions to bubble to the surface.

3618: Welcome to the world of industrial food production and high-tech farming! To the rhythm of conveyor belts and immense machines, the film looks without commenting into the places where food is produced in Europe.

2442: After being double-crossed and left for dead, a mysterious man named Walker single-mindedly tries to retrieve the rather inconsequential sum of money that was stolen from him.

109240: Having been exiled and vilified during the battle of the Homecoming War, Captain Harlock and his trusted crew of the Arcadia battle cruiser are the only hope mankind has of discovering the secrets that the Gaia have kept hidden.

33033: In this World War II docudrama, the British Royal Navy’s Capt. Bell (John Gregson) and the crew of the Exeter set out to destroy the German battleship Graf, chasing the indestructible Nazi vessel and cornering it in the South Atlantic harbor of Montevideo.
The Battle of the River Plate

108546: Gru is recruited by an Anti-Villain League to help find a diabolical super villain.

31942: After sheltering a fleeing anarchist, Ocho runs into the three gangsters responsible for her father’s murder, and runs afoul of various yakuza who want her dead.

573: Soldiers, chambermaids, poets, prostitutes, aristocrats—all are on equal footing in Max Ophüls’s multicharacter merry-go-round of love and infidelity.

95013: The film narrates Joaquim Sapinho’s experience in Bosnia during and after the Yugoslav Wars.

1315: A vacuum repairman moonlights as a street musician hoping for his big break. One day he meets a Czech immigrant, an aspiring singer-songwriter who earns a living selling flowers. The pair decide to collaborate, and the songs that they compose reflect the story of their blossoming love.

35884: Apparently rejected by women all his life, a loner with a high-power rifle starts on a trail of murder. The police are baffled by the apparently random killings until their psychologist comes up with some ideas.

417: A small community is torn apart by a tragic accident which kills most of the town’s children. A lawyer visits the victims’ parents in order to profit from the tragedy by stirring up the their anger and launching a class action suit against anyone they can blame.

10413: A Boeing 747 flying from Washington to Los Angeles, is struck frontally by a small prop plane, injuring the captain and killing the co-pilot and the flight engineer.

11649: Members of a circus troupe “adopt” Lili Daurier when she finds herself stranded in a strange town. The magician who first comes to her rescue already has romantic entanglements and thinks of her as a little girl.

36797: Interviews with women in alternative music.

95177: A young Korean-American girl, abducted and forced into prostitution by domestic human traffickers, joins forces with her captors in a desperate plea to survive.

12442: A nuclear weapon has been stolen by the most powerful gang in Paris’ treacherous, walled-in ghetto, and it’s up to a determined cop and a vigilante criminal in search of his sister to infiltrate the sector, save the girl, and get the bomb out of the bad guys’ hands.

33877: Mum and Dad, and their ‘adopted’ children, Birdie & Elbie, work at the airport. The family live off whatever they scavenge from cargo holds, offices and hotels…

55161: Teenager Carol Henderson is sentenced to 18 months in jail when she accidentally kills a man in this combo sexploitation/blaxploitation flick. When she arrives at the women’s prison, Carol finds a hellhole of corruption, violence and racial tension.

116296: Storm trackers, thrill-seekers, and everyday townspeople document an unprecedented onslaught of tornadoes touching down in the town of Silverton.

94081: Lady Gaga’s metaphor-laded autobiographical music video cum short film features her single “Marry the Night” as she recalls how she became famous.

48672: Clint Eastwood (in all his squinty-eyed glory) survives a hanging, vowing revenge on the lynch mob that left him dangling, in this film that aspires to be an Americanized spaghetti Western — and succeeds.

36847: 8 shorts centered around 8 themes directed by 8 famous film directors involved and sharing their opinion on progress, on the set-backs and the challenges our planet faces today.

90147: Ignoring his sexually transmitted disease, Mutsugoro travels to his hometown. gliding into the world of his dreams, he slowly loses his grip to reality. are his friends terrorists? And whom can he trust? Welcome to Sono’s elaborated dream worlds.

35630: Two men—one without arms and another with withered legs—develop kung fu abilities and fight their evil teacher, who made them disabled.

6374: A  classic Disney blend of irresistible characters, unforgettable music, and an endearing modern-day story about how the lovable Goofy bonds with his teenage son Max on a cross-country road trip. En route to the ol’ fishing hole, they find themselves up to their floppy ears in misadventure!

4325: Having served in the civil war against the communists in mainland China during the late forties, Han-sun finally moves to Taiwan with his devoted wife, Ping, and his lovely daughters, Li and Zhou. Though they seem to walk through life without a care, a happy ending is not in store.

28047: An award-winning 2008 Turkish documentary film directed by Orhan Eskiköy  and Özgür Doğan which gives openhearted account of a young Turkish teacher during a school year in a Kurdish village in southeastern Turkey.

41419: This film is about a man whose job is to deliver packages without asking any questions. Complications arise when he breaks those rules.

118330: Examines how the food we eat can help or hurt our health. Nutritionists, naturopaths, doctors, and journalists weigh in on topics organic food, food safety, raw foodism, and nutritional therapy.

104679: Bright interior, dark outside. Two women, struggling against external hostility and internal demons. Playing with the mood of Alfred Hitchcock’s Trouble With Harry, Serge Bozon invites us in an exhilarating and recreational English crime comedy style.

20112: Bobbie is an addict and small-time thief. When one of his jobs goes bad, Mel is called in to patch him up. Mel offers him a chance at a bigger score. Over time, Mel and his girlfriend Sid become almost like parents to Bobbie and his girlfriend Rosie, but this can’t last.

42612: A TV crew on a team-building expedition in the wilderness finds a dead body.

106628: An extremely lean man and an extremely fat man are engaged in a wrestling match. The lean man attacks the fat one viciously but cannot budge him from the floor.
The Fat and Lean Wrestling Match

26085: Walter Mitty, a daydreaming pulp-fiction writer with an overprotective mother, likes to imagine that he is a hero who experiences fantastic adventures. His dream becomes complicated when he accidentally meets a mysterious woman who hands him a little black book.
The Secret Life of Walter Mitty

43950: The heart of Minnie Mouse is the prize in a feud between Mickey and a new rival for her affections.

41901: While waiting at a train station, Nikki Collins witnesses a murder from a nearby building. When she brings the police to the scene of the crime, they think she’s crazy since there’s no body. She then enlists a popular mystery writer to help with her sleuthing.

99248: Student demonstrations are raging in Lahore, as young Pakistani professor Changez Khan talks of the glittering future he has ahead of him.  But then 9/11 changes everything. Attitudes shift dramatically, and his very name and face render him suspect.

38885: In this silent film, a woman forsakes husband and lover to pursue a young engineer.

47896: A 1901 British short silent drama film showing the occupants of a house in Hove being rescued by the local fire service, which was one of the very first films to make use of multiple shots edited together to create a chronological sequence propelling a coherent narrative along.

86976: A 1901 British short silent comedy film featuring a stereotypical yokel reacting to films projected onto a screen, which contains a performer reacting in perfect time to superimposed images.

43680: Johnny Handsome is a deformed gangster who plans a successful robbery with a friend of his, Mikey Chalmette, and another couple (Sunny Boid and Rafe Garrett). During the heist, Johnny and Mikey are double-crossed by Sunny and Rafe.

25046: When his beloved boss his killed, a dangerous young gangster cuts a path of vengeance through the Japanese mafia.

38755: The final entry in a trilogy of films produced for the U.S. government by John Huston. This documentary film follows 75 U.S. soldiers who have sustained debilitating emotional trauma and depression.

101649: The Punk Syndrome is a film about Finland’s most kick-ass punk rock band, Pertti Kurikan Nimipäivät.

44429: A girl travels to an island, after the death of her father, to find out why the father funded a convent on the island.

19678: Astronaut Spencer Armacoust was on a mission when he suddenly lost contact. When he got home, to friends he was the same, but to his wife he was different. She becomes pregnant, but as time progresses she begins to feel like the lives inside of her are not of this world.

26329: Banyu Biru is a road movie on how to rediscover love. Banyu (Tora Sudiro), a young supermarket customer service rep, is absorbed in his daily routine when a strange incident inspires him to hit the road and solve past family issues.

44855: Disenchanted with the movie industry, Chili Palmer (John Travolta) tries the music industry, meeting and romancing a widow of a music exec (Uma Thurman) on the way.

123877: A young girl is sexually abused by her father. Thus, begins the disturbing tale of a father and daughter torn apart, thrown into the center of a conspiracy that shocks the nation.

24378: Kresten comes from humble country origins but now lives in the yuppie circles of Copenhagen and has the prospects of a glittering career until a telephone call on his wedding night shatters his hopes of a better life.

47622: Mr. Money is holding another Tenka’ichi Budokai and Mr. Satan invites everyone in the world to join in. Little does he know that Bojack, an ancient villain who has escaped his prison, is competing. Since Goku is currently dead, it is up to Gohan, Vegita, and Trunks to defeat Bojack and his henchman.

48639: Party animal Tommy Callahan is a few cans short of a six-pack. But when the family business starts tanking, it’s up to Tommy and number-cruncher Richard Hayden to save the day.

1196: Two pieces of meat find love in a kitchen, before disaster strikes.

30483: One of Rohmer’s most obscure works, a black-and-white short film made for TV in 1964, Changing Landscape is a brilliant meditation on the industrialization of the French countryside.

133236: A “false translation” of the 1,000 year old Book of Optics, which debunks theories that the eyes emit rays, or that objects project replicas of themselves, and accurately describes the strengths and weaknesses of human vision.

34939: Charlie has plans to steal 4 million dollars worth of gold, but he needs to get a gang together first. Contains the legendary (for car buffs at least) Mini Cooper chase sequence.

153567: Made entirely by hand from cut marbled paper, this odyssey of remnants re-imagines a dream-sequence love.

694: Billy the Kid is both ruthless and bumbling in this impressionistic French-made western. Ruthless, in that he tracks down a witness to a robbery and kills him in cold blood. Bumbling, in that he literally stumbles over things throughout the film.

33688: When a young woman realizes her brother is about to marry the girl who bullied her in high school, she sets out to expose the fiancée’s true colors.

34545: An intimate portrait of the relationship between Portuguese writer and Nobel Prize winner José Saramago and the Spanish journalist Pilar Del Rio.

31909: In what might be termed Russo-Shakespearean noir, a ruthless woman’s adulterous affair with a drifter sets in motion a chain-reaction of murder and deception in a remote village in 19th Century Mtsensk.

5298: In this horror anthology film, a wandering supernatural feline’s adventures loosely link together a trio of Stephen King stories – “Quitters, Inc.”, “The Ledge”, and “General”.

31575: Sharon Stone plays a street-wise, middle-aged moll standing up against the mobs, all of which is complicated by a 6 year old urchin with a will of his own who she reluctantly takes under her wing after his family has been gunned down.

944: Based on Holling C. Holling’s beloved Caldecott-awarded children’s book, William Mason’s stunning film follows the adventures of a tiny, wood-carved canoe as it forges its own path from Lake Superior through the Great Lakes and down to the Atlantic Ocean.

89511: Mukash is chased by officials, learns of the devastation of war from a blind woman and helps her daughter to freedom beyond the river crossing, he, having to choose a tragic solution.

134257: The video, directed by Paul Thomas Anderson, features Joanna Newsom wandering through a huge cityscape, lights flashing from every source around.

10458: Based on the Robert Penn Warren novel. The life of populist Southerner Willie Stark, a political creature loosely based on Governor Huey Long of Louisiana.

2031: Still the standard by which many New York movies are compared, this chronicles a bank robbery gone awry. As motivations are revealed, the robbery turns into a hostage situation and a media circus ensues. Based on a true story.

820: Burt Lancaster is the worn-down Joe Collins, who, along with his fellow inmates, lives under the heavy thumb of the sadistic guard Captain Munsey. Only Collins’s dreams of escape keep him going, but how can he possibly bust out of Munsey’s chains?

89475: Three half-brothers are reunited at their mother’s funeral. After being told of their inheritance they quickly spend the money, only to find out that they will not receive it after all. The men grow closer while deciding how to proceed.

10824: In a time of war and disease, a young officer gallantly tries to help a young woman find her husband.

37586: A short film by Segundo de Chomón.

20391: A smug and overly self-assured downhill skier, David Chappellet (Robert Redford), joins the American ski team and quickly makes waves with his arrogant behavior and even flashier maneuvers on the slopes, falling into conflict with the team’s coach (Gene Hackman).

39938: A documentary about the threats that face a female lion trying to protect her cubs.

101766: The fourth chapter in the saga of the accountant Ugo Fantozzi features the out-of-luck office clerk who is the butt of all jokes, the recipient of consistently bad fortune, and the father of an exceptionally ugly daughter.

26206: Six short movies by six directors soon to be very famous. Six visions of Paris by Jean Daniel Pollet, Jean Luc Godard, Jean Rouch, Eric Rohmer, Jean Douchet and Claude Chabrol.

44506: A small house has to try to compete with progress and the encroaching press of the big city.

18971: After serving time for manslaughter, young Vince Everett becomes a teenage rock star.

102875: Best friends—introspective Lilly and free-spirited Gerry—spend their last summer at home in New York City before parting ways for college. The girls meet Brooklyn boy David, whom they both fall for, and Lilly soon begins a secret relationship with him.

19633: A fiercely independent woman is gang raped, then battles the legal system twice, going after both her attackers and the onlookers whose cheering fueled and encouraged the assault.

26362: A feature-length documentary chronicling early 80’s punk rock band the Minutemen, from their beginnings in San Pedro, California, to their demise after the death of singer D. Boon in 1985.
We Jam Econo: The Story of the Minutemen

101602: Two female vampires in modern-day New York City are faced with daunting romantic possibilities.

47669: As a result of Oliver’s love problems, Laurel and Hardy join the Foreign Legion. Their bumbling eventually gets them charged with desertion and sentenced to a firing squad. Will they manage to escape in a stolen aeroplane?

25169: In this humorous but melancholy tale, two  farmers are visited by aliens with a taste for their domestic cabbage soup.

42989: This short film is a morality tale about a con man passing off a counterfeit coin to make money. But once he amasses a tidy sum of money he has trouble holding on to it…

39420: First crush. First kiss. First steps in becoming a woman. Fourteen-year-old Dani and her older sister Maureen have always shared everything. But when Court Foster  moves in next door, the sisters become rivals as Dani experiences her first feelings of affection and Maureen finds true love…

102409: After a blow to the head, Abby decides she can’t do it anymore. Her life just can’t be only about the house, the kids and the wife. She needs more: she needs to be Eleanor.

40608: Using Helen Gurley Brown’s book as a jump off point, we follow the adventures of a supermarket tabloid editor as he tries to parlay an interview with the author of the book into headlines and sales. Of course, a romantic entanglement ensues.

23352: A film adaptation of the homonymous tragedy by Euripides.

41452: Starring Jean Reno, this is the harrowing true story from a dark page in France’s history books, when French police rounded up civilian Jews living in Paris, sending thirteen thousand men, women and children to their deaths at Auschwitz.

43403: A story about Jim Craig and 18 year old who has recently lost his father in trying to capture ‘the colt from Old Regret’ has to win the respect from the men of the high country to run his fathers farm located near Mt. Kosciusko.

126514: Using a spectacular staging of the artworks, reconstitution, archives, testimonies, the film explores the question of relations between art and power, what art tells us about ourselves even in the midst of one of the bloodiest conflicts the world had ever seen.
Francofonia: Le Louvre under German Occupation

23236: A former drug trafficker and police informer, Sofianos, is in prison. A conservative politician, Kriezis, with whom Sofianos had a homosexual relationship, visits him in prison. Using a smuggled gun Sofianos manages to take him hostage in his cell and blackmails the police in order to be released.

86541: A 12-year-old boy is convinced he’s been pushed toward social suicide when his teacher pairs him up for a project with the school’s biggest reject. But the boys form an unexpected bond when bullies turn their attention to an unlikely target.

98059: Young Rossi tries to fit among his older brother’s group of friends. But the outcome is surprising.

100690: On July 19, 1944, my brother Adolfas and I boarded a train that was to take us to Vienna. Instead, we ended up in a forced labor camp near Hamburg. In 1971, the Soviets permitted me to visit my mother in Lithuania. After visiting her, I decided to travel to Vienna.

43567: The story of Captain Richard Francis Burton’s and Lt. John Hanning Speke’s expedition to find the source of the Nile river in the name of Queen Victoria’s British Empire. The film tells the story of their meeting, their friendship emerging amidst hardship, and then dissolving after their journey.

62952: As cheerleading captain at her elite school, Britney makes plans for her squad to earn a coveted spot in singing sensation Rihanna’s upcoming video. But when her family moves across town to urban Crenshaw Heights, Britney’s plans are quashed.
Bring It On: All or Nothing

43746: Vacationing scuba divers discover a sunken treasure off the Bermuda coast along with a stash of narcotics, and soon find themselves on the run from drug traffickers.

21046: An early melodrama of the Thaw period in the Soviet Union, the film follows the uneasy but blossoming love between a teacher and her pupil.

23017: That morning when he went out to meet his children and grand-children who were on the way to visit him as every week-end, Mr Ladmiral did not know that this late-Summer Sunday and that the emotional events he would live through on that special day might radically change his whole life.

41717: After losing everyone he loves, young James flees to the woods to live alone. But when he’s discovered by a beautiful teenage cancer patient, their romance leads him on a journey back to civilization.

40855: The farmers in a small Dolomite village take the wild young girl Junta to be a witch, fearing her evil eye. Moreover, they consider her to be responsible for the deaths of four young men, who had followed her up Monte Cristallo during the full moon of the night into a mysterious blue light.

87822: A newlywed couple arrives at the home of the husband’s late wife, where the gardens have been maintained by a gardener faithful to the dead woman’s memory. Soon eerie events lead the new wife to think she is going out of her mind.

43622: Frank T. Hopkins, a cowboy working in Buffalo Bill’s Wild West Show is troubled by the events he saw at Wounded Knee and by the way the Indians are treated in the show. Billed as the world’s greatest endurance rider, an Arabian sheik challenges the title…

22329: Laura Smet makes her film debut as Charlotte, a young woman battling cancer. Nicolas Duvauchelle plays her boyfriend Paul, who has pledged to stick by her through the chemotherapy. When Charlotte’s healthy cousin Ninon (Marie Denarnaud) comes to visit, Paul ends up sleeping with her.

46612: The Red Market in Macao. The red tonalities of blood, flesh, buckets and even of the fish’s eyes, carry the audience into a strange and scary universe but also beautiful and intriguing.

39601: Brett Sprague is a violent and psychopathic man, who is released on parole after serving a sentence for assault. As he returns to his family house and we watch him and his brothers, Stevie and Glenn, for the next 24 hours, it becomes clear this day will not end well.

45865: Disgusted with the policies of King Charles I, Oliver Cromwell plans to take his family to the New World. But on the eve of their departure, Cromwell is drawn into the tangled web of religion and politics that will result in the English Civil War.

40785: After his battles with the communist mayor Peppone, Don Camillo is sent in exile by his bishop in a remote village. Peppone thought he got the village in his hands…

25348: Money and family are persistent Naruse themes, here revolving around Hideko Takamine as a young wife.

22085: Zorns Lemma is named after mathematician Max Zorn’s “lemma,” an axiom which states that given a set of sets, there must be a further set containing a representative item from each individual set.

27319: An ex-convict and his bumbling crook brother fight for the same woman.

44643: Mira, disobeying her parents, stays home alone for the first time during school break… She thinks herself strong and self-reliant, but will be proved wrong when fear comes upon her.

118392: Stripped is The Rolling Stones album released in 1995 during the Voodoo Lounge Tour. It includes a cover of Bob Dylan’s Like a Rolling Stone.

46776: A veteran comes home from the Korean War to the mountains and takes over the family moon shining business.

24076: An unusual and beautifully meditative portrait of an artist and her connection to the society around her.

26027: A Japanese cult ero-guro animation movie adapted from manga by Suehiro Maruo, following the misadventures of a girl called Midori who, after losing her mother, joins the fairground freak show.

125692: Ane’s life turns around when, week after week, she receives a bunch of flowers at home. Always at the same time and always without a senders note.

32847: This film describes the events surrounding a 1975 shootout at the Pine Ridge reservation in S. Dakota where two FBI agents were killed.
Incident at Oglala: The Leonard Peltier Story

94147: The protagonist, a lazy pen-pusher, gets the sack for his bureaucratic idleness, and learns that the way back into the job market depends on getting a letter of recommendation from a “grandmother”

31630: Lance Poole, an Indian who won a Medal of Honor fighting at Gettysburg, returns to his tribal lands intent on peaceful cattle ranching. But white sheep farmers want his fertile grass range and manage to turn the ostensibly civilized white population against the tribes, with tragic results.

33661: Almost 50 years in the making — filming began in 1956 — Ken Jacobs’s 440-minute avant-garde epic was named the best film of 2004 by J. Hoberman of The Village Voice.

53054: A couple embarking on a road trip are in for the fright of their lives when they’re assaulted by a chainsaw-wielding maniac while changing a flat tire in the third segment of the Texas Chainsaw Massacre franchise of slash-’em-up movies.
Leatherface: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre III

94023: Impression given to man and his environment. Unwitting cruelty of nature, resulting from its governing laws, intertwines with deliberate human cruelty.

116234: A newborn child rests beside its mother on a sultry summer afternoon. Around them, in the house and nearby fields, others go about their everyday lives. Amid the apparent calm, there is a hint of danger: a spot of blood is spreading out across the white baby suit…

33705: Thrown out by his girlfriend from her apartment, Axel moves in for a while with Norbert, a homosexual he met some days before.

719: Three men — a sometime DJ, a low-level pimp, and a hapless Italian tourist — find themselves in a Louisiana prison for crimes they didn’t commit and plot their escape.

28181: A parapsychologist discovers that the drawings of the child Mukul represent scenes from a former life.

37913: Redline is the biggest, most popular, illegal and most dangerous race in all of the galaxy.

3282: Everything returns to normal after Chernobyl. That is, everything but art. Most of the great works are lost, and it is up to people like William Shakespear Junior the Fifth to restore the lost artwork of the human race.

29077: A penniless young man tries to save an heiress from kidnappers and help her secure her inheritance.

31884: The world’s greatest criminal and the world greatest loser share the same face… now they’ll share the same life!

35942: A day in the life of the world’s unluckiest guy. Starting the morning off with a shaving nick from hell, he endures fires, mad dogs, rampaging vacuum cleaners, horny neighbors, kids with ray guns and, of course, a steam-roller.

89984: The film documents the solitary existence of Jake, a man who lives in isolation in the middle of the forest in remote Scotland. It follows the character’s unconventional life, capturing moments of profound beauty.

28349: The story of an itenerant fisherman named Bobo (Gabin) who, fearing he may have killed a man by accident, hides out on a barge and saves Anna (Ida Lupino) from a suicide attempt.

130378: José Régio, a Portuguese poet, wrote a letter expressing his desire to start making films. Nothing more was known about it. However, the discovery of some old film reels seems to provide the ending to the story..
The Glory of Filmmaking in Portugal

37877: Gabriel returns to try to destroy the human race he despises so much, with the help of a suicidal teen and the opposition of the angel Daniel.

29113: A group of inept amateur superheroes must try to save the day when a supervillian threatens to destroy a major superhero and the city.

16442: The story of Karen Silkwood, a metallurgy worker at a plutonium processing plant who was purposefully contaminated, psychologically tortured and possibly murdered to prevent her from exposing blatant worker safety violations at the plant.

32797: A Turkish comedy film built upon the question, “What would have happened if Mustafa Kemal Atatürk never existed?”, which was the fourth highest-grossing Turkish film of 2008.

15649: Recovering alcoholic British writer, David Graham, is released from a Montreal sanitarium and flies to London where he has 24-hours to find evidence to save his neglected son Alec from the gallows. Alec was convicted of killing Jenny Coles, a girlfriend he loved who broke up with him.

9061: An ambitious young accountant schemes to wed a wealthy factory owner’s daughter, despite falling in love with a married older woman.

38410: In Béla Tarr’s final film a monumental windstorm and an abused horse’s refusal to work or eat signals the beginning of the end for a poor farmer and his daughter.

44608: Pete Bell, a college basketball coach is under a lot of pressure. His team isn’t winning and he cannot attract new players. The stars of the future are secretly being paid by boosters. This practice is forbidden in the college game, but Pete is desperate and has pressures from all around.

26108: A reclusive, unhappy gold magnate finds his isolated tropical paradise threatened by the intrusion of organized criminals.

45452: An insane man is rehabilitated by the power of music.

27352: Rose (Laura Dern) is taken in by the Hillyer family to serve as a 1930s housemaid so that she can avoid falling into a life of prostitution, but her flirtatious demeanor starts to get her into trouble.

38574: The strangeness of this film is laced with carefully molded apocalypses as the filmmaker explores a vision of life beyond death – the Elysian fields of Homer, Dante’s Purgatorio, de Chirico’s stitched plain.

9105: Somewhere behind the early 1960s Cold War Iron Curtain, the Hollander family cause an international spying incident when Walter photographs a sunset in a sensitive region. In order to stay out of jail, the Hollanders take refuge in the American Embassy…

47567: For JR (comedian Carlen Altman) and her brother Colin (director Alex Ross Perry), a road trip boils over with complex sibling rivalry in this self-described “objectionable comedy about disappointment and forgiveness.”

45536: Jörn Donner, discusses work and life, women and love, philosophy and everyday life with the master of Swedish cinema, creating an exceptional and very personal portrait of Bergman.
Ingmar Bergman on Life and Work

27236: After their high school basketball coach passes away, five good friends and former teammates reunite for a Fourth of July holiday weekend.

20257: Gérard Depardieu plays an at-wit’s-end husband, Raoul, who’ll go to any lengths to sexually satisfy his wife, Solange (Carole Laure). Raoul decides that the best thing to cure Solange’s boredom would be if she took a lover; thus, he chooses Stéphane (Patrick Dewaere) for the “job.”

24391: A scientific film essay, a set of pictures of two picnickers in a park, with the area of each frame one-tenth the size of the one before. Starting from a view of the entire known universe, the camera gradually zooms in until we are viewing the subatomic particles on a man’s hand.

40506: A starving gendarme, wasting away from hunger, is reduced to grabbing castoff snacks from fat American tourists…
The Old Lady and the Pigeons

40462: Total, a young bank cashier, has been wondering for some time if his life, with its grey, dismal prospect, is worth living. He is aware of the illicit careers and rise to riches of many of his clients. He decide to start a new life : new clothes, new cars, new women.
Property Is No Longer a Theft

41638: In the ’30s a man is obsessed with a painting of a woman that reminds him of his long-lost mother. He models his girlfriend exactly after the woman in the painting and after she attempts to commit suicide she is committed into a sanatorium.

87415: Director Katsuya Tomita decided to make a film about rural life in Japan, focusing on the people of Kofu City, a city on the verge of extinction, focusing on Takeshi, a member of a local hip-hop group.

28266: A risk-taking amoral U.S. Treasury agent seeks revenge against a sleek counterfeiter who murdered a fellow agent, going rogue in an obsessive pursuit that swiftly spirals out of control.
To Live and Die in L.A.

2093: Director/choreographer Bob Fosse tells his own life story as he details the sordid life of Joe Gideon (Roy Scheider), a womanizing, drug-using dancer.

109691: Recruited as an informant by the Israeli secret service Shin Bet, a young Palestinian man finds himself caught between two very different kinds of loyalty.

37958: A comedy of maners in the wake of the October crisis in Quebec and the Osaka Expo ’70.

35575: A special sideshow torture exhibit has the power, according to the showman Dr. Diablo, to warn people of evil in their futures. The skeptical customers are shown the greed and violence they’re hiding.

37524: Daniel is schoolmaster of a kindergarten in a small French town. The local economy, which depended entirely on coal production, has been mired in a depression ever since the mines were closed.

1298: Irena Salina’s award-winning documentary highlights a global crisis on water politics, pollution and human rights and warns that water, our most precious resource, can no longer be taken for granted. Unless we effect global change, impoverished nations could be wiped from the planet.

35909: Two cops are brought back to life to chase down supernatural criminals.

10886: A man returns to Victoria, Australia, where he grew up, and encounters a mysterious woman who reminds him of someone he once knew.

92253: Set in 1937 in Nanjing, China during the Nanking Massacre, at the time of the Second Sino-Japanese War, a group of escapees, finding sanctuary in a Church compound, risk their lives as they struggle to survive the plight and persecution brought on by the violent invasion of the city.

35411: In this Chinese action-adventure a swordsman and a Samurai team up and begin searching for a notorious blade.

4060: The movie takes place during World War II and depicts the true story of Jan Baalsruds amazing escape from the German army from the coast of Northern Norway and across the border to the neutral country Sweden.

76358: The medicine woman of a wandering Neanderthal tribe discovers a blond child named Ayla, who comes from the race of “Others.” She convinces her fellow cave-dwellers to adopt the girl, who grows up to be more highly evolved than those who raise her.
The Clan of the Cave Bear

14458: This film version of Shelagh Delaney’s play follows the hopes and dreams of five people. Jo is the neglected 16-year-old daughter whose promiscuous mother marries a dandy. Jo gets pregnant after a tryst with a black cook, who leaves her over his impending responsibilities of fatherhood.

37440: A barrel of radioactive waste is lost out in the woods. Some demented rednecks find it and use it as part of their still. Everybody who drinks from the liquor they produced turns into a zombie.

30421: The footloose ennui of Poland’s postwar generation is captured to perfection in this jazzy chronicle of a draft-dodger’s final day of freedom.

11814: Two peasant children are led into the night by a fairy, to search for the Blue Bird of Happiness.

32470: Shortly before his execution on the death row in San Quentin, amateur sleuth and baby photographer Ronnie Jackson, tells reporters how he got there.

97307: After his wife’s death in a car accident, Roberto moves to Mexico City with his teenage daughter Alejandra. While father and daughter are inherently close, their repressed grief and lack of communication threatens to unhinge them when Ale becomes the victim of brutal bullying at school.

30545: Anatoli Yefremovich Novoseltsev works in a statistics institution, whose director is an unattractive and bossy woman…

37688: Sensual, lyrical, intelligent and musical: stylised Brazilian film version of the well-known story of Cleopatra and the structures of seduction and power it’s based on. In other words Cleopatra à la Bressane.

1134: German director Wim Wenders travels to Japan to explore the world of one his “masters” in cinema, Japanese celebrated film director Yasujiro Ozu. Sequences of Wenders’ view of Japan alternates with encounters and interviews with crew and cast-members of Ozu’s films.

109941: A comedy directed by and starring Albert Dupontel about Ariane Felder, a judge of strict morals who discovers she’s pregnant by Bob Nolan, a criminal wanted for murder. Ariane can’t remember a thing and tries to find out what could possibly have happened.

3165: After the attempted murder of beautiful Mathilde, a young reporter Joseph Rouletabille, accompanied by his friend and photographer Sainclair, heads for Glandier castle to unravel the mystery.
Le mystère de la chambre jaune

32514: Colonel Trautman is authorized to send Rambo in to rescue American soldiers that are missing in action from the Vietnam war.

114772: Samba migrated to France 10 years ago from Senegal, and has since been plugging away at various lowly jobs. Alice is a senior executive who has recently undergone a burnout…

32048: A charming drifter returns to his “home,” where he makes a desperate and very dangerous deal in order to reclaim his ex. When passion ignites into obsession, a treacherous game of “who can you trust?” spins a deadly web of intrigue and murder – from which no one escapes unscathed.

1814: In 1993, U.S. Special Forces sent to Somalia to bring down a dangerous faction leader find themselves in the middle of an explosive firefight and must struggle to survive.

73750: When 10-year-old Tadashi Ino stumbles into a spirit war, it’s up to him to free the spirit world from the forces of repression in this genre-bending fantasy tale populated by mod villains, scrap-metal robot monsters and goblins of Japanese folklore.

3439: When an insatiable great white shark terrorizes the townspeople of Amity Island, police chief Martin Brody, ichthyologist Matt Hooper and grizzly ship captain Quint, team up for an epic battle of man vs. nature.

94534: Between 1960 and 1975, Cambodia’s film industry showed enormous growth by producing 400 films. However, when the Khmer government took over, most of the filmmakers were purged from the country and the films were burned. Only about 30 films survived the ordeal.

1468: Two London brothers faced with huge money problems feel better when their rich Uncle propose some help. But it has a price which implies crossing (or not) the line of morality. Ewan McGregor and Colin Farrell Woody Allen’s sombre comedy and tale of ambition.

3845: In a minor town the morose manager is primarily responsible for the bad atmosphere of a restaurant. But central for the plot are three persons: a male waiter who is never named (here called W), the female waiter Anna, and “the count”, a self-invented nickname by a man cleaning plates.

30019: A wealthy hedonist learns that his scientist father is carrying out experiments to unlock the secret of immortality and is in league with vampires.

149447: Richard and Mildred Loving, an interracial couple, are sentenced to prison in Virginia in 1958 for getting married.

2707: Refusing to give into police investigators’ questions of suspicion due to the seal of confession, a priest becomes the prime suspect in a murder.

112781: A lonely Japanese woman becomes convinced that a satchel of money buried in a fictional film is, in fact, real. Abandoning her structured life in Tokyo for the frozen Minnesota wilderness, she embarks on an impulsive quest to search for her lost mythical fortune.

3921: Based on Maruyama’s novel Sōnan: aru fūfu no baai (Disaster: One Couple’s Case). Lovely young widow Takigawa Ayako goes on trial for the murder of her husband, Ryō, in a mountaineering accident. If cleared, she stands to gain five million yen from his life insurance.

36346: Three high-school students experience the perks and pratfalls of modern love in director Leste Chen’s sensitive tale of friendship and yearning.

133464: After waking up in a hospital room in Florence, Italy, with no memory of what has occurred for the last few days, Robert Langdon suddenly finds himself the target of a manhunt.

7737: Based on a true story, Kiss of Death is given a veneer of reality by being filmed on location in New York, with a bare minimum of studio work. In one of his best performances, Victor Mature plays a cheap crook who is sent up the river for 20 years for robbery.

34317: In this animated short, Ralph’s day gets off to a bad start when he dismisses his wife’s orders to clear the snow from the front walk. When he comes home and finds the mailman dead on his front stairs, Ralph attempts a massive cover-up with disastrous results.

151200: Damien lives with his mother Marianne, a doctor, while his father is on a tour of duty abroad. He is bullied by Thomas, whose mother is ill. The boys find themselves living together when Marianne invites Thomas to come and stay with them.

34273: Mary Rutledge arrives from the east, finds her fiance dead, and goes to work at the roulette wheel of Louis Charnalis’ Bella Donna, a rowdy gambling house in San Francisco in the 1850s. She falls in love with miner Carmichael and takes his gold dust at the wheel.

35029: Vincent Lamarca, whose father was executed for a 1950s kidnapping of a child, grew up to become a police officer, only to see his own son become a murderer.

4458: Pierre, a young man of privilege, whose anonymously-published novel is a hit and who’s about to marry his blond cousin, Lucie, abandons all when a dark-haired vagrant tells him her secret late one night in the woods: that she is Isabelle, his sister, abandoned by their father.

3795: A tender story from Australia highlights the realistic ups and downs of an Australian family in the year following a parent’s emergency medical procedure.

16031: Sharpshooters Zack and Joe are in a Texan stage-coach and manage to fight off Matson’s robber gang, so afterward they can fight over the $100,000 cash carried by a railroad official. Both make it to Galveston, where each, meets up with respective accomplices various dirty schemes.

29560: Three women in different stages of their lives – 20, 30, 40 – face the hardships of the female existence.
