42177: An FBI agent disguises himself as an old lady to protect a beautiful federal witness and her son.

125155: In New York City for their annual tradition of Christmas Eve debauchery, three lifelong best friends set out to find the Holy Grail of Christmas parties since their yearly reunion might be coming to an end.

25997: A man is killed in a kickboxing match. His brother vows revenge.

40126: A sharp-witted comedy that follows a group of apparent strangers in interlocking stories taking place in ten different bars during the course of one evening in Los Angeles.

99835: The philosopher and academic Slavoj Žižek is either a genius, madman, contrarian, clown, sensationalist, radical leftist, scourge of liberals, or all the above. Uniting with documentarian Sophie Fiennes, Žižek examines films, both famous and obscure, for their overt and hidden implications.

37060: Hans Petter has joined URO, a special elite police unit. He works undercover being driven and obsessed by exposing a criminal drug network but soon going too far on his own: violating police rules, being torn between both sides of the law and trying to resolve his unconscious inner conflict.

91960: Farce of the troubles of a restaurant when a President of a South American state is kidnapped while dining at his restaurant.

15222: A young woman marries an older millionaire and then falls in love with a handsome nobleman on her honeymoon.

91478: The arrival of Nadine, a new student, in the Abidjan Lyceum is the starting point for a discussion about interratial relationships.

4524: Alice Sycamore, a stenographer, is in love with her boss Tony Kirby, who is the vice-president of a powerful company owned by his greedy father Anthony P. Kirby.
You Can't Take It With You

32298: A travelling troupe of jousters and performers are slowly cracking under the pressure of hick cops, financial troubles and their failure to live up to their own ideals.

35155: A young man, falsely imprisoned by his jealous “friend,” escapes and uses a hidden treasure to exact his revenge.

17317: After seeing his ex-girlfriend (Henderson) turn down a nationally televised marriage proposal, a small-time crook (Carlyle) returns to his hometown to try and win back her heart.
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

Mac is very attracted to Jo Ann, the owner of a stylish restaurant. Nick gets close to Jo Ann attempting to know more about Mac.

4958: Louis Mahe is a tobacco planter at Reunion Island. He is waiting for Julie Roussel to marry her. He only knows her by mail. The woman that comes does not look like the picture he got, but he marries her anyway. Soon, she flees with Louis’ money. Louis tries to find her…

94448: A little lamb’s life is turned upside down by the wolf that killed his mother. He seeks to avenge his mother, but in order to defeat the wolf, he must become one.

3545: An Interpol agent attempts to expose a high-profile financial institution’s role in an international arms dealing ring.

4688: A masked killer stalks four teens responsible for the accidential death of a child six years earlier at their high school’s senior prom.

155116: No one could have ever imagined the absurd fate awaiting Mirror’s Quest and the other horses of Fukushima: almost dying in the tsunami; exposed to radiation inside the 20 km exclusion zone surrounding the nuclear meltdown; shut away in stables for months because of government red tape.

1470: Withdrawn curmudgeon Don Johnston receives an anonymous letter from a former flame telling him about a son he never knew about, prompting him to embark on a cross country journey to visit his past girlfriends.

30001: A woman is accused of killing a man to inherit his millions by having sex with him.

12243: Jack Baker and Frank Baker are brothers making a meagre living playing in seedy lounges and piano bars. In despair, they hold auditions for a female singer to join the outfit, ending up with the beautiful but hard-nosed Susie Diamond. The new act becomes unexpectedly successful.

10212: After an accident, a teenager suffering from blackouts believes she may be the one behind the murders of her fellow students.

3421: Farmhand Luke Skywalker must team up with the Rebel Alliance to save Princess Leia from the clutches of Darth Vader and thwart the Galactic Empire’s evil plans.

21502: A young female film editor specializes in discovering why other women degrade themselves in pornography and prostitution.

42058: This concise masterpiece began as a commission by French TV for the news series Envoyé spécial. By filming Cairo with his unique sense of artistic digression, Chahine transformed this portrait of a city into the self-portrait of a filmmaker.
Cairo as Told by Youssef Chahine

22709: An anonymous narrator outlines a bizarre, tongue-in-cheek journey taken through a domain known only as “H”, aided by a series of extraordinary maps and advice from a mysterious scholar named Tulse Luper.

23553: An eight-year-old boy receives an unusual paper fish for his birthday.

118862: Alex, Emily, and their son, RJ, are new to Los Angeles. A chance meeting at the park introduces them to the mysterious Kurt, Charlotte, and Max. A family \“playdate\” becomes increasingly interesting as the night goes on.

100091: Giulio is forty and lives a seemingly quiet life: a rented house, a permanent job, a car paid for by instalments, a rebellious but nice daughter, a sweet dreamy son and a wife he loves and cheats on. Giulio is caught out and dumped. His perfect life suddenly falls apart.

21466: A teenager attends a fantasy writers’ convention where he discovers his idea has been stolen by an established novelist.

41337: After an attempted assassination on Ambassador Han, Lee and Carter head to Paris to protect a French woman with knowledge of the Triads’ secret leaders.

8498: Brian Donlevy plays Dan McGinty, a Chicago hobo who is hired by local political bosses as a “professional voter”, casting ballots under a variety of assumed names in various districts.

24456: A social documentary describing the fate of some 15,000 miners in the Borinage, who in 1932 staged a strike in protest against the announcement by Belgian mine owners of a 5% cut in wages.

Paulo is torn between the elite’s madness and the blind submission of the masses.

39221: Stipan is a policeman who comes to small Adriatic island off the Croatian coast in order to investigate reported strange phenomena that had frightened the whole population.

47068: Lady Gaga music video of her single “Born This Way” consisting of a science fiction allegory concerning gay rights.

25768: A look at rapper Fatlip (ex-member of The Pharcyde).

26563: With help from his friends, a Memphis pimp in a mid-life crisis attempts to become a successful hip-hop emcee.

9876: When a soft-spoken detective saves the life of a local gangster, he receives an unusual thank-you present: a week with a beautiful young bartender. They fall in love, however and a murderous showdown looms.

98490: In anticipation of the end of his life, a man leaves his flat in Moscow and comes back to his native land where he was happy and loved.

27739: At the beginning of a nightly Alcoholics Anonymous meeting, Jim seems particularly troubled. His sponsor encourages him to talk that night, the first time in seven months, so he does – and leaves the meeting right after.

3972: When an 18 year-old girl named Joy goes missing, Helen is asked to “play” her in a police reconstruction that may help solve the case. 89310: Man & Woman & Animal shows a woman finding pleasure in herself, the whole film is a kind of assertion and affirmation of female sexuality and its independence from male values and pleasures..

2754: Robert Guédiguian, chronicler of the working class in Marseilles, made a panoramic, committed and gripping sketch of life in the port. A mother is willing to do anything to save her daughter who is addicted to heroin.

339: A surreal thriller from the Master of Suspense. Set in San Francisco, an acrophobic detective rescues a mysterious blonde from the bay and must unravel the secrets of the past to find the key to his future. The pair become trapped in a dizzying web of mistaken identity, passion and murder.

89274: During a sunny Sicilian summer Tanino has a sweet and tender time with Sally, a young American tourist. But when summer is over, Sally flies back to the States forgetting Tanino and her camera.

48394: When the director of an anime production mysteriously disappears, a replacement is brought in to complete the film. He must now absorb all that the old director was in order to complete his work as intended, but as members of the production crew keep turning up dead, all is not as it seems.

113890: Marc is talented, intelligent, eloquent and wealthy but has suffered from an incurable illness from childhood. Each weekend he escapes his everyday haute bourgeois life by travelling the world in search of the ultimate “Don Giovanni” performance.

96536: A magic sword is found stuck into a straw figure. The samurai who finds it keeps cutting at more straw figures to test its sharpness; but every time he slashes one apart, it turns into a human being.

1847: Two hapless individuals who work at a gym find a CD-ROM of a disgruntled former CIA agent’s memoirs and try to profit on their findings with disastrous results.

2630: In this romantic comedy featurette, a vulgar American oyster tycoon decides to find a noble husband for his daughter—a situation that soon spirals out of control.

6826: Second in Hammer Films’ trio of screen versions for Nigel Kneale’s classic 1950s BBC serials, with the same director and star as 1955’s “The Quatermass Experiment”.

28769: A day in the life of a Chicago cab driver is examined as he picks up fares from the good and bad parts of the city and emotionally connects to many of his passengers.

49306: Five sexy cover girls and their photographers break into a gothic castle for a macabre book jacket photo shoot.

92638: Madonna played on the beach with mermen and merchild. In the end she falls in love with one of the mermen.

2884: A strange man known only as the “metal fetishist”, who seems to have an insane compulsion to stick scrap metal into his body, is hit and possibly killed by a Japanese “salaryman”, out for a drive with his girlfriend.

34618: Friends since childhood, a magazine editor and a hip-hop record executive stumble into romantic territory.

56118: Daniel Madigan, a feisty detective with a knack for trouble, is chasing down an escaped murderer and the hood who stole Madigan’s gun.

4033: A look at Brian Clough’s 44-day reign as the coach of Leeds United.

57342: Filmed live during two concerts at Madison Square Garden, this stand-up comedy classic showcases Eddie Murphy in a series of uproarious celebrity impressions, observations about the 1980s, remembrances of his childhood and much more.

30472: Hüseyin is forced to go to İstanbul where he receives the biggest support from his clarinet and later from a bar singer called Firuzan.

11847: A teenage girl finds that she has the ability to leap through time. She tries to use her newfound power to her advantage, but soon finds that tampering with time can lead to some rather discomforting results.
The Girl Who Leapt Through Time

7194: There’s something pretty grisly going on under London in the Tube tunnels between Holborn and Russell Square.

Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa

38527: A schoolteacher becomes the mentor of a talented young miner and seeks to get him into a university.

27301: Two affluent suburban girls who clash with the Latino gang culture of East LA.

Impressionen vom alten Marseiller Hafen (Vieux Port)

The Twilight Zone: A Penny for Your Thoughts

32468: An ex-gambler is lured back into the game by a veteran insurance-fraud investigator.

3019: Belisaire is both a colonel in the military secret service and a past master at … ironing! And Prudence, not very inclined to be the model mother, prefers playing the amateur detective. By the Pricking of My Thumbs

3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain

1048: While on a journey of discovery in exotic India, beautiful young Ruth Barron falls under the influence of a charismatic religious guru. Her desperate parents then hire PJ Waters, a macho cult de-programmer who confronts Ruth in a remote desert hideaway…

129652: Portraits at 125th St and Lexington Avenue in New York City.

14440: A fashionable contemporary art gallerist in Chelsea, New York falls for a brooding new music composer in this comic take on the state of contemporary art.

6029: A woman disguises herself as a child to save on a train fare and is taken in charge by an army man who doesn’t notice the truth.

30795: It is the 2nd film from series about the amusing bear cub and his friends.

52095: The legendary late-1960s Saturday morning cartoon comes to live-action life when Scooby, Shaggy, Daphne, Fred and Velma journey to Spooky Island, where a magical force is awakened that could spell doom for the human race.

He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

37824: When a student dies, his father starts investigating how and why it happened.

34653: Narrative digressions on sex, race, politics, and more from comedienne Sarah Silverman.

582: A desperate woman strikes up a correspondence with a suave, charismatic smooth talker who could be the man of her dreams… or a wicked con artist.

88695: A young man who has committed a ‘crime passionel’ returns to the seaside village where he spent his childhood, spends a few days there, and kills himself before the police arrive.

14524: In an attempt to impress attractive adventuress Diana Emerson (Hillary Brooke), scheming Buzz Johnson (Bud Abbott) introduces his friend Stanley Livington (Lou Costello) as a veteran safari hunter.

36766: Arthur is a happy drunk with no pretensions at any ambition. He is also the heir to a vast fortune which he is told will only be his if he marries Susan. Arthur then meets a girl with no money who he could easily fall in love with.

41620: The little seen but wonderful Love & Basketball comes in a “Platinum Series” DVD from New Line and the results are spectacular. First of all, the anamorphic-enhanced 1.85:1 image is outstanding with rich, well-saturated colors and dark blacks.

The Romance of Aniceto and Francesca

41744: A serial killer, who drains his victims for blood is on the loose in London, the Police follow him to a house owned by an eccentric scientist.

19689: Ace Bonner returns to Arizona several years after he abandoned his family, Junior Bonner is a wild young man. Against the typical rodeo championship, family drama erupts.

19525: James Bond uncovers a nuclear plot when he protects an oil heiress from her former kidnapper, an international terrorist who can’t feel pain.

82925: Drawn together by a mysterious host, four mathematicians wind up locked in a shrinking room and bombarded by a series of tricky riddles. To avoid horrific deaths, the frantic scholars must quickly figure out the link that unites them all.

38874: Lady Snowblood is caught in the politics of 19th century Japan.
Lady Snowblood 2: Love Song of Vengeance

20087: Being a failure as a teacher and a familyman, Shinichi tries to escape everyday live by dressing up as “Zebraman”

45836: When Mammy goes out to the Lucky Seven Saturday Night Bridge Club, Tom invites his three pals- a black cat, a ginger cat and a beige cat- over for a party. Jerry was hoping for a quiet evening, but Mammy saves the day.

24141: Documentary about French philosopher (and author of deconstructionism) Jacques Derrida, who sparked fierce debate throughout American academia.

38408: A wealthy New Yorker leaves her cheating husband and bonds with other society women at a resort.

24360: Tore, son of a poor farmer, loves Berit, daughter of a rich one, but she is promised to another man whom she does not love and whom she refuses to marry.

19660: Newlyweds move into a house where a murder was committed, and experience strange manifestations which drive them away.

44431: Documentary following Susan Tom of Fairfield, California and her 11 adopted special needs children.

22393: When Eun-soo gets lost in a country road, he meets a mysterious girl and is led to her fairytale-like house in the middle of the forest.

24204: A woman, married and with a child but becoming increasingly distant from her husband (who is already cheating on her) reluctantly enters a secret relationship with her neighbor, a teenage boy.

46978: The adventures of a truant schoolboy cycling around the English town of Hartlepool in the north-eastern county of Cleveland.

87898: A mysterious man helps a woman from Pyeongyang escape to Seoul.

102692: A short film by avant-garde filmmaker Paul Clipson.

23265: Kaspar and the class pushover Joosep are 16 and life in high school isn’t easy. Without meaning to, Kaspar defends Joosep against the bullying of his classmates, but every time Kaspar tries to him, it backfires, with the class taking it out on Joosep.

43948: Mickey, Donald, and Goofy construct the ship “Queen Minnie” from folding component parts. When Minnie launches the ship by hitting it with a champagne bottle, she whacks it so hard that, once out at sea, it separates into its parts again.

43450: Rags-to-riches Hennessey meets newlyweds Jessie and Eddie from his old neighborhood. Eddie plots to have Jessie divorce him, marry Hennessey, divorce Hennessey, then bring Hennessey’s money into remarriage with Eddie. His plan goes awry at several points.

21350: “A”, an American film director of Greek ancestry, is making a film that tells his story and the story of his parents. It is a tale that unfolds in Italy, Germany, Russia, Kazakhstan, Canada and the U.S.A.

101981: Bugs and Daffy are vaudevillians competing for praise from the audience. They love Bugs no matter what; just the opposite for Daffy.

86476: An expectant newlywed couple needs to find a new place to rent, and when they visit a creepy apartment, they’re unimpressed and turn it down. But the leasing agent and landlady have other ideas, and force the couple to stay against their will.

47596: One evening after a hard day at the office, Pavel Ivanovich Vasin starts to behave quite strangely to family and friends. He leaves home and for the next 24 hours continues to do strange things, until his granddaughter persuades him to have a good cry, after which he feels much better.

104661: A girl’s obsession with firemen causes her to start a fire at her own home in order to trap a fireman in her room.

32481: In Brooklyn, fishing is the hobby of the workers Jonah Goodwin and Olaf Johnson and they use to fish every night in their old boat. Jonah’s daughter is the twenty-one year-old telephone operator Stella Goodwin, who is an ambitious young woman that dreams on leaving her neighborhood.

29205: A men gets depressed because his girlfriend has dumped him for a friend. He tries to attempt suicide but to no avail, so he decides to scare the guy that stole his girl, by throwing his own guts at him.

7136: Unsettling drama about three generations of Italian-American women struggling to get by in post-World War II New York’s Little Italy.

36547: After serving time for selling pot, Ned successively moves in with each of his three sisters as he tries to get back on his feet. His best intentions quickly bring the family to the cusp of chaos and ultimately the brink of clarity.

5003: The film is the first major picture based on the 1950s controversy that rocked American television and nearly led to the ruination of quiz-show producers Jack Barry and Dan Enright.

4259: Two cabbies search San Francisco’s Chinatown for a mysterious character who has disappeared with their $4,000. Their quest leads them on a humorous, if mundane, journey which illuminates the many problems experienced by Chinese-Americans trying to assimilate into contemporary American society.

29361: The story of a well situated urban family living under a constant shadow of guilt: the mother feels guilt with regard to her children, the father is guilty because of the home help, and the son feels responsible for all living things, particularly abandoned cats and dogs.

108796: In the sleepy Spanish town of Granada, a mild-mannered tailor and secret cannibal unexpectedly finds himself falling in love with his latest prospective victim, in director Manuel Martín Cuenca’s disturbing yet intoxicating tale of bizarre romance.

37679: A Moldavian tale about a shepherd Andriesh who receives a gift of a magic flute which helps him in his journey to the castle of the evil sorcerer whom Andriesh must defeat.

32999: As a brave couple demonstrates, the narrator uses quotes, examples and advice to help us all reach the highest heights in the art of kissing.

36423: Watty has made a living out of robbing convenience stores, but after one of these job turned into murder by his partner, the psychopath Billy Mack, he is on the run with his fiancé Starlene and with both Billy Mack, the police and some loansharks on his trail.

94335: A beautiful housekeeper becomes a romantic attraction to a widower and his three sons.

71100: During the roaring twenties, women became emancipated and dared colour, accessories and tomboy cuts.

873: Michael Redgrave gives the performance of his career in Anthony Asquith’s adaptation of Terence Rattigan’s unforgettable play. Redgrave portrays Andrew Crocker-Harris, an embittered, middle-aged schoolmaster who begins to feel that his life has been a failure.

31442: A man receives a break up letter from his girlfriend. He decides to answer but everything goes wrong.

2062: Juliette is released after having spent fifteen years in prison. She has not had any contact with her family during those fifteen years because they refused to have anything to do with her. Her younger sister, Léa, decides to take her in.

96364: This short relates the history of human civilization with a not-so-subtle message about the inevitable collapse of human societies and the return of nature in the end. Academy Award nominee.

3238: Greasy and unpleasant Arif (screenwriter Cem Yilmaz), a carpet salesman with a sideline in badly staged flying-saucer photos, gets beamed up to a spaceship colony with a male captive population (there’s also a cornrowed, Leia-like princess).

114173: Viviane has been applying for divorce for three years. But her husband Elisha will not agree. His cold intransigence, her determination to fight for her freedom, and the ambiguous role of the judges shape a procedure in which tragedy vies with absurdity, and everything is brought out for judgment.
Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem

35584: A Turkish drama film telling the story of a family dealing with incest, which was selected for the 47th Antalya “Golden Orange” International Film Festival.

31526: A black duckling is rejected by its mother, a hen, but manages to prove his worth when a tornado threatens the hen’s chicks.

917: God and Satan war over earth; to settle things, they wager on the soul of Faust, a learned and prayerful alchemist.

88718: A simple slap provoked a family drama. In this short fiction dating back to 1910, morality was intact but not virtue.

33577: Ricky, a dim-witted ex-con, meets Beth, a dim-witted waitress, in an Idaho diner. They take off in his car to Washington and begin an affair.

2106: Masaki Kobayashi’s mammoth humanist drama is one of the most staggering achievements of Japanese cinema. A raw indictment of its nation’s wartime mentality as well as a personal existential tragedy, Kobayashi’s riveting, gorgeously filmed epic is novelistic cinema at its best.

90397: An Iranian boy goes on a road trip with his deaf relatives after his own parents mysteriously leave in the middle of the night and are killed in an accident.

105968: Film comprised of archive footage shot by foreign photographers and filmmakers while staying in Portugal during the revolutionary years of 1974 and 1975. Featuring the collaboration of Sebastião Salgado, Robert Kramer, Thomas Harlan, Glauber Rocha, etc.

62536: After learning Russian mafia terrorists are plotting to implant thousands of “microbombs” in knockoff jeans and ship them around the globe, Hong Kong-based fashion rep Marcus Ray races to stop them alongside undercover CIA agent Tommy Hendricks.

8281: A concentration camp survivor named Samuel Berg, a preternaturally lucky fellow, runs a European casino. One of his workers is Federico, a man who “steals” other people’s luck merely by laying a hand on them.

19587: Jenna is a pregnant, unhappily married waitress in the deep south. She meets a newcomer to her town and falls into an unlikely relationship as a last attempt at happiness.

107421: An FBI agent and an Interpol detective track a team of illusionists who pull off bank heists during their performances and reward their audiences with the money.

24087: A documentary about the status of handicapped people in West Germany.

87667: Documentary-style series about the era of the dinosaurs, mixing real locations and CGI.

102411: The true story of Oscar, a 22-year-old Bay Area resident who crosses paths with friends, enemies, family and strangers on the last day of 2008.

39844: In this notorious Nazi propaganda historical costume melodrama, a conniving, ambitious Jewish businessman, Süß Oppenheimer, snares a post as treasurer to the Duke of Wurttemburg by showering the corrupt duke with treasure and promises of even greater riches.

102575: Eight super-8 film years condensed into seven eye-popping minutes. A dreamer moves through landscapes to far seas – over tracks, winding roads, skies and waters – a journey of flight and fancy. The animals are watching, the chicks are chasing sunsets and dancing with sharks.

18969: A bright assistant D.A. investigates a gruesome hatchet murder and hides a clue he found at the crime scene. Under professional threats and an attempt on his life, he goes on heartbroken because evidence point to the woman he still loves.

25015: Brecht said drama should always be performed with the house lights up so that that the spectator never forgot he was watching a play. Rappaport wants to remind us how artificial realism is, and how unreal our lives are.

47715: This first movie version of the Tennessee Williams play about a faded, aging Southern belle, her shy, crippled daughter and her “selfish dreamer” of a son more or less sticks to the original story, except for a compromise ending which strives to be more upbeat.

102909: Richard Linklater’s and Lee Daniel’s short, psychedelic film on the Woodshock festival.

33824: Rist’s body is the canvas in this surreal montage.

838: In the first Coen Brothers film, the owner of a seedy small-town Texas bar discovers that one of his employees is having an affair with his wife. A chaotic chain of misunderstandings, lies and mischief ensues after he devises a plot to have them murdered.

114138: Making the most of the family home while her parents are away, Nicole, 22 years old, is enjoying a peaceful summer with her best friend Véronique. When Nicole’s older brother shows up with his band to record an album, the girls’ friendship is put to the test.

32602: It’s 10 PM. The night before Walnut Lake’s neighborhood supermarket closes its doors forever. Ace check-out girl, Jennifer, has a deranged ex-boyfriend who’s fresh out of prison. When he appears outside, weird things start happening. The phone lines are cut, and people start dying alone by one…

3273: A dream job rapidly becomes a nightmare for Amelie, a Japanese-born Belgian woman, who suffers a series of humiliating demotions after she lands a job as an interpreter at a large Japanese corporation.

29086: In arguably his greatest film, Lye reduces the medium to its most basic elements by scratching designs on black film…and synchroniz[ing] the images to traditional African music (a field tape of the Bagirmi tribe).

56095: A newspaper reports live to its readers. In 1920? Impossible? That remains to be seen…

97175: The film is set in a playwright’s sumptuous old mansion in a little village in central France. In the large drawing room, the butler welcomes some friends whom the playwright, now deceased, asked to be summoned for the reading of his will and who all responded to the request…

444: Planted in a Tokyo crime syndicate, a U.S. Army Investigator attempts to probe the coinciding death of a fellow Army official.

2029: Michel plans one last fling before being sent to Algeria on military service. Only slowly does he realise that the girls he takes with him on holiday love him for who he is, not for what he pretends to be.

10440: A few years from now, Earth will have the first contact with an alien civilisation.

1346: After suffering terrible headaches and stomach cramps, Mr. Lăzărescu calls for an ambulance, beginning one man’s hellish journey through Bucharest hospitals in search of proper medical care. One of the first of many fantastic films emerging in recent years from Romania.

135015: A woman hires actors and strangers to pretend to be her friends and family at her wedding.
A Bride for Rip Van Winkle

10958: A young man, his wife, and his incompetent case worker travel across country to find his birth parents. Starring Ben Stiller, Patricia Arquette, Téa Leoni, Mary Tyler Moore, Alan Alda, and Josh Brolin.

33940: A photographer in the rain forest is captured by wild natives, and after months of living with them, he marries the chief’s daughter and helps protect the village from a vicious cannibal tribe.

95040: The film relates the beliefs the author held for a certain time concerning water and diving into it.

89975: After losing contact with Earth, Astronaut Lee Miller is stranded in orbit alone aboard the International Space Station. As life support systems dwindle, Lee battles to maintain his sanity and stay alive. His world is a lonely existence, until he makes a strange discovery aboard the ship.

115206: Featuring her tracks “Body Electric”, “Gods and Monsters” and “Bel Air”, Tropico is a lurid tangle of Americana, with themes of innocence lost, good vs. evil, and trading your body for money.

3317: Early one morning, Marcos observes Juan successfully pulling off a bill-changing scam on a cashier, and then getting caught as he attempts to pull the same trick on the next shift. Marcos steps in, claiming to be a policeman, and drags Juan out of the store.

108515: After a short investigation, the police concludes that the shot that almost killed justice commissioner Constantino Zegarra was in fact a stray bullet. But Constantino, convinced that someone wants him out of the way, re-opens the investigation…

50066: Wide receiver Phil Elliott is fighting to keep his career off the sidelines in this gritty gridiron classic. Elliott has done it all: drugs, booze, playing through injuries. But now he’s asking questions management doesn’t want to answer.

32766: Norman McLaren used a technique he called the “pastel method” in this film. On an 18"X24" piece of cardboard he painted the picture using chalk and pastels, altering the image for each progressive exposure. The entire process took three weeks.

28014: The movie examines the abortion issue through three stories set in different eras – 50s, 70s and 90s.

17545: A prequel to the critically acclaimed television series featuring Jerri Blank, a 46 year-old ex-junkie, ex-con who returns to high school in a bid to start her life over.

15968: In the 1980s, an ambitious young broker is lured into the illegal, lucrative world of corporate espionage when he is seduced by the power, status, and financial wizardry of Gordon Gekko. But he soon discovers the pursuit of overnight riches comes at a price that’s too high to pay.

35707: Based on the true story of the 1981 hunger strike in a British prison, in which IRA prisoner Bobby Sands led a protest against the treatment of IRA prisoners as criminals rather than as prisoners of war. The film focuses on the mothers of two of the strikers.

35663: A circus is in town so Bout-de-Zan (Rene Poyen) decides to sneak off and see the elephant while everyone else is sleeping. Once there he decides the best thing to do would be to steal it and the two then set off for many misadventures.
Tiny Tim and the Adventures of His Elephant

30983: A tyrant from the future creates evil android doubles of Bill and Ted and sends them back to eliminate the originals.

28170: Jacques Prévert cowrote this atmospheric tale of the romantic trials of a tugboat captain, played by the iconic French star Jean Gabin.

48621: Steven Seagal is in fine, butt-kicking form in this action-packed follow-up to his 1988 star maker, Above the Law. This time, a corrupt California politico and his henchmen gun down Det. Mason Storm (Seagal) and leave him for dead.

34845: Gwen’s family is rich, but her parents ignore her and most of the servants push her around, so she is lonely and unhappy. Her father is concerned only with making money, and her mother cares only about her social position. But one day a servant’s irresponsibility creates a crisis.

15470: Ignored by her owners after they have a new baby, a pampered cocker spaniel named Lady leaves her ritzy upper-class lifestyle and meets a charming, streetwise mutt named Tramp.

95288: Troy Billings is seventeen, overweight, and suicidal. Just as he’s about to jump in front of a bus, he’s saved by Marcus, a charming high school dropout/street musician. The two begin an uneasy friendship…

37632: This is not only a sequel to the “Second Heimat”, but also a chronicle of a very decisive decade for Germany (1989 to 200). The main couple of the mini-series released in 1992, Hermann Simon and Clarissa Lichtbau (played by the same actors), reunite after almost exactly 19 years.
Heimat 3 - A Chronicle of Endings and Beginnings

36134: A Chicago mobster hires a rock and roll singer and his band to keep an eye on his daughter during Spring Break in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

92419: The story takes place just after the “Thriller Bark” anime storyline. The plot involves the East Blue under siege by a ruthless pirate named Shiki or “Golden Lion Shiki”. It’s up to the Straw Hats to stop Shiki from destroying the East Blue.

3483: A drama with a two-tiered storyline concerning a mother (Kim Basinger) and daughter (Charlize Theron) who try to form a bond after the young woman’s difficult childhood.

29676: Rolf and Eva, a couple in late middle age, are stuck in a worn-out relationship that has clearly lost its passion. One night Eva tries to seduce Rolf. Although she is unsuccessful, something suddenly happens that completely transforms their relationship.

16327: Radiologist, Gina McVey, has a car crash and loses parts of her memory; further, she believes that her boyfriend, Stefan, is another man. Gina decides to investigate what is happening and unravels a dark reality.

36050: Chan, an articulate senior detective nearing the end of his career, is taking care of the daughter of a witness killed by ruthless crime lord Po. Martial arts expert Ma is set to take over as head of the crime unit, replacing Chan who wants an early retirement.

34001: The friendship between two orphans endures even though they grow up on opposite sides of the law and fall in love with the same woman.

32196: London-based thirty-something Bridget Jones continues her romantic relationship with Mark Darcy, despite many humorous complications.
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

51760: Striving to be independent, the blind but determined Don Baker moves away from his overprotective mother. After settling into his new San Francisco digs, Don meets kooky neighbor Jill Tanner.

2411: After a night on the town, Charlie comes home to the house where he is staying, drunk and unable to find his key. For the next twenty minutes he staggers into, out of, and through the house in an inebriated confrontation with the house itself.

149751: Based on António Lobo Antunes’ real letters to his wife,  it tells the story of the Portuguese colonial war throught the letters between a portuguese soldier in Angola and his wife.

31031: Following a four-minute clinical death from heart attack, Harry Joy (Barry Otto) returns to life finding the certainties of his former existence have vanished.  Harry is convinced he is in hell and it takes an angel in the form of an ex-prostitute called Honey Barbera to return him to bliss.

93993: Snow invites us to contemplate and put into question his chosen medium, in an oscillation between what is represented, its process and material.

35093: When a New York reporter plucks crocodile hunter Dundee from the Australian Outback for a visit to the Big Apple, it’s a clash of cultures and a recipe for good-natured comedy as naïve Dundee negotiates the concrete jungle.

118: When a sprightly teen with a gift-of-the gab falls pregnant accidentally, she chooses a part wistful/part uptight yuppie couple to adopt the baby. With “heartburn radiating to [her] knees” she wonders through a maze of adult decisions.

97429: It’s 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when their all girl group The Sapphires entertain the US troops in Vietnam.

2575: A gabbeh (an intricately-designed rug) recounts the story of the courtship of the young woman by a stranger from the clan.

33104: A series of hazy 8mm vignettes, accompanied by a soft, lilting voice over, in which girls skulk around schoolyards, spray graffiti, drink, smoke, pose and embrace, evoking the loneliness, confusion and overwhelming wonder of growing up.

31155: When Jenny’s husband, a respected psychologist, takes a year off to help raise their daughter, she is totally unprepared for the emergence of his multiple personalities and the fiendish plot to recreate the infamous experiments of his deranged father.

95478: After watching their respective partners die, a cop and a hitman form an alliance in order to bring down their common enemy.

26742: NERV faces a brutal attack from SEELE, but with Asuka in a coma, and Shinji in a nervous breakdown, things soon turn into the surreal. This movie provides a concurrent ending to the final two episodes of the show “Neon Genesis Evangelion”.
Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion

46013: In a border town the famous gunslinger Ringo kills four people out of self defense but is arrested nevertheless. Meanwhile a gang of Mexicans cross the border and rob the local bank. Their leader is wounded when they try to escape and therefore the bandits take refuge on a nearby ranch…

24713: Young lion cub Simba, the heir to the throne of the animal kingdom, is cast out of his pride by his sinister uncle, who leads him to believe he was responsible for his father’s death. Years later, he returns to take his rightful position in this Disney animated musical.

102029: Most of the passengers on an airplane disappear, and the remainder land the plane in a mysteriously barren airport.

22684: The setting is on a floating platform where a group of evenly and carefully placed men live. Each man is aware that the platform is not stable and in order not to fall to their deaths, they maintain a careful balance of weight to prevent the platform from tipping too far and cause them all to fall.

25549: Harry manages The California Dolls, a female wrestling tag team endlessly touring America. He is also romantically involved with one of them. Their fortunes seem on the slide (particularly when Harry accepts an engagement involving mud wrestling!) but then the big grudge match beckons.

39000: A mother falls for a younger man while her daughter falls in love for the first time. Mother Nature messes with their fates.
I Could Never Be Your Woman

26626: Prudence Friedmann, 17, has lost her mother a few days ago. Alone and adrift in the family flat, Prudence meets Marilyne, a high school misfit who introduces her to the illegal circuit of Rungis, greater Paris.

44126: A trio of teenagers find out that a neighborhood house is a living monster and plan to destroy the house on Halloween eve.

27800: A cop chases two young people visiting the English countryside, suspecting them of a local murder….

21997: Story of A Red Sea Crossing. Shot in the bars and seedy hotels of East LA, this film is about the inner life of a prostitute imprisoned for killing her pimp.

24677: An undistinguished province town of the 80’s. After parents’ divorce, 11-year-old Rolanas and his dad move in next door to same-aged Emilija. Friendship is born between the kids, however, shyness or fear of opening-up makes them communicate through the wall.

25781: Gloria is a cleaning lady, hooked on No-Doze, living in a crowded flat with Antonio, her surly husband, a cabby who adores an aging German singer he used to chauffeur; he’s also a forger.
What Have I Done to Deserve This?

38092: An 18-year-old college freshman is seduced by a handsome vampire lover who introduce her to a dark world of carnal desires.

98479: This film is a love story – covering the 42-year and 12-film relationship between legendary actress Liv Ullmann and master filmmaker Ingmar Bergman.

22830: A small group of cosmic explorers, including a woman, leaves Earth to start a new civilization. They do not realize that within themselves they carry the end of their own dream. They die one by one, while their children revert to a primitive native culture, creating new myths and a new god.

119501: A documentary tracing the history of the Academy Awards. The documentary is one of a series of programming events leading up to the TCM 20th anniversary in April 2014. In telling the story of the gold-plated statuette that became the film industry’s most coveted prize.

26892: A tin one-man-band toy tries to escape a destructive baby.

22528: The film is a day in the life of a young artist, Jean Michel Basquiat, who needs to raise money to reclaim the apartment from which he has been evicted.

40228: A lovable but introverted penguin named Hubie sets off on an adventure across the Antarctic to present his betrothal pebble to the bird of his dreams.

20905: On a South Pacific island during World War II, love blooms between a young nurse and a secretive Frenchman who’s being courted for a dangerous military mission.

106243: Three cameramen and a boom operator recorded a scene of extreme violence.

3600: A young field administrator (Montgomery Clift) for the TVA comes to rural Tennessee to oversee the building of a dam on the Tennessee River.

108002: A murdered man reincarnates in the body of a fly, and he will hatch a plan to take revenge on his murderer.

32271: A test pilot is granted a mystical green ring that bestows him with otherworldly powers, as well as membership into an intergalactic squadron tasked with keeping peace within the universe.

10033: Bumbling and conceited French police inspector Clouseau tries to catch The Phantom, a daring jewel thief whose identity and features are unknown – and is acting right under his nose.

2826: Mouna, a divorcee with a teenage son, is an enthusiastic and optimistic Palestinian woman. Deep in the occupied territories, however, daily life is an ordeal. But then one day, she has the chance to leave this life and work in the United States.

29889: IMF agent Ethan Hunt has been sent on a mission to retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically created disease called ‘Chimera’. His mission is made impossible due to the fact that he is not the only person after samples of the disease.

13238: McDull is not the brightest kid on the block, but he continually tries to do his best and please his mother. Although it seems that he may not be destined for great things in life as his mother wishes, McDull never gives up.

1651: In an unnamed Latin American country that closely resembles Mexico, the government fights a rural insurgency with torture, assault, rape and murder. Don Plutarco, his son Genaro and his grandson Lucio, musicians and humble farmers, support the peasant guerilla.

34282: In the slum of Cité Soleil, President Aristide’s most loyal supporters were ruling as kings.

97462: Tradition says that on June 13th, Saint Anthony’s Day – Lisbon’s patron, lovers must offer small vases of basil with paper carnations and flags with popular quatrains as a token of their love.

153: This atmospheric WWII drama recounts the perilous efforts of a group of underground fighters in the French Resistance, which Melville based on his own personal accounts as a freedom fighter against Hitler’s Nazi regime.

32315: Sumarna managed to have the White Crocodile Queen’s talisman. Then, he was cursed from the rightful owner of the talisman, that his children will die 20 years later

94669: A failed police negotiator turned small town cop, must save the lives of a family held hostage, which draws him into a much more dangerous situation.

1735: After being badly burned in a plane crash near the tail-end of World War II, a Hungarian cartographer recalls his tales of adventure, political intrigue, and romance to a Canadian nurse in this Oscar-winning epic.

30344: Trapped in an office building basement, five men reveal their darkest dreams in this compilation of chilling tales pulled from the E.C. Comics archives.

95433: A group of people from various walks of life enter an orienteering course in a wilderness, that not only test their strength and courage, but also their minds and spirit.

12106: Bill is an unemployed writer who has lately taken to following strangers at random on the street. One day, Cobb, a man Bill has been following, catches him in the act. Cobb reveals he has a transgressive daily routine of his own: he is a burgler. He invites Bill to join him.

1499: Jonathan Caouette builds his part documentary, part narrative fiction out of hundreds of hours of old Super 8 footage, VHS videotape, photographs, and dramatic reenactments to tell his terrible family story story and reconnect with with his mentally-ill mother.

11: In a rare male melodrama, a mechanic facing the end of an affair with a married woman wanders across the Italian countryside from the arms of one woman to another looking for satisfaction. Antonioni connects Italian neorealism with the director’s famous works of the 1960s.

28467: Akbar, 18, has been held in a rehabilitation centre for committing murder at the age of sixteen. Now, Akbar is transferred to prison to await the day of his execution. A’la, a friend of Akbar, tries desperately to gain the consent of Akbar’s plaintiff so as to stop the execution.

35374: Having become the face of contemporary French cinema, Mathieu Amalric directed his second feature film in 2001. Jeanne Balibar, who was his partner at that time, plays a woman who travels to Trieste following the trail of a man of literature who never actually published a book.

114783: Angelo Manglehorn is a small town locksmith who never got over the love of his life. Clara was a beautiful, idealized woman who left him heartbroken 40 years ago.

133739: Based on Austin Wright’s 1993 novel Tony & Susan, the story follows a woman whose life is changed when she receives a package containing the manuscript of her ex-husband’s first novel, forcing her to confront the problems in her life.

37241: This stunning short film of world champion freediver Guillaume Nery base jumping underwater into Dean’s Blue Hole will take your breath away.

29759: A Japanese-American fisherman may have killed his neighbor Carl at sea. In the 1950’s, race figures in the trial. So does reporter Ishmael.

4661: A poor girl must choose between the affections of her doting childhood sweetheart and a rich but sensitive playboy.

1981: Jean-Luc Godard’s feature, Moments Choisis des Histoire(s) du Cinema, is a 35mm condensation-cum-summation of his multi-part video series Histoire(s) du Cinema.
Moments choisis des histoire(s) du cinéma

28503: Pat Place plays a creature who lives in an old abandoned barge on a rubbish strewn beach. The mood is post-apocalyptic and the music of Telstar mixed with domestic kitchen clatter.

17052: After her cheating husband leaves her, Mildred Pierce proves she can become independent and successful, but can’t win the approval of her spoiled daughter.

24590: This film looks at the 1950’s muscle men’s magazines and the representative industry that were popular supposedly as health and fitness magazines.

40263: The frozen body of Paul Fournier is discovered in Greenland where he had disappeared during a scientific expedition in 1905. Perfectly conserved he is brought back to life in the 1960s. His descendants take care of him: to spare him the cultural shock they behave so to make believe it’s 1905.

87214: A cheeky female jester uses the smoke of her cigarette to make things appear and disappear. After showing her talents by playing with a chair or a dog, she lets clowns appear; one female, and two male. The male clowns fight each other over the girl who gets changed over and over again by the jester.

41039: Set in a medieval village that is haunted by a werewolf, a young girl falls for an orphaned woodcutter, much to her family’s displeasure.

23739: After his owner relocates, the cat Francis in involved in a series of cat murders in the new neighborhood. Francis tries to solve the murder cases with others – including Claudandus, a very knowledgable and old cat.

24888: Sonic Youth’s first music video features band members on a hot summer day scurrying out of a jeep and into a suburban house where carnage just occurred.

106208: This ‘60s classic documents a once-in-a-lifetime phenomenon, preserving all the fashions, energy and idealism of the first ’alternative lifestyles’. Hippies and flower children dance and create rituals at the historic Los Angeles ‘Love-In’ of Easter Sunday, 1967.
God Respects Us When We Work but He Loves Us When We Dance

44009: Donald lands a job working high steel as a riveter for construction foreman Pete.

61186: Focusing on the day-to-day struggles of two Mississippi gay bars and the grateful patrons who often travel hundreds of miles to find them, filmmaker Malcolm Ingram reveals a surprisingly close community that treats its residents like family members.

38211: Karla Zachanassian (Bergman), a fabulously wealthy woman returns to the decaying village which she had been forced to leave years earlier in disgrace.

24758: A band of medieval mercenaries take revenge on a noble lord who decides not to pay them by kidnapping the betrothed of the noble’s son.

41395: The plot for revolves around a woman whose father commits suicide on the eve of her wedding. The shock of her fathers’ suicide pushes her over the edge.

9660: A young man grows up in Sarajevo in the 1960s, under the shadow of his good, but ailing father, and gets attracted by the world of small-time criminals. They hire him to hide a young prostitute and he falls in love with her

18166: A mentally unbalanced young woman (Parker Posey) flips into a murderous rage when her brother returns home for the holidays to reveal he’s engaged.

9704: A demonic djinn attempts to grant its owner three wishes, which will allow him to summon his brethren to earth.

104091: The Valley of Fire. Oficina Chacabuco. The Calumet Industrial Corridor. From the outskirts of Vegas to the desert ghost towns of Chile – a pinhole travelogue for the world’s end, for what was left behind.

25024: Two women, Zwartjes’s regular actresses Moniek Toebosch and Trix Zwartjes, sit side-by-side on a sofa; they are intrigued by a photo of a mountain landscape. The physical attraction between the two is clearly tangible…

105689: Film narrates about the adventures of the crew of spacecraft Pegas who begins a trip to the far away planets looking for animals for the Moscow zoo. In the travel the crew rescues well-known captain Kim who was a prisoner at space pirates.
The Mystery of the Third Planet

46902: A short trick film by Segundo de Chomón.

38653: Purif, young peasant of the South Italy, is considered from the people a possessed one and a witch. All of the village is hostile to its activity magical and sorceress. The girl will be preserve from the community, undergoing a tragic and violent death.

39409: UA plays Ryo, a young woman who runs a countryside bathhouse with her father. One day she meets a handsome young man called Yusaku who goes to work for her in the boiler room, where he stokes the fires that heat the bath water.

22045: Why Has Bodhi-Dharma Left for the East?

36825: It is 80’s Turkey, local musicians of Adiyaman are hired by the military and trained to welcome one of the forceful generals of coup regime.

111139: A story set between the wars, about the adventures and friendship of a legendary concierge at a famous European hotel, and a lobby boy he took under his wing.

17908: Yaichiro is a warrior who must leave his family after he answers a request for his services in another town.

116390: A woman who studies butterflies and moths tests the limits of her relationship with her lover.

32887: A collection of 6 Napolitean episodes: a clown exploited by a gangster; a pizza seller (Sofia) loses her husband’s ring; the funeral of a dead child; the gambler Count Prospero B. defeated by a kid; the unexpected and unusual wedding of Teresa; the professorErsilio Micci, a “wisdom seller”.

135388: As his wedding day approaches, Ben heads to Miami with his soon-to-be brother-in-law James to bring down a drug dealer who’s supplying the dealers of Atlanta with product.

117266: A freak weather system turns its deadly fury on New York City, unleashing a Sharknado on the population and its most cherished, iconic sites – and only Fin and April can save the Big Apple.

88762: Bas Jan Ader jumps out of a tree.

32757: The Martians invade the planet Earth and begin to attack! Nothing seems to be able to defeat them, even an atom bomb.

To Get to Heaven First You Have to Die

33815: It is the annual meeting for the local football club, yet the entertainment turns out to be not quite what was expected. Johan Renck’s music video for The Knife’s “Pass This On.”

31438: A woman prepares the table to celebrate her wedding anniversary, but her husband encounters some trouble in the streets of Paris.

27392: A single shot of the Empire State Building from early evening until nearly 3 am the next day.

43979: No dogs are allowed on Pete’s train, so Mickey tries to smuggle Pluto aboard with a variety of disguises.

26264: An eccentric British woman picks up a young apprentice hairdresser on a wild night in Paris.

18877: A bitter ex-husband. A put upon Momma’s boy. Both want their respective spouse and mother dead,

2973: A collage of dreams. Garrel made a name for himself with this film as a new Jean Vigo. With Nico (Velvet Underground).

30375: Your tour guide for the night is one drunken man called Scullery. Prepare yourself for the experience of your lifetime as he shows you an average night along a derelict Lancashire road in the 1980s.

118995: After 25 years of a good marriage, Darcy discovers her husband has a sinister secret.

9735: An escaped political prisoner and a stuffy law professor vie for the hand of a spirited schoolteacher.

21889: The film is a semi-autobiographical account of both the radical theatre movements in the 1940s and 1950s, particularly recalling Indian People’s Theatre Association, an important leftist cultural platform of which Ghatak was an active member and relatively calmer Bengal in the latter half of 1950s.
A Soft Note on a Sharp Scale

38220: Set just prior to the French Revolution, the story revolves around Thomas Jefferson, then US ambassador to France, and his relationship with Maria Cosway, the unhappy wife of an unfaithful husband.

St. Claire revives him, but he remembers nothing, and as night falls the animals of the forest sing and praise Francis. It is a love song, but a song of desire and jealousy…

121283: Through the unrelenting winter in the north of Japan, a small group of workers must brave unusual working conditions to bring to life a 2,000-year-old tradition known as sake. A cinematic …

2544: A young boy plants some strange seeds and they grow into a grandmother.

The Light of a Firefly Forest

2938: Almost everybody is going to die very soon.
Attack of the Robots from Nebula-5

97864: An ex-cop now working as a security guard in a shopping mall tries to uncover the secret behind a series of mysterious deaths linked to mirrors.

95951: Two girls witnessed her attempted suicide, and in this film I am attempting to depict the broken state of their psyches.

37197: The Redemption of General Butt Naked

Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
